Aniceta requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business. She has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Aniceta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 49 years old and married with 4 children.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell in her sari-sari store.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 7 years and also earns an income buying and selling scrap materials.

Elsie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 59-year-old married man, living with his wife in Nabatieh. He has worked at selling charcoA. for four years. He used to sell candies and sweets, but he turned to this business since he found out that it's requested a lot in his village.

He is applying for a loan from A. Majmoua for the first time in order to buy extra charcoA. at a good price to store for the winter season sales, making a good profit. Adnan is willing to open a big charcoA. storage area, and he will work hard to save the necessary capitA. to do so.

loans.use: To buy extra charcoal to store for winter season sales.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, 58 years of age, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, a farmer, and is a mother to their four children. One is working as a caretaker of their fruit stand, another one is settled down with his own family, the youngest child is just staying at home and the daughter is already working as a factory worker. By the grace of God at this time, she is working hard to sustain their family needs everyday. 

Virginia operates a fruit and vegetables stand along the road. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines, like pineapples which are grown mostly in the southern region of Luzon. She also sells coconut, a root crop (Ube), papaya, and other Filipino fruit staples. Also in her store she sells coffee, bread, biscuits, and chips for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 370 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruit and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Virginia dreams of being able to give her children a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is married and is the loving mother of her children. She is a well-mannered and conscientious person. She has been involved in fattening pigs for over three years. Her husband helps her with this business, and looks after and feeds the livestock when she goes to the market to buy more livestock. 

She wants to expand her business and maximize her profits in order to provide for her family and place her children into schools. Rosalia wants to obtain a loan in the sum of P10,000 for the purchase of feed and vitamins and increasing turnover. She is grateful to all creditors for their help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a hardworking businessman, aged 26, and he is single. For the last three years, he has been operating a business of selling clothes to earn a living. He also does farming for more income. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pio

texts.en:
Pio has been a farmer for almost 28 years, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is 52 years old and has two adult children. He aims to increase their yield this coming harvest season so that he can earn a higher income to acquire their daily basic needs and save for future emergencies. Despite the hardships of life, he still has the strong faith and determination to become successful someday. 

At this time, he is in need of additional capital amounting to P25,000 to buy seeds, pesticides, fertilizers and pay labor costs required in planting rice. He believes that this loan will help a lot to make an improvement for his business. He hopes that he will increase his yields and income this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, insecticides and pay labor costs for planting rice.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 53 and lives with her family in her own house in the village of Calao, West Santiago. She is thankful because she has been blessed with four grown-up children.

She has a business selling food in front of her house. Her food stall is in an area much frequented by people.  She has been doing this business for three years and she's glad because she is able to generate an income of P40,000 a month. She starts vending rice soup at 6:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening because she has many customers due to the good flavor of her food and cleanliness of her stall.

Erlinda would like to improve her food production business so she is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy  rice, utensils and ingredients for her food production business. This will enable her to continue offering good service to her customers and covering all her household expenses with her earnings. Now she is aiming that someday she will have a bigger and more comfortable stall for her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, utensils and ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is an aggressive businessman, age 54. He is married and blessed with five children. 

For the last 20 years, he has been practicing tea farming to earn a living. Previously, he was employed. He works hard in his business so as to provide for his family. 

In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. 

He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fertilizer. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more business-oriented.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
For the last two years Margaret has been operating a boutique in Oloitoktok town. She is 36 years old and the single mother of four schooling children.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to add stock of trousers, shirts and dresses.

In the future Margaret hopes to expand her business and generate more income in order to buy land.

loans.use: To add stock of trousers, shirts and dresses.

loans.name: Zamirahon's Group

texts.en:
Zamirahon is the leader of this group. She is 55 and divorced. She has raised a daughter and a son. The son works in Russia and the daughter is a teacher at school.

Zamirahon works as an operator in the Kyrgyz Post Office. Her monthly salary is 5,000 KGS. In order to earn additional money to support the family, she also breeds livestock. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase sheep for breeding, fattening and further reselling. 

In the future Zamirahon plans to purchase a piece of land for cultivating agricultural products. She also wishes to build a house for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita, 53, lives in the town of Naguilan, province of Isabela. Elenita works hard to support the needs of her children. Her husband is farmer, and they help each other to achieve their dream for their children.

Elenita is a vegetable vendor. She is asking for a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy different vegetables that she can sell in the community. 

She dreams that someday she will have her own store and provide a better quality of life for her family

loans.use: to buy eggplant, cabbage, squash and beans for her business.

loans.name: Akil

texts.en:
Akil is 40 years old, married and has two children. He is from Iraq.

Akil has been an owner of a juice shop since 2009, where he prepares all kinds of ice cream and juices. He decided to open his shop since he had experience in this field. Akil has a good reputation and his shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting $2,500 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to make a higher profit to expand his shop so he can open a restaurant and get the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his ice cream and juice shop.

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en:
Priscillar is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household items like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces major challenges in the high cost of transportation and fluctuations in prices. Her dream is to become a supplier of household products in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of sugar, cooking fat oil and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, cooking fat oil and maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Nachiro

texts.en:
Nachiro is a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals selling business, selling beans from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also sells fish, which contributes another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans for resale.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
This is Belen, 38, a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Eugenio, a laborer, and is mother to their seven children.  Two are in college, four are in high school and the youngest is still staying at home. 

Belen, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Belen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this, she also earns additional income from a room that she offers to be rented in her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP  41,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Belen hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hailyn

texts.en:
Hailyn is married with 5 children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hailyn is 25 years old and has one child who is in school.

Hailyn has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Hailyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets and other equipments for fishing.

Hailyn has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Hailyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets and other equipment for fishing

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. 

Josephine requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy materials for her furniture. 

Josephine has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials to make furniture

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel is 29 years old and married. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucel is borrowing 22,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and additional pigs. 

Lucel has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from electronic re-loading (cell phone minute sales). 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and additional pigs

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 35 years old, married, and has six children. 

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Mary Joy has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from her business of buying and reselling used materials. 

Mary Joy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a brooms selling business, selling at the market and from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of brooms for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of brooms for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old, married and has six children who are in school.  

He runs a butchery to earn a living. He has been in the business for over 10 years and has employed one person. He does farming to earn extra income for his family. He hopes to grow his business for more income generation.

He has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a bull for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a bull for slaughter.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 30 years old and married with one child. 

Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying & reselling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. 

Melanie has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her charcoal business for seven years and also earns an income from her motorcycle transport business. 

Melanie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock to her grocery store.

loans.name: Bahtygul's Group

texts.en:
Bahtygul is the treasurer of this group. She is 33 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband she is bringing up three daughters and a son. The older daughter studies at university, two daughters are at school and the son is preschool age (under seven). 

In order to earn additional money to support the family, Bahtygul cultivates agricultural products. Bahtygul applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase fuel and to pay for a tractor driver’s services. 

In the future Bahtygul wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and to pay for tractor driver's services.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling maandazi, a doughnut-like form of fried bread popular in the Coastal Swahili areas of Kenya.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Chizi dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, oil, sugar, yeast and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, oil, sugar, yeast and charcoal.

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
This is Novie, 55, a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Lindro, and mother to their four children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Novie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Novie hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. 

Nena has been in this business for five years. Nena earns more income from food vending. 

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past two years, she has operated a farming business, selling green vegetables as wholesale to her neighboring community members. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Nyamvula dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase seeds to plant green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to plant green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for purchasing extra amounts of home and electrical used products to sell.

loans.name: Rebeka

texts.en:
Rebeka is 38 years old, married and has four children. She runs a grocery so as to earn a living for her family. She has been running the business since 2004. She has employed two people to assist her in the business. Rebeka also owns a pick-up which she uses for a transport business to earn more income.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Rebeka has developed her marketing skills through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya. This has helped her to get more clients, hence more income. She has requested 50,000 KES to buy potatoes and cabbages.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Saltanat's Group

texts.en:
Saltanat is the leader of this borrower group. She is 46 and married to an electrician. She and her husband have two daughters and a son.  Her son and older daughter are employed, and her younger daughter is a student.  In order to earn money, Saltanat breeds cattle and sells dairy products.  In this way she contributes 6,000 soms to her family's budget. With money received from this loan Saltanat wants to purchase a bull calf for breeding.  If she is able to profit enough from her business, she wishes to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a grocery-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry hot season the availability of vegetables for supply is lower compared to high demand. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
This is Daisy, 43, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jacinto, a warehouse man, and mother to their five children.  Two are now studying in college. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Daisy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this, she also sells cooked viands and she earns additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Daisy hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 24 years old and still single.She is currently residing in the village of Rizal Santiago. She is hardworking and business-minded person.

Jasmin owns a warehouse wherein she stores the grains she buys from her suppliers. She has been engaged in a "buy and sell" grain business for six years. She's thankful because she is able to maintain her business. Jasmin's goal is to save and continue improving her business. For this reason, she is looking for ways to improve the service she provides to her customers.

To fulfill her goal, she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P40,000 to be use in buying more grains, most especially this crop season. Many customers will sell their grain to her because of the rainy season and typhoons they experience nowadays. She is hoping that she can attain her goal for her business.

loans.use: to be used in her business buying and selling grain.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a house that she rents, which neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighboring community members in the area. She does a fish selling business to add to her income. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in the businesses. Saumu dreams of expanding her businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, salt, sugar and dried fish for resale. Saumu joined Yehu Microfinance to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, salt, sugar and dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 36 years old, married and with three children.  He does tailoring to earn a living.  He has been in the business for eight years and has employed two people.  He also repairs sewing machines so as to earn more income.  Through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in business management skills.  This has helped him to improve his business.

Vincent hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He has requested 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with two children; one attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a restaurant business. Her potential customers are the neighboring community members. Nyamvula dreams of establishing real estate (rental) houses in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is 36 years old, married and has four children. He is from Iraq. 

Since 1989, Moussa has been the owner of a store for rental woodcutting machines and for making and selling wood (lumber) for building. He has more than twenty years of experience in this field and is well-known in his area with a good reputation. 

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to add more wood inventories. He is aiming to make higher profits to buy a new car and to get the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to add more wood inventories.

loans.name: Burulbu's Group

texts.en:
Burulbu is the leader of this group. She is 59 and married to a man who is a retiree.  Six years ago, with an initial investment of 30,000 soms, the family started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening it, the family earns 13,000 soms per month. This profit made them able to build a house in the village and to open a kiosk. 

With money received from the loan Burulbu wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling.  In the future with the profits gained from reselling livestock, Burulbu wants to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 34 years old, married to Francis, and they are blessed with two children. Hellen runs a clinic in Kituluni, Kenya. She has been in this business for the last seven years and earns an income of KES 20,000 per month.

Hellen has got good credit history with KADET and she is applying for her sixth loan of KES 65,000 from KADET LTD which she plans to use to buy modernized equipment and medicine for sale. 

She will use the extra profit to diversify the business. She hopes to own a private hospital. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment etc.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with seven children; five attend school while two have graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighboring community members. Dzame dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and paraffin. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and also paraffin.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old young man, who is married and has one daughter. He lives in Ramallah city in Palestine, where he works in a hair dresser shop. 

Mohammad wants to purchase new home furniture to improve his family's living conditions, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN to pay. When Mohammad gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay to purchase new home furniture and live with his family in healthy better living conditions. Mohammad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing new home furniture.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара умная, добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Она разведена, и она сама воспитывает свою дочку, которая составляет 5 лет. Она  любит свою дочку и старается обеспечить её и выполнит все её потребности и нужды. Гулсара занимается купля продажей муки более 7 лет на местном рынке. Она всегда привозит для своих клиентов высококачественные муки. Все её клиенты ценят её, и всегда приходит к ней за покупками муки. Гусара хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить своего оборотного капитала. Она запрашивает займ на сумме 5000 Сомони для покупки муки. Она надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать её.
texts.en: Gulsara is a smart, kind and purposeful woman. She is divorced and raising a five year old daughter by herself. She loves her daughter and tries to provide for her by fulfilling her needs. Gulsara is in the business of buying and selling flour on the local market for more than seven years. She always brings highest quality flour for her customers. All her customers appreciate her and always come to her to buy the flour. Gusara wants to expand her business and increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to buy flour. She hopes for the support of her lenders.

loans.use: to buy flour with the purpose of expanding business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 48, a resident of Pasay City, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rodrigo, a mason, and mother of three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Zenaida is a "balut" vendor. She sells fertilized duck eggs (balut) which is one of the exotic foods that can be found here in the Philippines. Balut vendors go around the community to offer their product while some have their stand located on the side of streets where people can easily locate them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of the duck eggs that she sells. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Zenaida dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business and also for her business to grow more. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of products for her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old, married and has two children.  He runs a retail shop selling spare parts to earn a living.  He has been in the business for two years and has employed one person.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more business-oriented.  

Peter desires to move to bigger business premises in the future.  He has requested 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy more spare parts.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Nurjamal

texts.en:
Nurjamal is a resident of Kerben, a nice village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 35 and together with her husband, who is a taxi driver, she is bringing up four sons. The two older sons are at school and the other two sons are preschool age (under seven). 

A year ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, Nurjamal started to sell fruits and vegetables. In this way she earns 4,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more fruits and vegetables in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, with the profits gained from the trade, Nurjamal wants to purchase furniture to improve their living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with five children; three attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to neighboring community members. Pauline faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bales of sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of sugar for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a motorcycle transportation business, operating from the market and from home. In addition he sells poultry, which serves as another source of income. He dreams of establishing a retail business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan he wants to start another business of keeping poultry. He will use the loan to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Chumamurod

texts.ru: Чумамурод проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Чумамурод занимается птицеводством. У него у себя дома имеется мини птицефабрика. В этой области он уже пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа кур с птицефабрики города Худжанд.
texts.en: Chumamurod lives in the town of Isfara.  He is 36 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Chumamurod is involved in poultry farming and has a mini-poultry farm at home.  He has been in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of chickens from the Khujand poultry plant.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Nora Grace

texts.en:
Nora Grace has the desire to help her parents improve their standard of living. She is 45 years old and single. Nora is living with her parents who are involved in a farming business. For more than five years, Nora has managed a business raising hogs. Her profit from the business is a product of her hard work and patience. It helps her to meet the daily needs of her parents and herself.

Nora Grace's dream is to expand her business, which is why she continues to work hard. In order to help achieve her dream, she is looking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy feed for her hogs. She hopes that she can realize her dream and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more threads and leather materials

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: Erick is 32 years old, married, and has four children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living for his family. He has been in the business for ten years and has employed one person. He works hard in his business to provide for his family, which includes educating his children. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money. His desire is to open a supermarket in the future. Erick has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar and maize flour

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman who has five children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. Her biggest challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business. Mnyazi dreams of establishing a wholesale vegetable stall in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to establish another business. She wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar to sell in a retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 56, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Felix, an overseas contract worker, and mother to their children. She, together with her children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store selling groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying her stock at wholesale prices and selling by the unit. She also cooks and sells viand, as well as selling school supplies. Her store is adjacent to her house and regular customers include her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Nenita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of having a canteen. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups, composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that meet on a weekly basis. They gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Gulnazi

texts.en:
Gulnazi, 47, is from the village of Ninotsminda in the Kakheti region. She is married and lives with her husband, Malkhaz, and their 24 year old son. Gulnazi and Malkhaz are leading the family agricultural business. They own two milk cows and sell dairy products (mainly milk and yogurt) in the village. The family also grows maize on a 1.2 hectare piece of land, which is sold in the local market as well. 

Gulnazi has requested a loan for sowing wheat. She will use part of the loan to purchase the wheat and part to pay the workforce which will help them on the plot in the cultivation and sowing process.

Gulnazi will sell wheat locally and she will use this additional income for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase wheat for sowing and to pay the workforce which will help her on the plot.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with three children; two attend school while one is still too young. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells shoes, for an additional source of income. She faces the major challenges of theft and the high cost of transportation in her business. Her biggest dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kshs loan, she wants to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
Issam is 40 years old, married and has four children. He is from Iraq. 

In 1995, Issam opened an office for rental compressors and steamrollers. He is experienced in this field and has a good reputation. He is well-known in his area.

He is requesting a $1,500 loan in order to buy a small crane machine. He is aiming to make higher profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a small crane machine

loans.name: Battsend

texts.en:
Battsend, 70, is a pensioner and a farmer. He lives with his two children and his wife on their own small piece of land in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He plants certain kinds of vegetables in his backyard. 

His land is located in the track of flooding water, which is always afflicting his fence and vegetable garden. As he is a farmer, it is a big problem which he should solve immediately. In this case, he has decided to build a small flood protection dam on the side where the flood water comes in. If he builds it, it will be not only be an important creation for himself but it will be beneficial for other households as well.
 
Another purpose for his loan is to insulate the walls of his house as his home becomes cold in winter. It is a useful way to reduce the family's firewood usage and is better for the environment. Battsend's loan will be used to purchase some of building materials needed to build the flood protection dam and to insulate his home.

loans.use: to build a flood protection dam and insulate his home.

loans.name: Ifeniyi 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFENIYI 1 est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Ignace est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ignace est âgée de 47 ans et vit au Bénin.Ignace est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Latifou. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont trois restent encore à leur charge. Ignace n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Ignace vend depuis trois ans des plateaux d'œufs frais. Ignace s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ignace sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFENIYI 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.  Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The IFENIYI 1group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group is Ignace, seen with his hand raised in the photo. Ignace is 47 years old and married to a reseller named Latifou. The couple has five children who go to school. Three of them are still in their care. Ignace never attended school. 

To support himself and his family, Ignace started selling trays of fresh eggs three years ago. He gets his stock at a market in Benin. 

Eager to meet customer demand, and to increase his revenue and profits, Ignace is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other group members. The first two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy trays of fresh eggs for resale

loans.name: Batkhuyag

texts.en:
Batkhuyag, 25, works as a watchman in a public organization. He lives with his two children and his wife in Kherlen, a town in the Dornod province of Mongolia. He has been doing this job since 2008 and this April he bought a car with his savings. When he has days off, he runs a taxi business, earning additional income which is important for the daily expenses of his family.

Now, he needs to build a garage behind his home due to the breakage his car faces in the winter time. Mongolian winters are freezing cold and this badly affects cars. Therefore, Batkhuyag is taking a loan to purchase some building materials to build a garage for his taxi car.

loans.use: to purchase some building materials to build a garage for his taxi car.

loans.name: Othman

texts.en:
Othman is 40 years old, married and has two children.  He is from Iraq. 

In 2006, Othman opened a workshop for selling and repairing spare parts, oils, and wheels for cars. He has gained a good level of experience in this field because he began work at a young age. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to buy an air compressor and two small crane machines. He is aiming to make higher profits to purchase additional items and inventories and to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor and two small crane machines.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 45 years old and is single. She believes that a smile is the best medicine. Despite the challenges in her life, Jenifer stands firm to face them. She also believes that there is a biggest God for a big challenge. She is a kind and helpful individual. 

Jenifer runs a hog raising business – primarily pigs for breeding. She has been in this business for almost eight years. Jenifer needs additional working capital of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy feed and vaccines for her piglets. She will manage her business well to maintain it and earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her piglets.

loans.name: Nonvissi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVISSI est composé de trois personnes qui mènent des activités similaires. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Françoise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Françoise est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Françoise est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par Françoise et son mari. Françoise n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Françoise vend depuis quatre ans des articles divers (conserves, pâtes alimentaires, etc. ). Françoise s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Françoise sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVISSI, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Group NONVISSI is made up of three women who run similar businesses. The leader of the group, named Françoise, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 40 years old, lives in Benin and is married to a man named Jean. The couple has two children to support, who both attend school. Françoise and her husband take care of the various expenses of the household together.

Françoise never attended school. To provide for herself and her children, she's been selling various products (canned food, pasta, etc) for four years. She gets her supplies from one of Benin's market. Eager to meet customer demand and increase her revenue and income, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, together with the other members of the Group NONVISSI.

loans.use: to buy canned food and pasta

loans.name: Kunduzkan

texts.ru: Кундузкан 45 лет, вдова и воспитывает двух детей. Кундузкан по специальности медсестра, но учитывая небольшую зарплату медицинских работников, ей пришлось искать источник дополнительного дохода для своей семьи. После развала Союза, Кындузкан решила начать свой собственный бизнес в продаже детской одежды и обуви, и школьной формы. При стартовом капитале в сумме 500 советских рублей, Кундузкан приложила огромные усилия в развития своего бизнеса и добилась успеха – на сегодняшний день ежемесячный оборот составляет  около 30,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от ее предпринимательской деятельности позволили Кундузкан купить машину  «Фольксваген Пассат». В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса , Кундузкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закуп сезонного ассортимента детских  товаров. В будущем, Кундузкан мечтает купить дом для своего сына.
texts.en: Kunduzkan is 45 years old and a widow  raising two children. Kunduzkan is a registered nurse by profession, but, given the low salaries of medical personnel, she had to seek an additional source of income of her family. After the Soviet Union had fallen apart, Kunduzkan decided to start her own business to sell children’s clothing, shoes and school uniforms. With  a starting capital of 500 Soviet Rubels, Kunduzkan made a huge effort to grow her business and achieved success – now her monthly sales are about 30,000 KGS. The income from her business allowed Kunduzkan to purchase a Volkswagen Passat. In order to develop her business further, Kunduzkan turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” in order to obtain a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to stock up on seasonal goods for children. In the future, Kunduzkan’s dream is to be able to buy a house for her son.

loans.use: to expand her assortment of goods

loans.name: Seboblo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEBOBLO est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de  Franck est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Franck est âgé de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Franck est marié à une revendeuse  du nom de Marie. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  Franck a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Franck fait la maraîchage. Franck mène cette activité depuis cinq ans ennvirons. Franck s’approvisionne en engrais, en insecticides et en graines dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Franck sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEBOBLO, un troisième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
SEBOBLO Group is made up of three persons, who live in the same neighborhood. This is the third time that the group is seeking financial help from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group leader, named Frank, is the one raising his hand in the photograph. He's 32 years old, lives in Benin, and is married to a reseller named Marie. The couple has two children to support, who both attend school.

Frank attended school up to middle school. To support himself and his children, he's been growing fruits and vegetables for five years. He gets his supplies of fertilizers, insecticides and seeds from one of Benin's market.

Eager to meet customer demand and increase his revenue and income, Frank is seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, together with the other member of SEBOBLO Group. Previous loans were repaid with problems.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy canned food, hair extensions and sauce condiments

loans.name: La Joie Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA JOIE est composé de trois  personnes qui pratiquent la même croyance religieuse. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie Andréa Akouavi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marie Andréa Akouavi est âgée de 58 ans et vit au Bénin. Marie Andréa Akouavi est mariée à un certain Basile. Le couple a quatre enfants dont deux restent encore à leur charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Marie Andréa Akouavi mène comme activité depuis cinq ans environs la vente des produits chimiques. A côté de cette activité qui lui génère des revenus, Marie Andréa Akouavi vend des tissus par le système de distribution. Marie Andréa Akouavi s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Marie Andréa Akouavi sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA JOIE, un premier crédit.
texts.en: The La Joie group is made up of three people who practise the same religion. The representative of the group, whose name is Marie Andréa Akouavi, is the lady with her hand raised in the photo. She is 58 years old and lives in Benin. Marie Andréa Akouavi is married to Basil and the couple has four children, two of whom are still in their care. All their children are studying and they live with their parents. In order to provide for her own needs and her children's, Marie Andréa Akouavi sells fabric through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover and income, Marie Andréa Akouavi is requesting a first loan together with the other members of the La Joie group.

loans.use: to buy chemical products and fabric

loans.name: Sainte Marie Agla Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SAINTE MARIE AGLA est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même maison au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Emé Lucia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Emé Lucia est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Emé Lucia est mariée à un hôtelier du nom de Guy. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent encore à leur charge. Emé Lucia et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble aux diverses charges de la maison. Emé Lucia a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Emé Lucia vend depuis six ans des produits cosmétiques et des savons. A côté de cette activité, Emé Lucia vend des tissus. Emé Lucia s’approvisionne dans l'un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Emé Lucia sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SAINTE MARIE AGLA, un troisième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Sainte Marie Agla group is made up of three people who live in the same house in Benin. The representative of the group, whose name is Emé Lucia, is the lady who has her hand raised in the photo. Emé Lucia is 36 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a hotel manager called Guy. The couple has four children, all of whom are studying and two of whom are still in their care. Emé Lucia and her husband live with their children and cover the various household expenses between them. Emé Lucia attended school very little. In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, she has been selling cosmetics and soaps for the past six years. Alongside this activity she also sells fabric. Emé Lucia gets her supplies in one of Benin's largest markets. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover and income, she is requesting a third loan together with the other members of the Sainte Marie Agla group. The previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, soaps and fabric

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Джамшед женат и у них один ребенок, который составляет 2 годика. Он очень добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Джамшед занимается купля продажей хозяйственные товары. Он продает  люстры, шкафы, подставки для обувей, коврики для ванн, подставки для ванн и другие принадлежности для дома. Он является владельцем данного бизнеса, и его мать помогает ему. Он занимается этим бизнесом более 5 лет. Джамшед хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента товара и пополнение оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Jamshed is married and has one child who is two years old. He is a very kind and hardworking man. Jamshed is in the business of buying and selling household products. He sells lamps, dressers, shoe racks, bath rugs, bathtub stands and other household appliances. He is the owner of this business and his mother is also helping him. He has been in this business for five years. Jamshed wants to expand his business and maximize his profits. He wants to get a loan in the amount of $3,000USD to buy a new assortment of merchandise and to increase his working capital.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Safrokhon

texts.ru: Сафрохон жительница города Исфара. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Сафрохон занимается шитьем, она изготавливает мешки для продажи. Торговлей мешков занимается ее муж. Сафрохон в этой области уже 15 лет. Она берет кредит для покупки швейной машинки и материала.
texts.en: Safrokhon lives in the town of Isfara.  She is 43 years old, married and has two children.  Safrokhon is involved in sewing; she makes sacks for sale.  Her husband sells the sacks.  Safrokhon has been in this business for 15 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a sewing machine and materials.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz is from the village Martkopi, Gardabani District. He is 55 years old and lives with his family: his wife – Eter, two adult daughters (24 and 20 years old) and his 83-year-old mother. Nikoloz’s elder daughter is a math teacher and the younger one is an English language teacher. 

Nikoloz works as operator in a local petrol station. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in the family agro business. The family owns one cow. They sell milk locally. Also they have hens and sell eggs. 

Nikoloz requested credit to start up a new agro business. He plans to purchase 5-6 calves, raise them and sell the grown calves by spring at a higher price. The income received from the calves’ sales will be reinvested in dairy farm expansion – Nikoloz will purchase an additional milk cow and increase the family income, as he will sell double the amount of milk.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Eric Lester

texts.en:
Eric is still single, but he works hard to help his parents meet their needs. Eric’s goal in life is to have a stable source of income before he gets married. Eric runs a hog raising business. He also operates a tricycle for passenger transportation to make additional income. 

Eric had difficulties in buying feed for the maintenance of his pigs. His daily earnings from the tricycle business could not buy his pigs feed. For this reason, he decided to request a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed for his hogs. He is hoping for the growth of his business in order to support his parents and have savings for his future.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Sa'ed

texts.en:
Sa'ed is a 25-year-old young man. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a modest salary. Sa'ed has his own business which is raising sheep for the sale of their products. He wants to purchase more sheep but the amount of money he saves from his salary isn't enough to pay for it, so he needs to take out a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. With this loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, Sa'ed will easily have enough money to pay for more sheep. Increased sales from their products will increase his income and lead to better living conditions for him. 

Sa'ed is in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a 21-year-old young man. He is a construction worker and is looking to increase his income to pay for his wedding expenses in the future. Jehad has his own business which is raising sheep to sell their products. He wants to purchase more sheep to raise, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take out a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. 

With this loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, Jehad will buy more sheep and increase sales from their products. This will increase his income and lead to better living conditions for him. 

Jehad is in the photograph.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing more sheep.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda, 52, is from the village of Sartichala in East Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband, Zurab, and their 25 year old son. Zurab works as a baker in the local bakery. Izolda has two cows and she produces approximately 40 kg of cheese per month, which she sells locally to dairy retailers. The family's total average monthly income is 500 Laris.

Izolda has requested a loan for the expansion of her cattle shed. She plans to purchase two additional milk cows in the near future but her existing cattle shed doesn’t allow her to keep more cows. After the expansion of the shed, she will increase the number of cows and double her production and sales of cheese. This will increase her income and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a cattle shed.

loans.name: Rasul

texts.ru: Расул – 32-летний пчеловод из села Оттук (север Кыргызстана). Расул начал заниматься пчеловодством с 2009 года, использовав свой стартовый капитал в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день его пчелоферма с 10 пчелиными семьями приносит прибыль в 20,000 сом в месяц (KGS).  На доходы от своей деятельности Расул расширил свое хозяйство за счет приобретения крупного рогатого скота.  В целях дальнейшего развития своей фермы, Расул обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) для покупки пчелиных семей с ульями.   В будущем, Расул планирует купить машину и жениться.
texts.en: Rasul is a 32-year-old beekeeper from the Ottuk village (northern Kyrgyzstan).  He started his beekeeping business in 2009, using a starting capital of 35,000 som (KGS).  Today, his bee farm with 10 bee families yields a profit of 20,000 som (KGS) per month.  Rasul used the income from his business to expand his farm by buying cattle.  In order to further expand his farm, Rasul requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy bee families with hives.  In the future, Rasul plans to a car and get married.

loans.use: to further expand his farm and buy bee families with hives

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Шариф умный и целеустремленный человек. Он занимается и выращиванием сельхоз культур. Он выращивает пшеницу и кукурузы. Имеет 2 гектара земли для посева и в этом году он посеял там пшеницу и кукуруза.  Он еще занимается откормом скота. Он получает доход от переработки абрикосов и в этом году высушил более 1 тонны кураги. Этот бизнес является семейным и летом все участвуют в сушке абрикоса. На полученные доходы, приобрел корову дойную. Шариф запрашивает займ на сумму 1500$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений и горюче смазочные материалы.
texts.en: Sharif is a smart and goal-oriented person.  He is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He grows wheat and corn.  Sharif owns two hectares of land for sowing and planted wheat and corn there this year.  He is also involved in fattening up livestock.  He received an income from processing apricots and made over a ton of dried apricots this year.  This is a family business, and everyone participates in the apricot drying process during summer.  Sharif used his resulting profit to buy a dairy cow.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and fuel and lubricant materials.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel and lubricant materials

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is a farmer in the Philippines, and is married to a housekeeper and a loving woman. Regie is engaged in the  hog raising  business and his earnings from it go to his children's  education. Recently, Regie has encountered financial shortages in being able to finance his family and business needs.  Hence, he is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs. He believes that the loan will help him survive the financial crisis he has encountered. 

Regie has no bigger dream in life than for his children to complete their education and become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: St Antoine De Padou Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ST ANTOINE DE PADOU est composé de treize personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Zinsi Pauline est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Zinsi Pauline est âgée de 37 ans, et vit au Bénin. Zinsi Pauline est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Etienne. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Zinsi Pauline et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Zinsi Pauline a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Zinsi Pauline mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d'année, la vente de tissus dans un marché du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité qui lui procure des revenus non moins considérables, Zinsi Pauline vend également divers produits (conserves, condiments de sauce, etc.). Zinsi Pauline achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Zinsi Pauline et les autres membres du groupe ST ANTOINE DE PADOU sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The group ST. ANTOINE DE PADOU is made up of 12 members who all live in the same neighborhood in Bénin.  The representative of the group, Zinsi Pauline, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  Zinsi Pauline is 37 years old and lives in Bénin.  She is married to a salesman by the name of Etienne.  The couple has two children, both of whom attend school, in their care. Zinsi Pauline and her husband live with their children.  Zinsi Pauline had very little schooling. To meet her needs and those of her children, Zinsi Pauline has been in the business of selling fabric at the market in Bénin for about 12 years. Along with this work, which brings in comparable profits, she also sells various products such as jams, sauces, etc. She buys her products in Bénin.  This is the first time that Zinsi Pauline and the other members of the group ST. ANTOINE DE PADOU have requested a loan through ALIDé.  This loan will allow them build up their businesses so that they can better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy fabric and various products such as sauces, jams, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials

loans.name: Sodiki

texts.ru: Кодири ответственный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и у них 1 ребенок. Он занимается купля продажей скот на рынке, где продает животных. В месяц он продает 2 -3 коров по сумме 10000 или 12000 Сомони. Прибыль, который он получает, использует для семейной нужды и улучшения уровень жизни. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получать хорошую прибыль. Кодири запрашивает займ в размере 1500$ США для покупки скота. Он заранее благодарен всем, кто поддерживает его.
texts.en: Sodiki is a responsible and goal-oriented person.  He is married and has one child.  Sodiki is involved in buying and selling livestock at the livestock market.  He sells 2-3 cows per month at 10000 or 12000 Somoni.  He uses the resulting profit for family needs and improvement of quality of living.  He wants to expand his business and make a good profit.  Sodiki is requesting a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of livestock.  He thanks everyone who supports him in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes of ladies and children clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer for storing milk

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 25 years old married to Peter and blessed with one child. Jane is a tissue seller in the area of Mwiki Nairobi.She has been in this business for the last year and gets an income of KES. 4,400 per month.

Jane has got good credit history with KADET and she is applying for her second loan of KES.20,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans usse to buy tissues for expansion of her business.She will use the extra profit to build and expand her business.

Jane, who is very hardworking. hopes to increase her business and to rent a premise for it.

loans.use: To buy tissue for sale.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil, who is from Iraq, is 38 years old, married and has four children. The owner of a shop for birds and fish since 2010, he has good experience in this field and enjoys a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area and so has good visibility to the many potential customers passing by.

Nabil is requesting a $3000 loan in order to make cages for birds as well as an an outdoor ceiling, and to purchase more inventory for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to expand his shop in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: in order to make cages for birds, an outdoor ceiling and to add more inventory for his shop.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives in the village of Nasaguri, East Georgia. She lives with her family: her husband, Valerian; two daughters (35 and 28 years old); a son (34 years old) and her 83-year-old mother-in-law. Svetlana’s son and younger daughter work in a local store as salespersons. Her elder daughter works as a barber. Svetlana and Valerian are running the family's dairy farm. They have four milk cows and four calves. Svetlana sells milk in Tbilisi. 

With the requested credit, Svetlana plans to expand the cattle shed. In the near future, she plans to increase their cows, but the existing cattle shed won't allow her to keep more cows. With more cows, Svetlana will be able to sell more milk and increase the income of the family. She hopes to purchase new household goods and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for cattle shed expansion.

loans.name: Mukimakhon

texts.ru: Мукимахон проживает в городе Исафара. Ей 33 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации. Сама Мукимахон занимается выпечкой и торговлей самбусы. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки масла, муки, мяса и лука.
texts.en: Mukimakhon lives in the town of Isfara.  She is 33 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation.  Mukimakhon is involved in baking and selling samosas.  She has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of oil, flour, meat and onions.

loans.use: to purchase oil, flour, meat and onions

loans.name: Mayrambubu

texts.ru: Майрамбубу 58 лет. Она вдова и имеет 10 детей. В 2002 году Майрамбубу начала заниматься откормом и перепродажей скота, использовав в качестве стартового капитала 30,000 сом (KGS).
