На сегодняшний день, благодаря упорному труду и инициативности Майрамбубу, ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 коровы, 2 теленка, 1 лошадь и 32 овцы. Дополнительно, она возделывает 1,8 га земли , где выращивает кормовые культуры. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Майрамбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки коровы и бычков для откорма. В будущем, Майрамбубу , при помощи доходов от кредита, планирует женить младшего сына.
texts.en: Mayrambubu is 58 years old.  She is a widow and has ten children.  In 2002, Mayrambubu became involved in fattening up and reselling livestock, using a starting capital of 30,000 som (KGS).  Today, thanks to Mayrambubu's hard work and initiative, her farm has two cows, two calves, one horse and 32 sheep.  In addition, she tills 1.8 hectares of land, where she grows fodder crops.  In order to further expand her business, Mayrambubu requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy cows and bulls for fattening up.  In the future, she plans to use the profits from this loan to marry off her youngest son.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sainte Victoire 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SAINTE VICTOIRE 1 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Jeanne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Jeanne est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais les trois enfants ne sont plus à sa charge. Jeanne vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Depuis huit ans environs, Jeanne mène comme activité la vente de charbon de bois et de l'huile végétale dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir sans difficulté à ses différents besoins. Jeanne s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Jeanne désire augmenter le volume de son activité. Pour ce faire, Jeanne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SAINTE VICTOIRE 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The SAINTE VICTOIRE 1 group is comprised of three women living in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Jeanne, can be seen raising her hand in the photo. The group is requesting their third loan from ALIDE in order to increase their activity level. Jeanne is a widow and mother of three, all of whom attended school. She now lives on her own, and no longer cares for these three children. For the last three years, Jeanne has been selling wood carbon and vegetable oil in her neighborhood which has allowed her to take care of her needs. She plans to use the loan to purchase more materials and thus increase the volume of activity of her business, as well as catering to client requests.

loans.use: purchase bags of wood coal and vegetable oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more livestock.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comité  llamado San Miguel, se conformó gracias a  la iniciativa de la señora Blasia quien se mostró muy interesada por el programa, organizó a sus amigas,  ya que todas son vecinas  y actualmente cuenta con un total de 12 integrantes. Todas ellas son mujeres de escasos recursos y vieron en la Fundación Paraguaya una gran oportunidad ya que son varios comités en la ciudad que están saliendo adelante.
Este comité se encuentra en el primer ciclo, y están aprendiendo la importancia de trabajar en equipo dentro de un grupo con responsabilidad, honestidad y comunicación.
La señora Blasia se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, dice que este es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que debe de estar muy al pendiente de los animales, para que no se enfermen y cosas similares, pese a esto dice que le trae muy buenas ganancias y que le gustaría poder seguir con su trabajo. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener una granja donde pueda tener todo tipo de animales para criar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de animales, como así también balanceados para los mismos. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Miguel was formed through the initiative of Señora Blasia who was very interested in the program, organized her friends, as they are all neighbours, into the group which currently has a total of 12 members. They are all women of little means and they saw the Fundacion as a great opportunity as several communal banks in the city are making progress.

This group is in its 1st cycle and is learning the importance of teamwork that is honest, responsible and communicative within the group. 

Señora Blasia works in the breeding and sale of animals. She says that this kind of work is very hard as she must keep a close eye on the animals so they do not get sick and the like. In spite of this, she says that she makes a very good profit and she would like to continue in this work. 

One of her dreams is to have a farm where she can keep all kinds of animals for breeding.

She is asking for the loan to buy animals, as well as nutritionally balanced feed for them. She is grateful to the Fundacion for the opportunity this provides her with as obtaining the loan will be of considerable help to her.

loans.use: to buy animals to breed for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Muhas

texts.en: Muhas is 47 years old and lives with his two children and wife in a house in Hovd province of Mongolia. His two children are high school students. His wife helps Muhas to manage the family business. He started his business in 2003 by selling motorcycle spare parts trade. Usually, he purchases second hand motorbikes and then resells the spare parts from them. There is no similar business operating in the town. Thus, his income and business is stable and constant. He is an open-minded person who says, "I plan to sell my truck very soon and contribute to my business." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase new motorbikes for himself.

loans.use: To purchase new motorbikes

loans.name: Kahor

texts.ru: Кахор занимается выращиванием абрикосовых деревьев и имеет питомник. Начиная с февраля и марта, он начинает продавать саженцы, а также летом приобретает абрикосовый сад. В этом году он высушил более 800 килограмм кураги. А также он занимается откормом скота и её продажей. Его сыновья находятся в России на заработках. Ежемесячно они отправляют денежные переводы своим родителям, а Кахор строит дом за эти деньги.  Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и горюче смазочные материалы.
texts.en: Kahor is involved in growing apricot trees and has a nursery.  He starts selling seedlings in February and March and buys an apricot garden in the summer.  He prepared over 800 kilograms of dried apricots this year.  He is also involved in fattening up and selling livestock.  His sons are in Russia for work.  They send money home to the parents every month, and Kahor is building a house using this money.  He wants to obtain a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel and lubricant materials.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel and lubricant materials

loans.name: Amanjol

texts.en: Amanjol is 29 years old and lives with his sisters, mother, wife and daughter in a house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His sisters are college students. His wife works at the local photo studio. He started a business in 2004 selling meat with his sister. In 2007 he started to work at the car body shop that belongs to his brother. His monthly salary was 150,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT). In April 2011 he opened a tire repair center and his business is doing well. In the future he plans to expand his business and open a car repair center. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I want to build a big house for my family." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase additional equipment for his business and increase his turnover capital.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for his business and increase his turnover capital.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is 46 years old. He lives in Vanadzor city with his wife and 5 children: two sons and three daughters. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children, and Andranik is engaged in bee-keeping. He has been  bee-keeping for more than 15 years and he is known in the Lori region as a one of the best honey producers.  Andranik produces high quality honey, so he has many regular customers. 
In early spring, when the flowers are starting to blossom, Andranik moves his beehives to Havlavar village. Bee families stay there during spring and summer months, and in the late summer Andranik transports his beehives back to Vanadzor, where he takes out a large lot of honey. For beehive transportation Andranik rents a truck, and for frames and other parts of beehive transportation he uses his own car. 
Andranik is asking for a 180.000 AMD loan to install in his car equipment for use CNG (compressed natural gas) instead of liquid fuel, because gas is two times cheaper than liquid fuel. 
This is Andranik’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To install in his car equipment for use CNG (compressed natural gas) instead of liquid fuel

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is from the village Giorgitsminda. He is 37 years old and lives with his  wife Nina and two sons (19 and 11 years old).  Their younger son goes to school and the elder one helps his parents on the family farm. 

Zaza runs a dairy farm. He has 4 milk cows. He and Nina produce 80 kg cheese per month and sell it locally. Also he has a car and brings wood from the forest, which is sold in the village. 

Zaza requests a loan for purchasing calves. He will raise them and sell grown calves by spring for a higher price. One part of the loan will be used for purchasing the feed for cows and calves for the winter months. Zaza will spend the profits for purchasing new household goods, in order to make the house comfortable and improve the living conditions of the family members.

loans.use: to purchase calves and feed for calves and cows

loans.name: Tsogzolmaa

texts.en: Tsogzolmaa is 45 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in the Dundgovi province of Mongolia. Her daughter is a high school student. Tsogzolmaa is a single mother. She started her business in 2004 by selling meat. Since then she also began to sell packed coals and second-hand clothes from her house. Also she makes and sells clothes from her house. With her business profits, Tsogzolmaa has purchased furniture and a personal computer. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a open-minded woman who says " Next year, my daughter will study in the university. I want to provide the best possible education and opportunity for my daughter." Tsozolmaa is requesting a 850,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 35-year-old married woman living with her husband and seven wonderful children in Dahieh, Lebanon. She has been an owner of a grocery store since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, and dairy products. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. Her store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers coming in and buying.

Nada decided to apply for a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy new products for her store that she believes her customers will like. This is her second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower; she has a very good loan history. Nada hopes to increase her profits in order to provide a better life for her big family.

loans.use: To buy new products for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase peanuts and chips to sell

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.ru: Фахриддин добрый и ответственный муж.   Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей.  Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В данном бизнесе помогает ему его жена, и они вместе дружно работает. С прибылью, который он получает от данного бизнеса, он использует для нужд своей семьи и для расширения бизнеса. Фахриддин хотел бы получит кредит в размере 2700$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений. Он заранее благодарен Киве и Кива кредиторов за их доброту.
texts.en: Fakhriddin is a kind and responsible husband. He is married and is a loving father of three children. He grows agriculture crops. His wife also helps him in this business and they work together as a team. He uses the profit which he gets from the business for his family needs and for expansion of the business. Fakhriddin wants to receive a loan in the amount of $2,700USD to buy mineral fertilizer. He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their kindness in advance.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: San José Obrero Group

texts.es:
El comité San Jose Obrero está conformado D. 11  integrantes D. la ciudad D. Curuguaty. Actualmente están en el segundo ciclo, y lo han logrado trabajando con responsabilidad y así salir siempre adelante con solidaridad y unión entre todas. Ellas se definen como personas muy trabajadoras, sacrificadas y muy responsables en cuanto al cumplimiento D. sus obligaciones.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Francisca, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que desD. muy temprano empieza su jornada laboral. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo D. productos. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, pues la mayoría D. las personas del barrio van hasta su negocio. Lo que la ayuda en las ventas es su amabilidad para con los clientes. Desea poder ir creciendo paulatinamente y D. esa forma ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. comestibles, bebidas, carne y otros para abastecer su local, con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes. Está agradecida con la Fundación, pues D. obtener el crédito le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Jose Obrero consists of 11 members from the city of Curuguaty. They are currently in their 2nd cycle and have achieved this by working responsibly. As such they always come out in front with solidaity and unity amongst all.  They describe themselves as very hardworking, self-sacrificing and very responsible people in meeting their obligations.

One of the members is Señora Francisca. She is a very hardworking woman whose working day starts very early. She has a store well stocked with all kinds of products. She says that she has a lot of customers as most of the people in the neighbourhood frequent her business. What helps her sell is her friendly manner with the customers. She wants to be able to grow slowly and in this way help her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy groceries, beverages, meat and other products to stock up her store to meet the demands of her customers. She is grateful to the Fundacion as obtaining the loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages, meat and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a quarry site

loans.name: Gbomuma Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the Gbomuma group from the eastern city of Kenema. This group of entrepreneurs have come to SMT to seek a loan of 800,000 SLL each in order to develop their respective businesses. SMT is a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone.

The leader of this group of businesswomen is Mariama. Mariama was born in Bonth, 35 years ago. She is married and has three children who are attending primary school. Mariama has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells rice, onions, sugar, beans, pepper, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy more of these products in bulk to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy rice, onions, sugar, beans, pepper, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old, single, and has three children who are over the age of 18. She is a resident of Kahawa Sukari. Her primary businesses are managing rental houses and keeping poultry. This loan is to help her in her poultry-keeping. She has been in this business for the last six years.

This is her first loan, which she will use to purchase chicks to rear and poultry feeds. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for the children in college. 

Her hopes are to educate her children through college, expand the rental houses, and consistently keep a large number of chickens.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is age 22 and married with three children between the ages of 7 and 3 years. She has been farming for 7 years in her home area of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. Her produce of potatoes and milk goes to the local market. She says lack of finances is the main challenge in farming.

Caroline has made a loan request for 40,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She is optimistic her income will improve and she will be able to meet her family's basic needs with ease. She hopes to complement her maize retail business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 28-year-old college student who decided to help her mother, who is supporting Sanaa and her younger brother since their father passed away. Her mom, Shieha, has been running a small snack and food products store in the neighborhood to support her family, especially their education, for more than 5 years. 

Now that Sanaa is a college student, she decided to give a hand to her mother. She's applied for a loan so she can buy more products for expansion of the store into a wholesale store. Part of the loan will be used for school tuition so she will be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy more products for her mother's store and for school tuition fees.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 6 years. He is 42 years old, married to Lucy, and they have six children going to school. He plans to use this loan to pay school fees for one of his children in high school. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a field officer, and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. In the future, Charles hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura, who was born in 1959 in Koti village, Ijevan area, is a widowed mother of four daughters, three of whom are married and live separately from Laura. Her youngest daughter lives with her and studies at the Ijevan branch of Yerevan State University.

Laura was a cigarette-maker on the state farm for about 18 years. Since 1990, she has engaged in the breeding of cows and chickens, and cultivates land upon which she grows wheat for her family's use. Dairy products and eggs she sells to her neighbors or exchanges them for other products. Thanks to her income, Laura provides for her family's needs, pays for her youngest daughter's education, organized her three daughters’ weddings, and paid for their educations as well.

Laura used her first Kiva loan to buy some piglets for her farm. She is now seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some calves and animal fodder, and plans to spend her increased income on her youngest daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy some calves and animal fodder.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 35, has been engaged in mixed farming for the last 15 years in Nkubu, producing eggs, milk, maize, and cabbage for the local market. He currently employs four farmhands and does welding for additional income.

Peter has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. He says the income will be used to educate his children, who are 13, 10 and 6, and uplift his family's living standards. He is focusing on being the major supplier of eggs and poultry in the area.

Peter says Juhudi Kilimo loans are having a great impact on small farmers, but disease outbreaks and drought are still a challenge to the farming business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en: Mirriam has been operating a tailoring shop for the last 10 years in Emali town. She is 32 years old and married to Joel. They have three children in school. Mirriam was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to buy materials for making dresses, trousers and shirts. In the future, Mirriam hopes to expand her business and diversify into other income-generating businesses.

loans.use: to buy materials for making dresses, trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья замужем, ее дети уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Наталья из Каховки. Там она работает на местном городском рынке в продуктовых рядах, торгуя продуктами питания, а именно кондитерскими изделиями и сладостями. Наталья всегда реализует только свежие сладости по доступной цене. Свое дело открыла еще 6 лет назад. На сегодняшний день у нее товара на сумму 10 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет 6 000 гривен. 

Наталье необходим кредит в 12 000 гривен для приобретения дополнительного количества кондитерских изделий для последующей розничной реализации. Полученную прибыль Наталья планирует использовать для последующего реинвестирования в свое дело, а часть – на разные семейные нужды и обустройство быта.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Natalya is married, and all of her children are grown and independent now.  Natalya is from Kahovka.  She works there at the local city market in the food rows, selling food products, specifically, confectionery goods and sweets.  Natalya always sells only fresh sweets at affordable prices.  She started her own business six years ago.  Today, she has merchandise valued at 10,000 hryvnia.  Her net profit is 6,000 hryvnia.  Natalya needs a loan in the sum of 12,000 hryvnia to buy an additional quantity of confectionery goods for future retail sale.  She plans to invest part of the resulting profit back into her business and use part of the profit for various family needs and living arrangements.

loans.use: to buy an additional quantity of confectionery goods for future retail sale

loans.name: Taron

texts.en: Taron keeps livestock and cultivates land. Taron would like to develop farming, but he doesn't have sufficient financial means. With the requested loan, Taron plans to purchase livestock. Farming development will help Taron to get more income and ensure a sustainable future for his family. Taron lives together with his wife and little son.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
This borrower is 58 years old, married and has two children.

Mahmoud has owned a grocery market since 1985, selling meat, soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is located in an area where they are in need of foodstuffs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for $2,400 loan in order to buy an electric diesel generator for his market and to add more foodstuffs to his inventory. He is aiming to earn more profits in order to have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy an electric diesel generator for his market and to add more food to his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy margi, rice, sugar, bulgur wheat, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado San Roque esta situado en la ciudad D. Curuguaty. Todas ellas son amigas y vecinas D. esa ciudad, que se organizaron con el propósito D. procurar para sus familias unas mejores condiciones económicas. Actualmente se encuentran 11 mujeres dentro del grupo, trabajan dentro del segundo ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundación.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Flora, ella se dedica a la venta D. lencería, trabaja en esto hace ya un tiempo por lo que ya tiene una clientela, la mayoría D. mujeres, bien definida. Comenta que tienen muchas ventas y pedidos con los que debe cumplir. Le gustaría poder seguir creciendo con su negocio, para que D. esa forma pueda seguir manteniendo a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. lencerías para la posterior venta, sabe que D. obtener el crédito, este le será D. gran ayuda, pues con esto podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Roque committee is located in the city of Curuguaty. All the members are friends and neighbors from that city that organized themselves for the purpose of obtaining better economic conditions for their families. Currently there are 11 women in the group. They are working in the second cycle of the women entrepreneurs program of the Foundation.
One of the members is Flora. She sells lingerie. She has been in this business for awhile, so she already has a well-defined customer base, the majority of which are women. She says that she makes a lot of sales and has many orders to fill. She would like to be able to continue growing her business, so that in this way she can continue supporting her family. 
She is requesting the loan to buy lingerie to later sell. She knows that obtaining the loan will be of great help to her as it will enable her to supply and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to later resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rolls of material for tailoring.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
This borrower is 33 years old, married and has five children.

He has owned a grocery store since 1995, selling soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for $3,000 loan in order to renovate and fix his market’s ceiling, walls and floors, and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his market’s ceiling, walls and floors, and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Wallace

texts.en: Wallace is a 32-year-old business man. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last six years he has been operating a hardware store to support his family. He is also a mechanic by profession. Wallace works hard in his business so as to provide for his family. In the next five years he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan for 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy lubricants.

loans.use: to buy lubricants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks by the carton for her business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is a 49-year-old Lebanese widowed woman living with her three children. After the loss of her husband, she had to handle the entire family expenses. So she decided to start her own business to earn income and be able to support her family. She opened a lingerie shop where she sells underwear, nightclothes, etc. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1800 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to further diversify her merchandise selection. She will purchase more underwear and nightclothes as she wants to satisfy her customers' demands. She hopes to expand her business in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear and nightclothes

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a 27-year-old single business man. For the last two years he has been running a motorbike transport business. He has retained his business because of his hard work and determination. In the next five years he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 34 years old, married to Christopher, 42, who works as an engineer. Together they have two children aged seven and thirteen. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. Her primary business is transport along the busy Mulolongo-Nairobi highway where most of her customers are people who work in town. This gives her a monthly income of 4,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

She intends to use the whole amount of the loan to repair her vehicle's mirror. She will use the anticipated profit to pay fees for her children. She hopes to start a transport company through her hard work.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle's mirror.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталия – частный предприниматель из Ивано-Франковска, Западная Украина. Она не замужем, сама воспитывает 5-летнего сына. Наталия работает на центральном рынке, занимаясь розничной торговлей спортивной одеждой, шапками, штанами, а также тапочками и бельем. Она предлагает большой ассортимент спортивной одежды по низким ценам. Сначала Наталия работала продавцом на рынке, а потом решила начать свое дело. В сфере торговли она работает уже 3 года. Ее валовый доход составляет 15 000 гривен в месяц. Чистая прибыль – 5 000 гривен. 

Наталии необходим кредит в 7 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить ассортимент тапочек – 100 штук, 50 штук шапок и 70 пар штанов. Будучи матерью-одиночкой, Наталия старается сделать все возможное, чтобы обеспечить своему сынишке достойную жизнь. Она очень хочет скопить какие-то сбережения и дать сыну высшее образование в свое время. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Natalya is a small business owner from Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine.  She is not married and is raising a five-year-old son by herself.  Natalya is involved in retail sales of athletic clothing, hats, pants and also slippers and undergarments.  She offers a wide assortment of athletic clothing at affordable prices.  At first, Natalya worked as a salesperson at the market and then decided to start her own business.  She has been working in the retail field for three years.  Her gross income is 15,000 hryvnia per month, and net profit is 5,000 hryvnia.  Natalya needs a loan in the sum of 7,000 hryvnia in order to buy a new assortment of merchandise: 100 slippers, 50 hats and 70 pairs of pants.  Being a single mother, Natalya tries to do everything possible to provide her son with a decent life.  She wants to save some money and provide her son with a higher education in due time.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of merchandise: 100 slippers, 50 hats and 70 pairs of pants

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a 29-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with one parent and two siblings. She has 10 years of experience selling perfumes, souvenirs, etc. In 2009, she opened her own store which is located next to her house. Patricia is a new business owner, and she says that today she is applying for a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. in order to strengthen her business. She will purchase a wide variety of new products (perfumes, accessories, souvenirs, etc.) with the intention of increasing her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of new products (perfumes, accessories, souvenirs, etc.)

loans.name: Redemta

texts.en:
Redemta is 41 years old and married to Reuben. They are blessed with three school-going children. She has been in the quarry business for the last year, making a monthly profit of 11,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

She has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD which she plans to use to purchase a wheelbarrow and pay wages.

She plans use the anticipated profit from her business to finish her family's house. In the near future she hopes to expand her business and make her family financially stable.

loans.use: to purhase a wheelbarrow and pay wages.

loans.name: Nejma

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 52 years old, widowed and lives with five family members, all of whom work.

Nejma has been an owner of a food market since 2009 selling meat, soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. Her market is located in an area where they are in need of foodstuffs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in her area.

She decided to apply for a $1,200 loan in order to buy an electric diesel generator and a fridge and to make shelves for her market. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy an electric diesel generator and a fridge and to make shelves for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional painting tools and supplies

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en:
Dismas is aged 50 and married, with three children between 8 and 4 years. He has been in farming for 5 years, producing vegetables and milk for the local market in the Kitale area of Western Kenya.

Dismas has made a second loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES to purchase poultry birds and boost his farming business. He says the income will improve the living standards of his family. He adds that once the poultry business gets stable he will start a dairy business.

He notes that poultry diseases and feed are costly and reduce farming income significantly.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a hardworking business woman and a single-mother of one. For the last seven years, she has been managing a boutique to earn a living. She works hard in her business so as raise her five-year-old child who is in school. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. 

She is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a business woman aged 33. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last 13 years, she has been selling sand soil and building blocks to make a living. She has been able to improve her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. In the next 5 years, she wants to buy a piece of land. 

She is requesting for a loan of 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy sand soil and blocks to sell.

loans.use: To buy sand and blocks to sell.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa is a 31-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has been running a clothing store since 2004. He always presents the newest clothes collections in order to attract more customers to his shop. He is the main income source of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand his store’s inventory for the coming winter season. He says the loan will help him diversify his merchandise selection. In the future, he is hoping to sell shoes by adding a corner in his store for this purpose.

loans.use: to expand his store’s inventory

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
La Señora Arminda es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, ella tiene una despensa muy bien surtida en la esquina mismo del asentamiento de esa ciudad . La misma manifiesta que tiene una muy buena clientela porque tiene casi de todo en su despensa y le trata muy bien a sus clientes. Ella esta acompañada con el Señor Anibal, el mismo trabaja como mototaxista y así se ayudan mutuamente con los gastos que hay en la casa. Dice que uno de sus sueños es poder agrandar su despensa y algún día poder tener un supermercado, con el cual podrá atraer a mas clientes
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas y otros para abastecer su negocio. También comenta que está muy agradecida con la Fundación por haber confiado en su persona porque esta oportunidad que le da la Fundación es muy importante para ella.
texts.en:
Arminda is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She has a well-stocked store on the same corner as the settlement of that city. She states that she has a good customer base, because her store has almost everything and she treats her customers well. Her partner is Anibal. He works as a motorcycle taxi driver, and they help each other out with the household expenses. She says that one of her dreams is to expand her store and to one day be able to have a supermarket, with which she could attract more customers.
She is requesting the loan to buy food, drinks, vegetables and other goods to stock her business. She also comments that she is very grateful to the Foundation for having confidence in her, because this opportunity from the Foundation is very important for her.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, vegetables etc.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a focused business man aged 27 and married. For the last two years, he has been doing vehicle repairs and selling spare parts. He has retained his business because of his hard work and determination. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 45 years old. She is married to James Nyongesa, and has three children aged 14, 18 and 20. For the past 11 years her primary business has been selling kerosene, from which she earns a monthly income of 12,500 KES. 

This is her second loan with KADET, and she intends to use the money to purchase more kerosene.  She repaid her previous loan successfully.  Anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and also to add more stock to the business. She hopes to stock more fuel in her station so as to supply more customers.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more timber to make more furniture to sell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a sales agent in a local company since 2004. His wife, who works in a communication center, helps him pay for the household expenses and especially the children’s education fees. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his daughter’s university education fees. She is studying translation and this is her last year. Hussein notes that his daughter is a very ambitious woman and willing to reach a higher education level.

loans.use: to pay his daughter’s university education fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks (soda,energy drinks, etc.) by the carton for her business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. He started his career at a very young age working in the aluminum industry. Today, he is the proud owner of a small shop with one full-time employee helping him with the work.

Mahmoud is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools and supplies for his business to replace the old ones. He states that these purchases will improve his operation and allow him to complete his work correctly.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and supplies for his business.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a 44 year old business man. He is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. For the last year he has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. He is also employed. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar and cooking fat. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señorita Maria tiene 25 años, es soltera vive en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo. Allí es donde también tiene su negocio, la misma tiene una fotocopiadora y además hace trabajos a computadora.
Manifiesta que le va bien en su negocio porque está muy bien ubicado, pues se encuentra cerca de una universidad por eso cuenta con muy buena clientela.
Además nos comenta que gracias a su negocio está pagando su Universidad, está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de Derecho. Dice que todo el trabajo que hace es por su futuro, ya que hoy en día todo es muy costoso y gracias a su local y su trabajo logra salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintas y artículos de librería, lo cual la ayudará a cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Maria is 25 years old.  She is single and lives in the town of Coronel Oviedo.  This is where she has her business.  She has a photocopier and also produces work for people on a computer.

Maria tells us that she is doing well in her business because it is well placed, near a university.  For this reason, she has very good customers.  She also tells us that, thanks to her business, she is paying for her own university course.  She is in the third year of a law degree.  She says that all the work she does is for her future as these days everything is very expensive but, thanks to her business and work, she manages to get ahead.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy ink and stationery store items which will help her to fill her customers' orders.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they are giving her as the loan will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy ink, paper and other stationery store items

loans.name: Rweida

texts.en: Rweida is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman. She is living with her husband and four school-aged children. She has owned a clothes shop since 2002. She also sells shoes in her store. She cooperates with her husband who works in a local company to satisfy the family needs. With her requested loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will be able to purchase the newest clothes and shoes collection to satisfy all her customers' demands. This will be her third Kiva loan and we note that she has a very good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase the newest clothes and shoes collection

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en: Winifred is a 42 year old business woman.  She is single and blessed with one child. For the last three years, she has been selling clothes to earn a living. She has retained her business through financial training offered by Faulu Kenya. In the next 5 years, she wants to own a boutique. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy vests and socks.

loans.use: To buy socks and vests

loans.name: Nooretet

texts.en:
Nooretet is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Her primary business is farming.  She has been in the sector for the past three years. She learned about KADET through other women registered in her area. 

This is her second loan with KADET LTD. She will use the money to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. She hopes to expand her farming operation and improve her family’s standard of living. She is an industrious woman who struggles to achieve more despite a shortage of resources.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more water by the sack, rice bags, and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 61-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child who is still attending school. He has owned a mini-market in his village since 2007. He sells dairy products, juices, soft drinks, bread etc. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his store’s inventory of food products and groceries. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop and add new foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more food products and groceries to sell

loans.name: Kory Inti Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY INTI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por seis integrantes las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva  a la cabeza de la señora  Yola.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Macrame, venta de celulares, venta de mantas, venta de fruta, taller de carpintería.
 
La señora Yola indica que es el primer año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta fruta, que viene trabajando hace doce años atrás, este oficio lo aprendió de su madre.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) los que compra de la zona el Tejara y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kory Inti" will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer at the Germán Busch central office.  This group has 6 members who are led by a board of directors headed by Yola.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses such as: macrame, cellular phone sales, blanket sales, fruit sales, and a carpentry workshop.  

Yola states that this is the first year that she has been in a Pro Mujer communal bank; she joined the group at the invitation of a loan officer.   She currently  has a business selling fruit that she has been working in for two years.  She learned this business from her mother.

The loan that she is taking now will be used to increase her capital (to buy more fruit.)  She buys her fruit in the Tejara area, and later sells it from her stall.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as best she can.  She is married and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings accounts and the health services.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 38-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has owned a cattle farm in his town since 2001. He works independently on his farm. His work consists of purchasing cattle, feeding them and reselling them to cattle farms, butcheries etc. He is the only income provider of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more cattle for his farm. He hopes that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials such as pipes, bathroom fixtures, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a businessmen from the city of Hato Mayor, an agricultural city surrounded by valleys and mountains. Juan makes his home in a simple structure with his wife and four children. This entrepreneurial man is dedicated to distributing cocoa beans to small markets. He buys them from the farmers. He plans to use this loan to purchase more cocoa beans from the farmers to trade in the main markets or to cocoa producers. 

Juan is excited to be taking his tenth loan with Esperanza after successfully repaying his previous loans and growing his business. He started his business with his first Esperanza loan five years ago. All through the years since starting this business, the lives of himself and his family have experienced change. He will use his profits to support his family and to improve his business. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy cocoa beans

loans.name: Midedji 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIDEDJI 1 est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Cécile, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Cécile est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un carreleur du nom de Mathias. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par Cécile et son mari. Cécile n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Cécile exerce comme activité, la vente des produits divers et des tissus. A côté de cette activité, Cécile vend des produits cosmétiques. Ces activités permettent à Cécile de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Cécile désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Cécile sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIDEDJI 1, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Midedji 1 group is composed of three individuals living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, by the name of Cécile, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Cécile is 37 years old and married to Mathias, a tiler. They have two dependent children, both in school. Cécile and her husband jointly provide for various household needs. Cécile never went to school. To support herself and her children, Cécile works as a vendor, selling fabrics and miscellaneous products. In addition, she also sells cosmetics. This business allows Cécile  to meet the needs of her family and her own. In order to better respond to customer demand, Céclie would like to expand her stock of goods. In order to be able do this, Cécile, along with the other members of the Midedji 1 group is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items, cosmetics and fabrics [fro resale[

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper, some spices, and a carton of used clothes for her business

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: La señora Reina, se dedica a la venta de “pan de Laja” (es un pan especial hecho en la comunidad de Laja, que tiene la particularidad de ser un pan muy sano, con poca sal y sin levadura) tres veces a la semana y también ayuda a sus padres en la elaboración de los mismos. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar  insumos en mayor cantidad como ser: harina, anis, huevo. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la localidad de Laja  del departamento de La Paz,  es soltera y tiene un hijo. Reina se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente pues esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y la tercera a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Reina sells “pan de Laja” (It is special bread made in the Laja community.  It has the distinctive quality of being very healthful, with little salt and no yeast).  She sells it three times a week.  She also helps her parents make the bread.

The loan that she needs is to buy ingredients like flour, anise, and eggs in greater quantity. 

She lives in her parents’ house, which is located in Laja in the La Paz department.  She is single and has one child.

Reina is very happy with the previous loans she was granted.  This is the fourth time she has requested a loan from IMPRO, and it is her third time to request a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy flour, anise, and eggs to make a special bread called "Pan de Laja".

loans.name: Nougbognon 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUGBOGNON 1 est formé de trois personnes qui ont la même croyance religieuse. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Jeanne Oueke Françoise, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Jeanne Oueke Françoise est mariée à Yves, un enseignant et a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux à sa charge. Jeanne Oueke Françoise et son mari supportent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Jeanne Oueke Françoise a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite la couture. Il y a près de neuf ans que Jeanne Oueke Françoise exerce cette activité dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Jeanne Oueke Françoise vend également des produits de mercerie ; ce qui lui permet d'assurer les besoins de sa famille sans grande difficulté. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Jeanne Oueke Françoise n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Jeanne Oueke Françoise et les autres membres du groupe NOUGBOGNON 1 sollicitent ensemble un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Nougbognon 1 group is made up of three people who have the same religious beliefs. The representative of this group, whose name is Jeanne Oueke Françoise, is the lady who is raising her hand in the photo. It is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé and they are doing so in order to increase their business volume. Jeanne Oueke Françoise is married to Yves, a teacher, and has four children, all of whom are studying and two of whom are in her care. She and her husband cover the various family expenses together. Jeanne Oueke Françoise left school at secondary level and then learnt dressmaking. She has been exercising this activity in her neighborhood for almost nine years. She also sells haberdashery products as a secondary activity, which allows her to provide her family's needs without any problem. Customer demand is becoming more and more significant, and in view of her limited means, Jeanne Oueke Françoise is no longer able to meet this demand. In view of this and their limited means, she and the other members of the Nougbognon 1 group are together requesting a loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery products

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La señora Hilda, se dedica a la producción de leche y su esposo es constructor albañil y sus hijos la ayudan con labores agrícolas. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar  dos vacas lecheras para  así poder aumentar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicado en la localidad de Achacachi  del departamento de La Paz. Hilda  es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es la Primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y también en Kiva.
texts.en:
Hilda devotes herself to milk production, and her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  Their children help with the farm work.

The loan that she needs is to buy two dairy cows.  That way she will be able to increase milk production and improve her income.  

She lives in her own house in Achacachi in the La Paz department.  Hilda is married and has two children.

This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to increase the volume of milk production that will be sold later.

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
Bintiali is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Bintiali has operated a tailoring business, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. She also operates a secondhand clothes selling business which contributes another source of income. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Bintiali dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs and improve her standard of living. 

With this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan, Bintiali wants to purchase two bales of secondhand clothes, cloth materials and needles. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of secondhand clothes, cloth materials and needles.

loans.name: Andon

texts.en:
Andon spent most of his adolescence moving to and from different countries, including Chile, Mexico, India, and multiple states in the US. He says that along the way his family was a part of every socioeconomic class, from “third world rich” to “first world poor”. His father built oyster and shrimp hatcheries all over and taught Andon about the customs of Latin America. In 2008, Andon took a journey from Appalachia to Yucatan to learn about how he can contribute to forest restoration- this is how Andon’s non-profit, New Forest Earth, came to be.

New Forest Earth works with community cooperatives in Mexico and Ecuador to bring handcrafted, sustainable goods to customers in the United States. These goods vary from recycled paper journals, jewelry made from plants in the Amazon rainforest, and USDA organic, Rainforest Alliance certified chocolate. The goal of the business is to fund reforestation and indigenous cultural development projects. The organization has a large support group, including interns from universities and even children as young as 12, all trying to raise awareness amongst their peers.

Andon hopes to expand his business across the United States, and with this loan from Accion USA, he will purchase inventory from co-ops, which will allow him to sell more products and in turn contribute to the mission of reforestation. 

Help New Forest Earth raise awareness by visiting the website here: 
http://www.newforestearth.org/

loans.use: To purchase inventory from community cooperatives to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction material for home improvement.

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
African artwork and crafts are Marcel’s specialty. Coming to the US from DRC as a refugee four years ago gave him the opportunity to start his own business. In March 2010, after Marcel worked with a non-profit that produced and commercialized African crafts, he decided to use his connections with African artisans to sell their artwork as a formal business. He purchases the crafts in bulk from Africa or local artists and sells them at shows on the weekend, since he works at another job during the week. Marcel made this dream from his passion as an artist, and his business helps support his wife and six children.  

Marcel is trying to formalize his business and is using this loan from Accion USA to set up a website, which will enable him to sell products on weekdays.

loans.use: To start a business website and purchase artwork in bulk.

loans.name: Amanecer De Patamanta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER DE PATAMANTA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Reina es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, carnicería, costura de chamarras, tejido de mantas, macramé de mantas, compra y venta de ganado, venta de papa.

La señora Reina,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que esta iniciando en la actualidad.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de azucar, arroz, aceite, etc.) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo comercializará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The “Amanecer de (Dawn of) Patamanta” communal bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana office. The bank is composed of 10 members and headed by a board of directors with Reina as president. The businesses that the members of the communal association are involved in vary; among them are a neighborhood store, a butcher shop, making leather jackets, sewing blankets, weaving blankets, buying and selling cattle, and selling potatoes.

Reina reports that this is the 1st time she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution through the invitation of a promoter in the zone. At present, she is launching a neighborhood store.

The loan she will receive is to augment her capital (buying sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc.) which she will obtain from La Ceja and, later, sell in her store. This type of work will allow her to generate resources to help her family. She is married and has 5 children.

When asked what she thinks of Pro Mujer, Reina responded that she likes the office.

loans.use: buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is one of our individual loan borrowers. She operates an underwear sales business. She buys underwear wholesale and sells it to different sellers. Alicia’s family consists of her four children and husband, but her children are already grown, so they are not living together with their parents. She said that her most difficult challenge is to keep improving her business, the economy is really not stable. She loves to work and especially to sell goods.

Alicia started her business after she had the option to start a business or stay alone all day at home. She started selling underwear directly to clients, now she sells to sellers. She took her first loan with Esperanza and started her business. After seven years and 13 loans, Alicia is now running an underwear wholesale business.

With her profits, she is planning to reinvest in her business, buy anything she needs at home and to support her children if they need anything (by saving money for the moment any of her child requests help). She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Missessin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSESSIN est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Alihossi Lucie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Alihossi Lucie est mariée à un carreleur nommé Abel. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leurs charges. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Alihossi Lucie n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a plus de vingt ans que Alihossi Lucie exerce comme activité, la vente de maïs, de boissons et des produits divers dans son quartier au Bénin ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Alihossi Lucie s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Alihossi Lucie désire renforcer son activité, par l'augmentation du stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Alihossi Lucie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSESSIN , un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The MISSESSIN group is comprised of three persons living in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group, Alihossi Lucie, can be is seen in the photo raising her hand. This is the sixth loan the group is asking for from ALIDE, in order to increase their activity level. Alihossi Lucie is married to Abel, who works as a tiler. The couple have six children, all of whom they care for and who are in school. Alihossi Lucie did not attend school. For the past twenty years, she has been selling maize/corn, drinks and other general products in her neighborhood in Benin, which has allowed her to cover the needs of her family. She is asking for a loan from ALIDE in order to purchase greater quantities of products on stock and better respond to client requests.

loans.use: purchase corn and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: La Sra. Irma vive en la comunidad de Pampa el Coscal distante a 40 km de el Torno, convive con el sr. Víctor  tiene 6 hijos ya grandes, ellos viven y trabajan  en su misma parcela, ellos se dedican a la agricultura, siembran maíz, sandia, etc. El crédito que ha solicitado es para la siembra de sandia y maíz y todo lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, toda la familia trabaja junta en la agricultura, todo lo que ellos siembran  la Sra. Irma lo sacan a vender al mercado de el torno, directamente del productor a l consumidor, son una familia muy unida y trabajadora, la Sra. Irma esta muy orgullosa de sus hijos ya que le ayudan en esta actividad muy sacrificada.
texts.en: Señora Irma lives in the community of Pampa el Coscal, 40 km from Torno.  She lives together with Víctor.  They have 6 children who are already grown. They live and work their own plot of land. They are dedicated to agriculture, growing corn, watermelon, etc.  The loan that she has requested is for sowing watermelon and corn and everything that is needed to prepare the land.  The whole family works together in agriculture.  Señora Irma takes everything that they sow to sell in the market of Torno directly from producer to consumer.  They are a hard-working and very united family.  Señora Irma is very proud of their children that they sacrifice to help her in this activity.

loans.use: to grow watermelons.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 35 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They both have three children ages 10 to 20, and all of them are currently in school. For seven years she has been selling charcoal, oil, rice and pepper. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, oil, pepper and rice for her business. She plans to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, oil, pepper and rice for her business.

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité se inició gracias a iniciativa D. la señora Ramona, ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas D. Ciudad del Este y D. allí surge el comité denominado Kuña Marangatu, se encuentran actualmente en el quinto ciclo, con 13 integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, ellas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor y luchador y desean poder crecer más cada día.
Una D. las integrantes del comité es la señora Evangelista, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropas D. todo tipo, con lo cual pueD. mantener a su familia. Dice tener muchos clientes, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos, lo que le sirve para poder los gastos diarios D. la casa. Tiene muchos pedidos con los que tiene que cumplir, además D. eso le gustaría poder renovar la variedad D. prendas que tiene.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. prendas D. todo tipo para el abastecimiento D. su negocio, además D. eso quiere cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ramona got together this current committee.  She contacted her neighbors and friends in Ciudad del Este and created the committee called 'Kuña Marangatu'.  The group are currently in their fifth loan cycle and have 13 members.  This is a group which stands out in their neighborhood for being very united, supportive and responsible.  They have a great entrepreneurial and tenacious spirit and would like to be able to continue growing every day.

One of the members of this committee is Evangelista who sells all kinds of clothes.  This enables her to support her family.  She tells us that she has many customers and so makes very good income.  She uses this income to cover her daily household expenses.  She has a lot of orders to fill and would also like to be able to update the range of clothes that she has.

Evangelista is requesting this loan to buy all kinds of clothes with which to stock her business.  In addition, she would like to fill the orders that her customers make with her.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of clothes to sell

loans.name: Gbenonkpo-Hevie-Zoungo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO-HEVIE-ZOUNGO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Sylvie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est une veuve. Sylvie est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Sylvie n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de cinq ans que Sylvie mène comme activité la vente de condiments de sauce (piments, oignons, etc.) et des tubercules d'igname de façon secondaire ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Sylvie s’approvisionne au Bénin et vend ses produits à son domicile, mais aussi dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Sylvie sollicite pour la première fois un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO-HEVIE-ZOUNGO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The GBENONKPO-HEVIE-ZOUNGO group is made up of 3 people who all live in the same area of Benin. The group´s representative is Sylvie (the woman with her hand raised in the picture). She is 40 years old, widowed and has 4 children, all of whom go to school. She herself has no formal education. She has been selling condiments for sauces (e.g. peppers and onions) and yam tubers as a secondary occupation for nearly 5 years. The resulting income enables her to take care of her needs and those of her children. Sylvie buys her merchandise in Benin and sells it from her home, and her local market. Sylvie and the GBENONKPO-HEVIE-ZOUNGO group are requesting their first loan in order to invest in their businesses so that they can better satisfy customer demand and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of peppers, onions and yams for resale.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel, originally from Argentina, knows the importance of good-tasting meat. In May 2010, he started a business buying “vegetal carbon” from South America and selling it to local supermarkets and stores in Florida. Vegetal carbon is a vegetable-based charcoal, which is 100% natural with no chemical additives. Hear it from him, in his own words: "You can take a piece of meat and bar-b-que it with normal charcoal and it will taste like chemicals and oil. Take that same piece of meat and cook it with natural vegetable charcoal and the meat smells and tastes completely different."

Since Miguel has been in business, he has been actively searching for the best ways to structure the business, where to import from and who to sell to. Miguel hopes to continue obtaining new sales and wants to become a large scale distributor of the product. He will use this loan as initial capital to import large quantities of charcoal and expand inventory.

loans.use: To import charcoal from Paraguay and sell it in the US.

loans.name: Elsa Elisa

texts.es: la señora Elsa es cliente antigua de la institución y solo trabaja con emprender ella se encuentra en su quinta secuencia, la señora se dedica a la venta de diversos productos en una tienda de barrio ofreciendo productos de primera necesidad la tienda se  encuentra en su propio domicilio, ella vive con sus cuatro hijos quienes se encuentran en edad escolar, el esposo se dedica a la construcción en una empresa por la zona sur, son una pareja joven y las actividades que tienen les ayuda a vivir con cierta comodidad, el crédito que ahora solicitan es para la compra de mercadería, ya que por las fiestas de la zona y las de fin de año ella necesita proveerse de mercadería, como refrescos, dulces, regalos, abarrotes, etc. y de esta manera surtir su tienda. Es una persona trabajadora, con ganas de superación desea mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Señora is a long-time client of the institution and works alone in her undertaking.  She is in her fifth loan cycle.  The lady is dedicated to the sale of diverse products in a neighborhood store, offering groceries and supplies.  The store is located in her own residence.  She lives with her four children who are of school age.  Her husband is dedicated to construction in a business in the South zone.  They are a young couple and the work that they have helps them live with certain comfort.  The loan that she now requests is for the purchase of merchandise, since she needs to be supplied with merchandise for the festivals of the zone and those of year end, such as refreshments, sweets, gifts, groceries, etc. In this manner she will supply her store.  She is a hard-working person, with a desire to win.  She wants to improve the quality of life of all of her family.

loans.use: to provider herself with merchandise such as candy, refreshments and gifts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper and oil for her business.

loans.name: Joseline Jeannette

texts.es:
La joven Joseline tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su mamá y sus hermanas.

La clienta se dedica a cuidar niños desde hace 10 años con su mamá, quien le ha enseñado el oficio y le ayuda desarrollar esta actividad.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundacion Campo para ampliar su casa ya que quiere construir una habitación mas. Actualemnte, Joseline y su familia viven en una casa de una sola habitación la cual fue construida por su padre hace ya muchos años. Hace mucho tiempo que Joseline y su mamá han querido hacer mejoras a la casa, pero han invertido lo que ganan el la educación de una de las hermanas de Joseline. 

Con el préstamo, Joseline espera pagar por el techo, paredes repelladas, y piso de cemento para la nueva habitación. Al mejorar su casa Joseline y su familia estará más cómoda, ya que en la actualidad una sola habitación la comparten 4 personas.

En un futuro Joseline espera poder seguir mejorando su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Joseline, 20, is a single young lady living with her mother and sisters.  She has been working caring for children with her mother for the last ten years.  Her mother has taught her this occupation and helps her carry out this activity.

She is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to enlarge her house because she wants to add another room.  Currently, Joseline and her family live in a one room house that was built by her father many years ago.  Joseline and her mother have wanted to do these home improvements for a long time now but have invested their earnings in the education of one of Joseline’s sisters.

With the loan, Joseline hopes to pay for the roof, plastered walls and cement floor of the new room.  By improving her house, Joseline and her family will be more comfortable because currently the one room is shared by four people.  In the future, Joseline hopes to continue to improve her house little by little.

loans.use: to add a room to the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more kola nuts and oil for her business.

loans.name: Libertad San Francisco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LIBERTAD SAN FRANCISCO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva  a la cabeza de la señora  Verónica.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de gelatina, tejido de mantas, tejido de chompa de alpaca, compra y venta de ovejas, venta de verduras, tejido a máquina.
 
La señora Verónica indica que es el primer año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas, que viene trabajando hace años atrás, este oficio lo aprendió de sus amigas.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) los que compra de la feria 16 de Julio y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
The group “LIBERTAD SAN FRANCISCO” is beginning their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Center of Germán Busch.  The group is composed of nine members, directed by a managing board headed by Señora Veronica.  The members of the communal association carry out various businesses, among them we have: sale of gelatin, weaving of blankets, weaving of alpaca sweaters, buying and selling of sheep, sale of vegetables, and machine weaving.  Señora Veronica indicates that this is the first year that she has started a communal association in Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of an advisor.  Currently she has a blanket weaving business, that she has been working for several years.  She learned her position from her friends.  

The loan that is requested now is for the increase of capital to pay for the purchase of wool that she bought at the market on July 16 and that she will later sell in her position at the market.  This form of work permits her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has four children.  

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the meetings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El Señor Fernando tiene 61 años de edad, está casado con la  Señora Maria de 56 años de edad, ellos llevan 35 años de casados y tienen la dicha de tener 3 hijos, todos ya profesionales en distintas áreas tuvo la dicha de verlos convertirse en grandes profesionales gracias a su sacrificio y la de su señora y desea ir trabajando como lo viene haciendo ya que de esa manera brinda empleo a lugareños de la zona.
El Señor Fernando es carpintero hace ya 40 años, fue adquiriendo este oficio gracias a que desde pequeño empezó a trabajar como secretario y después pudo independizarse gracias al pequeño ahorro que estuvo haciendo a lo largo de su trabajo. Además de eso su señora lo ayuda incansablemente en su labor día a día.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas y maderas para la utilización en su taller. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Fernando is 61 years old and married to 56-year-old Maria.  They have been married for 35 years and are lucky enough to have three children, who are all professionals in different fields.  Fernando was lucky enough to see them become professionals thanks to his own sacrifice and that of his wife.  He would like to continue working as he has been doing because, in this way, he provides work to people in his area.

Fernando has been a carpenter for 40 years.  He started working in this trade because when he was very young he worked as a secretary.  He was able to start working independently thanks to a small amount of savings that he managed to make in that job.  Fernando's wife also helps him untiringly in his daily work.

Fernando is requesting a loan to buy tools and wood to use in his workshop.  He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving him because this loan will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools to use in his workshop

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El señor Simón, se dedica a la venta de vajilla; también es rentista jubilado. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital de trabajo ya que sus clientes le piden más variedad en la vajilla que vende y necesita el préstamo para comprar más vajilla y mantenerla a la vista de sus clientes en el puesto de venta que tiene en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive en casa anticretico  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Lazareto en la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene cinco  hijos. Es la primera vez que Simón  solicita un crédito y el flujo de fondos que presenta muestra su capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Simón sells dishes, and he is a retiree with a pension.
