The loan he needs is for working capital because his customers are asking him for a greater variety of the dishes that he sells.  He needs the loan to buy more dishes.  He needs to keep the dishes in sight of his customers at the stand where he sells in the city of El Alto.

He lives in an “anticretico” house. (In an “anticrético” arrangement, the owner leases property for a lump sum deposit in lieu of monthly rent. At the end of the lease period, the money is returned to the renter. If the owner fails to repay the money, the renter gets to keep the property.)  The house is located in the Villa Lazareto area of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has five children.

This is the first time that Símon has requested a loan.  His cash flow shows his ability to pay.

loans.use: to buy different colors and varieties of dishes to satisfy his customers' demand.

loans.name: Carlos Vital

texts.es:
Carlos, es empleado, vive solo porque sus hijos se han trasladado hacia otra zona por estudios, él trabaja ejecutando proyectos, hoy tiene 7 meses en la ejecución de un trabajo.
Actualmente quiere comprar equipo de estudio para sus hijos que les sirva de apoyo para el curso de sus materias, este préstamo le servirá para tener la facilidad económica para la respectiva compra.
La aspiración de Carlos es finalizar la construcción del proyecto, realizarse en su área y estar siempre al pendiente de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos is employed and lives alone because his children have moved to another area because of their studies.  He works carrying out projects.  He has worked on one project for seven months.

He currently wants to buy supplies for his children's education that will support them with their classes.  This loan will let him have the economic flexibility he needs to buy these things.

Carlos's aspiration is to finish his project, to be accomplished in his field, and to always take care of his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies to support his children (like books and a printer).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more lapa for her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora Sonia, tiene 48 años D. edad, nacida en Monteagudo-Chuquisaca, actualmente vive con su esposo en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz ya  hace muchos años que se vino D. su ciudad natal buscando nuevas oportunidades, tiene dos hijas ya mayores D. edad. La señora se dedica al alquiler D. mesas y sillas para eventos sociales también a la decoración D. los salones, es la única actividad con la que se mantiene económicamente. El crédito otorgado a la señora es para la compra D. tela para la decoración D. mesas y sillas. La clienta esta muy agradecida con  la institución por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
Sonia, 48, was born in Monteagudo-Chuquisaca. Many years ago she came from  Santa Cruz looking for new opportunities and this is where she now lives with her husband.   She has two adult daughters.

Sonia rents tables and chairs for social events and also decorates salons.  This is the only business that supports her financially.  She will use the loan to buy cloth to decorate tables and chairs.

This client is very grateful to the institution for their confidence in her.

loans.use: to buy material for decorating

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Mercedes, se dedica a la producción de leche que vende a la Planta Industrializadora de leche PIL y su esposo es profesor. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar una vaca lechera para aumentar la producción de leche y generar mejores ingresos para su familia. Vive en casa propia ubicado en la localidad de Achacachi  del departamento de La Paz; Mercedes  es casada y tiene un hijo. Es la Primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y en Kiva.
texts.en:
Mercedes devotes herself to milk production, which she sells to the industrial milk production plant called PIL.  Her husband is a teacher.

She needs the loan to buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production and generate better income for her family.

She lives in her own house in Achacachi in the La Paz department.  Mercedes is married and has one child.

This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production and generate better income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Estrellas De Belen Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE BELEN” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Maria es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de medias, venta de frazadas

La señora María,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frazadas que viene trabajando desde hace muchos años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de frazadas) que adquirirá del departamento de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y la garantia.
texts.en:
The “ESTRELLAS DE BELEN” [Stars of Belen] communal bank started its first cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Panamericana center. It is made up of six members and led by a board of directors of which Maria is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Amon them, there are: selling clothes, socks, and blankets.

María indicates that this is the first time that she has with Pro Mujer and she joined the institution at the invitation of a member. At present, she has a business selling blankets that she has been working at for several years.  

The loan she will take out is to increase her capital (buying blankets) that she will acquire in the department of Oruro and later sell in her store. This work will allow her to generate income to support her family. She is in a common law marriage and has four children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings and the guarantee.

loans.use: Compra de frazadas

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que tiene gastos escolares, que es pagar las inscripciones y comprar los útiles escolares que son cuadernos, carpetas, libros, plumas y lápices, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero para poder pagar estos gastos que tiene para que sus hijos puedan estudiar este año escolar. 
Doña Maritza trabaja en un restaurante de comida Mexicana con una parte del sueldo que recibe pagar el crédito ya que es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene. 
Desea que sus hijos tengan una buena educación, para que tengan un futuro mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Maritza is s single mother and she is raising 3 children. She is asking for a loan since she has to pay for school expenses and buy supplies such as notebooks, folders, books, pens and pencils. At this time, she doesn't have the money to pay for these expenses so that her children can go to school this year.   

Maritza works a Mexican restaurant and with part of her wages will pay off the loan, since it is her only source of income. She wants for her children to have a good education so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses buying supplies and paying for registration fees.

loans.name: Bendicion Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres D. la ciudad D. San Lorenzo se unieron con la intención D. poder generar mayores ingresos y D. esa forma ayudar a sus hijos y familiares. Ellas se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que diariamente salen a muy tempranas horas para poder empezar su jornada laboral. Desean un mejor futuro para sus hijos, ya que no quieren que ellos pasen por las mismas necesidades por las que ellas pasaron.
Una D. las miembros del comité es la señora Pabla, ella tiene un pequeño copetín donD. venD. todo tipo D. comidas rápidas, como ser empanadas, sandwish, panchos y demás. Dice que tiene mucha venta ya que los alimentos que prepara son muy ricos. Una D. sus metas es tener un comedor donD. pueda seguir alimentando a las personas que acuden a ella.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. carnes, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos necesarios para la elaboración D. los alimentos que prepara. Sabe que D. obtener el crédito, este le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Seventeen women from the city of San Lorenzo came together with the intention of making more income and thereby helping their children and family members.  They describe themselves as very hard-working and tenacious women who go out very early every morning in order to start their workday.  They would like to proviD. a better future for their children as they don't want them to have to go through the same hardships they did.

One of the members of this committee is Pabla who has a small snack bar where she sells all kinds of fast food such as empanadas, sandwiches, hot dogs, etc.  She tells us that she makes a lot of sales because the food she prepares is delicious.  One of her goals is to own an eatery where she can continue feeding people who come to her.

Pabla is requesting this loan to buy meat, vegetables, seasonings and other supplies she needs for making her food.  She knows that this loan will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, seasonings and other products for making food

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: la señora Modesta pertenece al banco Dalias  se amino para tener su crédito individual  se dedica ala artesanía D. aguayos ella los hila en unos telares artesanalmente y después los lleva para coser a la maquina y lo terminan  es muy una persona muy  responsable vive por la zona bajo Llojeta, los aguayos los venD. mas que todo por la ciudad D. Viacha en el alto el crédito lo saco para incrementar su mercadería compra D. hilos ya que por mayor le sale mas barato es viuda sus hijos ya son mayores ya no tiene responsabilidad D. esa parte pero con esta actividad ella sola se mantiene ya que es su único ingreso económico.
texts.en: Modesta belongs to the Dalias bank. She has decided to have an individual loan. She does artisanal crafts, making aguayo cloth. She weaves artisanally them on looms and later takes the fabric to be sewn  and finished on machines. She is a very responsible person. She lives in the Bajo Llojeta area. She sells the aguayo cloth throughout the city of Viacha en el Alto. She took out the loan ton increase her merchandise by buying thread, since buying it wholesale is cheaper. She is a widow and her children are grown and not her responsibility now but with this activity she supports her self on her own and it is her only financial income.   el crédito lo saco para incrementar su mercadería compra D. hilos ya que por mayor le sale mas barato es viuda sus hijos ya son mayores ya no tiene responsabilidad D. esa parte pero con esta actividad ella sola se mantiene ya que es su único ingreso económico.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for her small store: oil, sugar, soap, and sardines.

loans.name: Marvin Roberto

texts.es:
Marvín, vive con su esposa  y sus hijos de 16, 18, 20, él se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando maíz y frijol, su esposa es ama de casa y le apoya en las actividades, actualmente se encuentra con la siembra de maíz.
Necesita de un financiamiento para comprar abono, limpiar el terreno y pagar mano de obra, esta será una gran ayuda para Marvín, quien desea tener una cosecha abundante y sana.
El tiene por objetivo dar los cuidados a su familia, trabajar fuertemente por ellos y apoyarlos para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Marvín lives with his wife and children aged 16, 28, and 20. He does agricultural work, planting corn and beans. His wife is a homemaker and she helps him with his business. Currently she is helping to plant corn. 

He needs financing to buy fertilizer, to clear the land, and to pay laborers. This will be a great help to Marvín who wants to have an abundant and healthy crop. 

His goal is to help his family, to work hard for them, and to help them so that they can succeed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to clear the land, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Kantutitas De San Simon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTITAS DE SAN SIMON” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Martha es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, venta de artículos varios, elaboración de mochilas, tejidos, elaboración de enaguas, elaboración de accesorios de celular.

La señora Yolanda Martha, indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de accesorios de celular que viene trabajando desde hace muchos años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de de accesorios de celular) que adquirirá de la Tumusla y posteriormente lo comercializará en su sitio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y las reuniones con las compañeras.
texts.en:
The communal bank “KANTUTITAS DE SAN SIMON” will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focus on the Pan American Highway. This bank is comprised of eight members and is governed by a board of which Martha is the president. The businesses which the communal bank members run are varied among them. There is: blanket weaving, selling miscellaneous items, making bags and tissues, making skirts, and making cell phone accessories. 

Yolanda Martha says that she's been working with Pro Mujer for one year and that she joined the institution at the invitation of a developer. At this time she has a business selling cell phone accessories that she has been running for many years. 

The loan she will take out is to increase her capital (buy cell phone accessories) that will pay for the Tumusla, and later she will sell it at her business location. This type of work permits her to generate income to help her family, since she is single and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she like the savings and meeting up with the other members.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
María, administra una pupuseria, vive con cuatro hijos y una hermana menor, es madre soltera y sus hijos tienen 14, 12, 9 y 5 años de edad, María se dedica a la venta de pupusas, este negocio lo atiende de 3:00pm a 9:00pm, su hermana le ayuda en la venta.
Actualmente necesita invertir en materia prima como maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, esta compra le ayudara para mantener todo al alcance y poder aumentar la venta.
Su aspiración es mejorar la pupuseria, tener un lugar adecuado, en un futuro ofrecer comida y a través de las ganancias apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María runs a pupuseria (shop selling stuffed tortillas). She lives with her three children and younger sister. She is a single mother and her children are 14, 12, 9, and 5 years old. Maria works selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas), and this business serves food from 3:00pm to 9:00pm. Her sister helps her in the store. 

Now she needs to invest in raw materials like corn, cheese, pork, and oil. This purchase will help her to keep everything in stock and to increase sales. 

Her dream is to improve the pupuseria, own her own location, and in the future to offer meals and through her earning help her children.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, pork, and oil.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo comprar otro vehiculo para la venta de tacos por la mañana y con el cual contrato a otra señora para que le ayude a vender en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en comprar mas mercancía que, dulces, chicharrones, tostadas con chile, refrescos y raspados de sabores (helo molido con jarabe de sabores de frutas), y acondicionar el vehiculo para la temporada de invierno. 
Espera contar con su cooperación en este crédito ya que desea mejorar su negocio y así tener más ingresos para la familia, con el cual planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Patricia is grateful for your cooperation on her previous loan which helped her to buy a vehicle to sell tacos in the mornings and to hire another woman to help her sell in different parts of the city of Nuevo Laredo. 

She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise like sweets, pork rinds, chili tostadas, sodas and flavored shaved ice (ground ice with fruit-flavored syrups), and to do maintenance on the vehicle for winter. 

She hopes to have your cooperation on this loan since she wants to improve her business and have more income for her family, which she will use to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and do maintenance on her sales vehicle.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas es un grupo antiguo que mantiene un excelente comportamiento dentro del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras. El objetivo D. cada D. una D. ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espíritu solidario y mantener la unidad del grupo.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Obdulia, ella se dedica a la venta D. comestibles, tiene muchos clientes pues los platillos que prepara son muy ricos. Comenta que su negocio le produce buenas ganancias y que gracias a esto ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Le gustaría poder seguir creciendo en el ramo y algún día poder tener un local granD. donD. ofrecer los alimentos que prepara. Ella demuestra toda la voluntad para seguir operando con su comité, alienta a sus compañeras a trabajar para el logro D. sus objetivos.
La señora Obdulia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. víveres como ser carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros para la elaboración D. los alimentos. está agradecida con la Fundación por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Unidas' committee is a long-standing group that maintains an excellent record within the 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' program.  The goal of each of the members is to work, encourage a supportive spirit and maintain the unity of the group.

One of the group's members is Obdulia, who sells food.  She has many customers because the dishes she prepares are delicious.  She tells us that her business makes her good profits and, thanks to this, she has managed to get her family ahead in life.  She would like to be able to continue growing in her field and some day she would like to own large premises where she can sell the food that she prepares.  She would very much like to continue working with her committee and she encourages her fellow group members to work to achieve their goals.

Obdulia is requesting this loan to buy food products such as meat, seasonings, vegetables, etc. to make her dishes.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasonings, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
Claudia, vive con su hija de 5 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida, dicho negocio lo tiene en el mercado municipal,  lo atiende todos los días de la semana preparando diferentes platillos para los clientes.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de arroz, aceite, carnes, embutidos, estos productos le ayudaran a mantener una buena disponibilidad para preparar los menús diarios y dar salida a las demandas de los clientes.
Su aspiración es trabajar por su hija, darle lo necesario e ir mejorando para el futuro.
texts.en:
Claudia, who lives with her 5 year old daughter, sells food. She has a stall in the town market where she works every weekday preparing different dishes for her customers.

Currently she needs a loan to buy rice, oil, meat and sandwiches. These products will help her to keep up a good selection for preparing her daily menus and meeting the demands of her customers.

Her goal is to work for her daughter and to give her everything she needs for a better future.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, meat and sandwiches for her business.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 31 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alfredo de 32 años y sus 04  queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Rebeca y su esposo lograron que sus parcelas sean áreas verdes, rodeado de árboles frondosos, pues es ahí donde cultiva plantas de cacao y café, actividad que lo ejecuta durante 10 años, asimismo en este trabajo se apoya de los joranleros que contrata o en ocasiones de la ayuda de su familia. Ell desde muy niña aprendió a labrar la tierra, gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres. Su producto más rentable es la venta de café, porque los vende en cantidad  y a un buen precio, y con las ganancias adquiridas logró comprar muchas utilidades para su hogar. La temporada de invierno no es de su agrado por la abundancia de insectos y precipitaciones de lluvia razón por la cual acude a la entidad Financiera para tramitar un crédito y llevar consigo uno de sus propósitos que es combatir la plaga de insectos y cuidar las florecillas de sus plantaciones. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir sembrando y adquiriendo más espacios de terreno para así sobresalir de la pobreza que convive su familia. Este será su séptimo crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, ya que no quiere causar problemas a la entidad financiera y a los socios de su banco comunal  y agradece a los prestamistas por apoyarle en el progreso de su trabajo. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará insumos naturales para combatir la plaga de insectos que perjudica sus sembríos.
texts.en:
31-year old Rebeca is a loving and hardworking mother. She lives in her own house with her 32-year old husband Alfredo and their four beloved children for whom she wishes to provide a better quality of life.

Rebeca and her husband have succeeded in making their land fertile and surrounded by lush trees. This is where she grows cocoa and coffee, work she's been doing for ten years. She also gets help from time to time from labourers who work on contract. Ever since she was little, Rebeca learnt about the land from her parents.Her most profitable crop is coffee as she sells it in large quantities and for a good price. With the money she earns, she has managed to buy many useful items for the home. 

The season she likes the least is winter because of the number of insects and the large amount of rain. This is why she has approached the institution Financiera for a loan to try to overcome the insect infestations and safeguard the blossoms on the crops. 

Rebeca's plan for the future is to continue farming and acquire more land so that she can overcome the poverty in which her family lives. She does not want to cause any problems for the financial institution or for the members of her community bank. She is grateful to the donors for their help with her work. With the money from the loan she plans to buy natural insecticides to overcome the insect infestations which harm her fields.

loans.use: to buy natural insecticides to overcome the insect infestations which affect her fields

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos,  él está trabajando en una milpa actualmente, ya que aprendió desde pequeño el proceso por medio de su padre, trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Él necesita comprar abono, herbicidas y semilla para realizar la siembra, que a través de un préstamo espera realizar este trabajo.
Su aspiración es contar con lo básico en su familia, para que puedan tener garantizada la alimentación.
texts.en:
José is a farmer. He lives with his wife and four children. He is currently working with corn, as his father taught him this process at a young age. He works Monday through Saturday.

He needs to buy fertilizer, weed-killer and seeds for the sowing season, so he has requested a loan so that he can carry out this work.

He aspires is to provide the basic needs for his family and guarantee their food supply.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed-killer and seeds.

loans.name: Laura Maria

texts.es:
La señora Laura tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Concepción con su marido Walter quien se recibió como radiólogo, pero que no ejerce su profesión. La pareja tiene un hijo y otro que esta en camino.
La señora Laura y su marido habían viajado a España para buscar mejores futuros, según cuenta la señora esos tres años que estuvo trabajando en España fueron días y días de arduo trabajo y añoranza. Tres años después regresaron e iniciaron un negocio en su propia casa. Ella tiene una tienda donde vende todo de artículos, como comestibles, bebidas y otros de primera necesidad. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos, mediante los cuales puede ayudar a su familia. El mayor deseo de la señora es que sus hijos cuando crezcan estudien para que puedan ejercer una profesión y que no pasen lo que sus padres tuvieron que pasar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Está esperanzada con el crédito, pues de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Laura is 27 years old and lives in the city of Concepción with her husband Walter who is trained as a radiologist but doesn't work in his profession.  The couple have one child and another on the way.

Laura and her husband traveled to Spain in search of a better future.  Laura tells us that the three years she spent working in Spain were days and days of hard work and homesickness.  Three years later, they returned home and started a business in their own house.  Laura has a store where she sells all sorts of goods such as food, drinks and other basic household products.  She says that she has good customers and this makes her very good income with which she is able to help her family.  Laura's biggest wish is for her children to study when they grow up so that they can work in a profession and not have to go through what their parents went through.

Laura is requesting this loan to buy drinks with which to stock her store and meet her customer demand.  She is hopeful about this loan as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy drinks to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Tony

texts.es: Tony, de 22 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida y por ello se esmera a diario. Tony es locutor de la radio "Amistad" que se encuentra en el poblado de Santa Rosa (Dentro de la selva Ayacuchana. En la vida de tony, la locución es su principal fuente de ingresos y por lo cual se ha dedicado todo su vida. Su esfuerzo se ha visto recompensado, ya que es la principal radio de la ciudad de Santa Rosa y la más sintonizada, lo cual ha hecho que este negocio le sea muy rentable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es programar música y monitorear que los programas que se transmiten en la radio tengan el contenido adecuado, lleva 03 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer dentro de la radio por casi 12 horas diarias, lo cual lo fatiga mucho. Espera seguir creciendo con este negocio ya que es de su vocación. Este será su quinto crédito con MFP y se compromete a aportar sus pagos en la fecha indicada, ya que desea acceder a otros prestamos posteriormente y esta muy seguro de que contará con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir prosperando. Tony solicita el crédito para  mejorar las instalaciones de su espacio radial, muebles y materiales de construcción, para brindarles una mejor comodidad a los visitantes de la radio.
texts.en:
22-year old Tony is a straightforward and hardworking young man. He lives alone in his own house; his greatest wish is to get ahead in life so he makes a great effort every day.

He is a presenter for Radio 'Amistad', a station found in the community of Santa Rosa in the Ayacuchana rainforest. This work is his main source of income so he has dedicated his life to doing it well. His efforts have paid off as this is the main station for Santa Rosa and the most listened to. As a result he earns a good income from his work. He most enjoys programming music and monitoring the programs to ensure that they have suitable content. He's been doing this job for three years. The most difficult part is being at the radio station for almost twelve hours every day--it's very tiring.

Tony hopes to continue expanding the business since he considers it his vocation. This will be his fifth loan with MFP, and he promises to repay it according to the schedule as he wishes to access more loans in the future. He is sure that he can count on the support of donors so he can continue to prosper. The money from the loan will be used to improve the station's facilities, and to buy furniture and construction material to provide more comfort for visitors.

loans.use: to buy furniture and construction materials for his radio station

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Raúl le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar la materia que es cemento, arena, pintura especial para el exterior y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora. Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder mejorar la vivienda de su familia y así estar mas seguros, protegidos y evitar enfermedades. 
Don Raúl es empleado de un taller que se dedican a realizar trabajos de herrería, como soldador, con una parte de este sueldo planea pagar el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene su familia, su esposa la señora  Sandra de dedica al cuidado de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Raul is having the outside of his house finished off.

He has requested a loan to buy cement, sand and special paint for the exterior, and to pay the person who will be doing the work. With the money needed to improve the family home, his family will be safer, better protected and better able to avoid illnesses.

Raul works as a welder in a blacksmith's workshop.  He will use part of his salary to pay back the loan, as he is the breadwinner for his family. His wife, Sandra, looks after their young child.

loans.use: to finish off the outside of his house.

loans.name: Patricia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Patricia, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, vive con su esposo y una hija, ambos trabajan, el negocio D. Patricia lo aprendió junto a su madre, ya que también es comerciante, no tiene un horario estable ya que todo depenD. D. la demanda.
Ella necesita comprar ropa interior D. dama y caballeros, para niños y niñas, también ropa casual como blusas y faldas,  la inversión le ayudara para atender mejor la demanda D. los clientes.
Su aspiración es que el negocio crezca a través D. préstamo, apoyando a su hija y su esposo en las necesidades que se presenten.
texts.en:
Patricia earns her living by selling clothing. She lives with her husband and a daughter, both of whom work. She learned the business from her mother who is also a businesswoman. She doesn't have a fixed schedule as it all depends on orders.

Patricia wishes to buy men's, women's, and children's underwear as well as casual clothing such as blouses and skirts. The investment will help her better respond to the demands of her customers.

In the future she hopes to see her business grow as a result of the loan so she can help her daughter and husband with any needs that arise.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's, and children's underwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of maize to make Fante kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Santísima Trinidad Group

texts.es:
El comité Santísima Trinidad nace con la firme intención de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus integrantes, ellas se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras, emprendedoras y con visión. Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación. El grupo está integrado actualmente por 13 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción.
una de las miembros es la señora Cristina, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas, ya sea de sport, de vestir y demás. Gracias a su trabajo ella puede obtener los medios necesarios para enfrentar los gastos diarios de la casa. Tiene como objetivo seguir creciendo y convertirse en una gran comerciante. Dice que todo lo que ella hace es por darle a su familia lo mejor.
Ella pide es crédito para poder abastecerse con más prendas y de esa forma hacer frente a los pedidos que tiene, pues no desea defraudar a sus clientes. Está esperanzada en crédito, pues de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The 'Santísima Trinidad' committee was born with the firm intention of improving the quality of life of its members who describe themselves as very hard-working, entrepreneurial women with vision.  They long for a better future for their children and, for this reason, they work doubly hard in order to provide them with the materials they need for their development and education.  The group currently has thirteen members (all women) from the city of Asunción.

One of the members of this group is Cristina who sells clothes (sports clothes, dress clothes and others).  Thanks to her work, she is able to make the income she needs to cover her household's daily expenses.  Her goal is to continue growing and become an important saleswoman.  She says that everything she does is done so that she can provide her family with the best.

Cristina is requesting a loan to stock her business with more clothes.  This will enable her to fill the orders that she has as she doesn't want to let down her customers.  She is hopeful about this loan as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Julia Esperanza

texts.es:
Julia, vive con una hija D. 19 años D. edad, administra una tienda donD. ofrece artículos D. primera necesidad, ella tiene 20 años D. estar administrando el negocio, este surgió por iniciativa propia y con el apoyo D. su esposo, el horario es D. 7:00am a 7:00pm.
Actualmente necesita comprar mercadería como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, pan y huevos, esta inversión aumentara el inventario y mejorara la atención a los clientes.
Su aspiración es que el negocio sea cada día más rentable, que se pueda sostener y brindar lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Julia lives with a 19 year old daughter and runs a shop offering basic products. She has been running the business for 20 years and it was her own initiative with the support of her husband. The shop is open from 7am to 7pm.
Currently she needs to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, bread and eggs. This investment will increase her stock and improve her customer service.
Her ambition is for her business to be more profitable every day, to allow her to support herself and afford what her family needs.

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, bread and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cassava to make gari.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 54 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 02 hijos, a quienes les brinda todo su apoyo. Victoria es responsable y trabaja con mucho esmero para sobresalir adelante; pues ella cultiva cacao, café y achiote, productos que son llevados a vender en los centros de acopio de las ciudades de  Santa Rosa y San Francisco. Ahí tiene diversos compradores, quienes sabiendo de la calidad de sus frutos no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todos sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que le es muy rentable por que gracias a ello mejoró de a poco su condicio de vida y apoya a sus hijos con su educación. Con el crédito solicitado comprará estiércol de animales para mejorar la calidad de sus productos. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos ya que desea que sus hijos sean profesionales. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que este porte le será de mucha utilidad en el progreso de su trabajo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará estiércol de animales para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en: Victoria, originally from the city of Santa Rosa, is 54 years old. She is a cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own house. She lives with her two children, to whom she offers all of her support. Victoria is responsible and works with great care in order to get ahead. She cultivates cocoa, coffee and achiote. She brings these to sell at the trading centers in the cities of Santa Rosa and San Francisco, where she has various buyers who, knowing the quality of her products, do not hesitate to wait to buy from her. When it comes to her work, Victoria most enjoys planting her fields and making them fertile and productive. She has been doing this work for twenty years and considers it to be quite profitable. Thanks to her work, she has been supporting her children's education and, little by little, improving her quality of life. She will use this loan to buy animal manure to improve the quality of her crops. Going forward, Victoria hopes to continue to save her earnings, and she dreams that her children will become professionals. This will be her third loan through MFP and she knows that this support will be very useful in the progress of her work. She will use the 3,000 nuevos soles to buy animal manure to fertilize her land.

loans.use: to buy animal manure

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace lives in Essiam, a village near Abura. She is a widow taking care of 5 children. Palm oil production is what she has been doing for the past 10 years. The income she makes from her sales is used to take care of her dependents. Her loan will be used to obtain palm fruits to make more volumes of oil for resale.

loans.use: to obtain palm fruits to make more volumes of oil for resale.

loans.name: Jose Avilio

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y 4 hijos, él desde pequeño se dedica a la agricultura, porque ayudaba a su padre, trabaja de lunes a sábado y por medio de este oficio ha logrado mantener a su familia.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de abono y preparación de terreno, con esta ayuda económica podrá brindar el cuidado necesario para al terreno, para trabajar en la nueva siembra, esperando que a través de un buen proceso sus cosechas sean abundantes.
El objetivo de José es tener una fuente de ingreso para su familia, por eso busca las alternativas para lograr los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en:
Jose is a farmer. He lives with his wife and their 4 children. He has been a farmer ever since he was young because he used to help his father. He works from Monday to Saturday and has managed to support his family through his work.

Currently, he needs this loan in order to buy fertiliser for preparing his land. This financial assistance will allow him to provide the care necessary for his land, to be able to sow new seeds, in the hope that taking such care will allow him to reap a greater harvest.

Jose's aim is to have a source of income for his family; consequently, he is looking for alternative ways to achieve the income he needs to live.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser in order to prepare his land for new planting.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHICON” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Poblado D. Chicon, en la Provincia D. Urubamba y Departamento D. Cusco.
La socia Florencia; La socia tiene 47 años, la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica a la atención diaria D. sus restaurante, la socia tiene su propio negocio D. alimentos, ella prepara los diversos potajes y se encarga D. la administración D. sus restaurante, la socia invita a todo el público en general a que pasen a degustar si se encuentran por Chicón a su restaurante llamado el Paraíso; la socia es una persona muy trabajadora y año a año está concluyendo con la construcción D. sus vivienda, ella también apoya en los estudios D. sus hijos, la socia desea a futuro muy cercano poder hacer crecer su restaurante y mejorarlo, e implementar, ella ahora D. sea invertir el préstamo e la compra D. arroz, aceite en bidones, papa, fideos entre otros para poder preparar los diferentes potajes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. insumos para la elaboración D. sus diversos potajes.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "CHICON" which is located in the village of Chicón in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

Florencia, 47, is married and has two children.  She has a food business and also runs a restaurant called El Paraíso where she makes different kinds of stews.  She invites everyone visiting Chicón to come by and taste her dishes.  She is a hard worker and in the process of building her own house.  She also helps her children with their education.  In the future she wants to expand and improve her restaurant.  The loan will be used to buy rice, oil, potatoes and noodles, among other items, for her different stews.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her different stews.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CHICON” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Poblado de Chicon, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.
El socio Edgar; El socio tiene 29 años, El socio  es conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos, El socio se dedica al transporte turístico, el socio tiene su propia unidad vehicular y está registrado en el área de prestación de servicio turístico; el socio presta servicio desde la ciudad del Cusco hasta el bello poblado de Urubamba, el socio trabaja muchos años en este rubro y también ofrece tours a los otros centros arqueológicos de la zona y alrededores, como traslados al aeropuerto, hotel o de las discotecas a sus respectivos lugares, el socio es una persona muy amigable y siempre está dispuesto al cambio por lo que  por ahora es un buen trabajo el de servicio a los turistas y prestar tours, el desea a futuro poder implementar su vivienda y dar hospedaje familiar, también le gustaría poner una agencia turística. El socio desea el crédito para poder invertir en el mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular para que siga operando sin molestias. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular, el socio cambiara también un par de llantas y combustible.
El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "CHICON" which is located in the village of Chicón, province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Edgar, 29, has a common-law wife and two children.  He has a tourist transportation business and uses his own vehicle which is registered for tourist service.  He offers service from the city of Cusco to the lovely town of Urubamba and has been working in this activity for many years.  He also offers tours to other local archaeological sites and in surrounding areas, as well as airport, hotel and discoteque transfers.  He is very friendly and always willing to adapt.  For now he has a good job with his tourist transport and tours service.  In the future he wants to turn his home into a guest house and also set up a travel agency.  He plans to use the loan for vehicle maintenance, new tires and fuel.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance, new tires and fuel.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHICON” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Poblado de Chicon, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Victoria; La socia tiene 49 años, la socia es conviviente;  la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de productos secos, la socia tienen su stand en uno de los mercados de Urubamba; la socia compra al por mayor de sus proveedores productos secos como las diversas menestras habas, porotos, maíz, quinua, cebada, entre otros como papa seca, carne seca y los vende en sus stand en el mercado todos los días desde muy temprano por la mañana la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de otro grupo de productos secos para la venta e implementación de sus negocio la socia pagara a sus proveedores y ellos le darán a cambio maíz amarillos, blanco, papa para que la socia lo deshidrate, lentejas, porotos,  entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos para implementar sus negocio.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "CHICON" which is located in the village of Chicón, province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Victoria, 49, has a common-law husband.  She buys and sells dry goods at her stand in the Urubamba market.  Her goods, which she buys from wholesale dealers, include vegetables, lima beans, green beans, corn, quinoa, barley, potatoes, and dry meat.  She opens her stand every day from very early in the morning.  She wants to use the loan to buy another group of dry goods.  She will pay the dealers and they will give her yellow and white corn, potatoes for freeze-drying, lentils, and green beans, among others.  

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy dry goods for her business.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, es agricultor, vive con su familia, es padre de ocho hijos, los cuales mantiene a través del trabajo agrícola, tiene 20 años de estar dedicado a la actividad y quien le enseño fue su padre.
Por el momento necesita comprar abono y semilla de maíz, para realizar el cultivo, teniendo estos materiales podrá sin ningún inconveniente realizar sus actividades.
El propósito de Wilfredo es que a través de préstamos, pueda enriquecer sus cultivos y apoyar a sus hijos, de la presente siembra espera tener abundancia de cosecha para poder comercializar.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a farmer and lives with his family.  He has eight children and supports them through his agricultural work which he learned from his father and has been active in for 20 years.

He is in need of fertilizer and corn seed to carry out his activity and grow his crop.

Wilfredo's goal is to use the loan to make his crops better so he can provide for his children.  He hopes to have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and corn seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to procure more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Berkis

texts.en:
Berkis is a hardworking woman with 8 children. Just 6 of them live together with her and her long term partner. The other two live with their own families. Berkis is located in the agricultural city of Hato Mayor.

She has a little stall in her house to sell vegetables. She will invest this loan to buy different vegetables like plantains, cassava and also salad and fruits. Around 7 years ago, Berkis started her business with her first Esperanza loan, where she started to receive loans with a group. Now she is taking loans by herself in bigger amounts. She is planning to save her profits to help her children attend school, and lately to support them with their university expenses.

She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
For the past six years Abena, a single parent taking care of four children, has been making palm kernel oil in Abura. She will use her loan to buy more palm nuts to expand her kernel business, and anticipates reinvesting the increased profits for further growth.

To prepare her palm kernel oil, Abena removes the shells from the palm nuts. The shelling used to be performed manually, using two stones to crack each nut to separate the kernel and shell. Thanks to advancements in machinery, we now use nut-cracking machines instead. The traditional oil extraction method is to simply heat the dried nuts to release the palm kernel oil. The released oil is then skimmed from the top of the nuts. This process is continued until all of the oil is skimmed out of the palm kernel.

loans.use: to expand her palm kernel business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood, molds and photograph paper.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia, se dedica a la venta de verduras y fritas, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 16, 12 y 8 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian, ella administra el negocio desde hace 15 años, lo atiende de 7:00am a 5:oopm, este horario depende de la demanda en el mercado.
Actualmente comprara frutas y verduras frescas, para surtir el negocio, compra de bananas, naranjas, manzanas, papas, güisquil, yuca, y más de la que sea necesaria, esta inversión se hace con la intención de aumentar sus ganancias.
Ella quiere trabajar de la mano con préstamos, que esta ayude le permita crecer y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Emilia sells fruit and vegetables.  She lives with her husband and their three children who are 16, 12 and 8.  All of her children are in school.  Emilia has been running her business for 15 years and serves in it from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  Her hours depend on the demand in the market.

Emilia will buy fresh fruit and vegetables in order to stock her business.  She will buy bananas, oranges, apples, potatoes, chayote, cassava and more of what she needs.  She is making this investment with the intention of increasing her profits.

Emilia would like to work with loans as this will allow her to grow and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, apples, potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toilet paper, tomato purée, oil, sugar and rice

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 67 años de edad, viudo y con 5 hijos. El señor Juan tiene 55 años de dedicarse a la agricultura. Él aprendió esta actividad de su padre cuando tenia tan solo 12 años de edad, lo que le impidió asistir a la escuela.

El señor Juan manifiesta que su objetivo primordial es garantizar la seguridad alimentaría de su familia. El ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable, ya que hace ocho años quedo viudo y a cargo de proporcionar educación y alimento a dos de sus hijos. Hoy en día sus dos hijos son los que le ayudan a cultivar la tierra.

A pesar de no haber asistido a la escuela, el señor Juan es un hombre visionario que lucha de sol a sol para en un futuro poder comprar la tierra que actualmente cultiva junto a sus hijos. El tiene mucha fé de lograrlo porque sus hijos comparten su mismo deseo.

El señor Juan esta solicitando un préstamo a la Fundación Campo para comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas. De esta manera el podrá controlar las plagas y enfermedades en el cultivo de fríjol y maíz que plantó en la última semana de agosto. Con el préstamo, el podrá comprar los insumos a mejor precio y pagar un solo transporte para llevarlos a su comunidad. Juan debe recorrer hasta dos kilómetros desde su comunidad para llegar al lugar donde compra los insumos, y otros dos kilómetros hasta el lugar donde cultiva.

Con la venta de su cosecha el planea cancelar el préstamo otorgado por la Fundación,  y comprar unos cerdos y engordarlos para tener otro ingreso durante la época seca. Lo demás el espera ahorrarlo para comprar la tierra donde cultiva. El señor Juan desea poder dejarles a sus hijos un patrimonio que los haga sentirse orgullosos de su padre.
texts.en:
Juan is a 67-year-old widower with five children.  Juan has been farming for 55 years.  He learned this activity from his father when he was just 12 years old which kept him from going to school.

Juan states that his prime objective is securing his family’s food needs.  He has shown himself to be a very responsible person.  It’s been 8 years now since he became a widower and was left in charge of providing education and nourishment for his two children.  Today, it’s his two children that help him farm the land.

Despite never having gone to school, Juan is a visionary man who struggles from sunup to sunup to be able to buy a piece of land to farm with his children in the future.  He has much faith that he’ll accomplish this since his children share the same wish.

Juan is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to be able to control infestations and crop diseases in his corn and bean plants that he planted during the last week in August.  With the loan, he’ll be able to buy supplies at a better price and pay transportation costs just once to take them to his community.  Juan must travel almost two kilometers from his community to the place where he buys the supplies and then an additional two kilometers to the place where he does his planting.

With the sale of his harvest he plans to repay the loan granted by the Fundación and also to buy some pigs to fatten up and have another source of income during the dry season.  He plans to save the remainder in order to be able to buy the land he currently farms.  Juan wants to be able to leave his children an estate that will make them proud of their father.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, él es padre de cuatro hijos de los cuales dos viven con él, José se dedica al cultivo desde hace 30 años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am 3:00pm.
Actualmente necesita comprar abono y herbicidas para aplicarlos al cultivo de maíz y frijol, esta compra le ayudara para cuidar del cultivo y poder garantizar una buena cosecha.
Su aspiración es que a través del cultivo pueda generar mejores oportunidades para sus hijos, y una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
José grows corn.  He is the father of four children, two of whom live with him.  He has been farming for thirty years.  He works every day, from 6.00am to 3.00pm.

José currently needs to buy manure and herbicides to apply to his corn and bean crops.  This purchase will help him to care for his crops and guarantee a good harvest.

José's goal, through his farming, is to be able to provide his children with better opportunities, and to achieve better financial solvency.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicides to apply to his corn and bean crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional bags of charcaol to supply her customers.

loans.name: Dabo 01 Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 12 Juillet 2008 le groupe Dabo 01 a plus de cinq cycles dans le programme des bancs villageois. Il  est composé de 21 femmes qui vivent dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Baldé  (assise l’extrême droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de  51 ans, mariée et mère de sept  enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse  de jus et de glace dans son village, de même elle a un étalage de légumes. Au début elle ne vendait que des légumes. Avec  années d’expérience de ce domaine d’activité, elle compte d’avantage varier son activité.
 
Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter les différents produits pour la fabrication de jus et s’approvisionner en légumes pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des membres de la famille en nourriture, santé et scolarité.
texts.en:
The Dabo 01 group was created on July 12, 2008, and has had five loan cycles with Banc Villageois. The group is made up of 21 women who live in the same village. Their main activity is small-scale retail. 

Madame Baldé (seated, far right) is the group's leader. She is 51 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She sells juice and ice in the village, and she also has a vegetable stall. At first, she only sold vegetables. After several years of experience, she decided to add some variety. With this new loan, she will buy items necessary to make juice, and she will stock up on vegetables for re-sale. Profits from these activities allow her to support her husband in paying for food, healthcare and schooling for the family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make juice and to buy vegetables to re-sell.

loans.name: Dabo 02 Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 12 Juillet 2008 le groupe Dabo 02 a plus de cinq cycles dans le programme des bancs villageois de CAURIE-MF. Il  est composé de 21 femmes qui vivent dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Chérif  (debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois  enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de patte d’arachide et d’huile de palme au marché hebdomadaire de sa localité, activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de cinq ans. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter de la patte d’arachide pour la revente.

Les profits tirés de son activité l’aiderons à acheter de chèvres ou moutons en parti et d’autre part soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Dabo 2 Group was established on July 12, 2008 and has been through five loan cycles with the banc villageois program. It is made up of 21 women who live in the same village. It's main business is small-scale trade.

Mrs. Chérif (standing on the far right in the picture) is the group leader. She's 31 years old, married, and the mother of three children. For more than five years, she's been selling peanut paste and palm oil at the market in her town, a business has run for the past 5 years.

Her new loan will enable her to buy peanut paste for resale. The profits derived from her business will help her in part to buy goats and sheep, and in part to support her husband with the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy peanut paste for resale

loans.name: General Diaz Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre General Díaz se conformó con mucho esfuerzo de las miembros. Ellas se encuentran en el primer ciclo, todas trabajan en forma conjunta, solidaria y siempre dentro de un ambiente de cooperación y desarrollo. Se encuentran muy felices dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta para llegar a los objetivos que es el de trabajar para apoyar económicamente a sus familias.
Una de las miembros es la Señora Patricia, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, nos comenta que mediante su trabajo puede mejorar bastante su nivel de vida e ingresos económicos. Además de eso dice que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que actualmente pose además del ingreso de su marido que es empleado en un negocio, con el ingreso de su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que elabora, como ser carne, pollo, verduras y otros. Agradece el apoyo de la Fundación, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The General Diaz Women's Committee was established through much effort by its members. They are in their first loan cycle. They all work together in a mutually supportive way, always in an atmosphere of cooperation and development. They are very happy in the program. In addition to each one's independent work, they also come up with joint business activities in order to arrive at their goal of working to support their families financially. 

One of the members is Ms. Patricia, who devotes herself to selling prepared meals. She comments that she is able through her to work to improve her living standard considerably as well as her income. In addition she says that with this business her family's finances improved considerably, since currently they possess not only the income of her husband who is an employee of a business, but also the income from her business. 

She is seeking the loan for the purchase of the ingredients necessary for making the foods she prepares, such as meat, chicken, vegetables and other items. She appreciates the support of the Foundation as, having obtained the loan, it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Daniela Fatme

texts.es: La Señorita Daniela es soltera y tiene 21 años, viene estudiando en la universidad en el horario de la mañana y en las tardes aprovecha para dedicarse a su negocio que consiste en la venta de ropa (Short, pantalones, bluza, camisas) y algunos accesorios exclusivamente para mujer. El crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderia (POLOS, SHORT, PANTALONES), ya que se exproxima la temporada primavera - verano. Su gran gran sueño es ampliar su negocio con la venta de ropa en general (niños, caballeros, entre otros), además de tener su casa propia. La Señorita está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que le permitirá incrementar su negocio y cumplir con sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Miss Daniela is single and 21 years old. She has been studying at the university on a morning schedule, and makes use of the afternoons to devote herself to her business which consists of selling clothing (shorts, pants, blouses and shirts) and a few accessories which are exclusively for women. 

The requested loan is for investing in the purchase of merchandise (polo shirts, shorts, pants) since the spring-summer season is approaching. Her big dream is to expand her business with the sale of clothing in general (children's and men's, among other items) and to have her own house. The young woman is very grateful for the loan she received since it will allow her to increase her business and fulfill her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (polo shirts, shorts, pants) for the spring-summer season.

loans.name: Susana Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Susana tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de artículos personales. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en el negocio, productos para la escuela, que son carpetas, cuadernos, colores, plumas, marcadores y lápices. Ya que por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que desea para que su negocio tenga mas variedad de mercancía. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas planea pagar el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor Aníbal se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de su pequeño hijo que empezó a estudiar, con el sueldo que recibe como chofer de un camión de carga.
texts.en:
Susana has been selling personal items for more than 4 years now. She is applying for a loan to invest in her business, to buy school products, such as, folders, exercise books, coloured pens, fountain pens, marker pens and pencils. At the moment she does not have the money required to invest as she wishes in order to offer a greater variety of stock.
The money she earns from selling these products will be used to repay her loan, as her husband Anibal, a freight truck driver, pays for the family expenses and their young son's educational expenses now that he has started school.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Gladis Antonia

texts.es:
La Señora Gladis es de la ciudad de Santaní, ella tiene una Ropería y Zapatería en la zona del Mercado Municipal. Se define como una mujer muy emprendedora, trabajadora y creativa. Vivió por mucho tiempo en el extranjero de donde trajo un poco de capital y abrió para su puesto de trabajo.
Comenta que le llevo mucho esfuerzo y trabajo lograr lo que ha tenido hasta hoy, pero manifiesta que seguirá trabajando duramente para poder seguir creciendo y expandiendo su negocio. Dice que todo lo que realiza es por ayudar a su familia, ya que desea darles lo mejor y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Una de sus metas es tener una gran tienda donde pueda atraer a mas clientes y con ello aumentar sus ingresos. Su objetivo es mantener este negocio y así poder solventarse, desea tener todos los artículos de primera necesidad, para que sus clientes encuentren todos en este lugar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas que posteriormente va a vender. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito, pues de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Gladis is from the city of Santaní.  She has a clothing and shoe business in the Mercado Municipal neighborhood.  She defines herself as a very enterprising, hard-working, and creative woman.  She lived abroad for a long time.  She brought capital from abroad, and she used it to open the stall where she works.

She says that it took a lot of effort and work to achieve what she has had as of today.  She states that she will continue working hard in order to be able to continue growing and expanding her business.  She says that everything she does is to help her family.  She wishes to give them the best so that they do not experience any type of privation.

One of her goals is to have a large store where she could attract more customers, which would increase her income.  Her objective is to maintain this business and be able to pay for her expenses.  She wishes to have all of the basic needs items so that her customers find everything at her place. 

She is requesting the loan to buy garments that she will later sell.  She hopes for the loan because getting it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy garments to later sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a 42-year-old married mother of five children, four of whom are currently in school, lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past year, Sarah has been working hard to manage her clinic, which offers health services.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more medicine, which will help Sarah generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. She hopes to open a retail shop in the future.

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), a program primarily serving small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine.

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en:
Zaitun, a 40-year-old married mother of four children, one of whom is currently in school, lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past year, she has been working hard to manage her small retail business which sells sugar and soap.

To help expand her enterprise, Zaitun has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more supplies, which will help Zaitun to generate greater profits and buy more stock. She hopes to start a farming business in the future.

Zaitun is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), a program primarily serving small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a 48-year-old married mother of six children, one of whom currently attends school, lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past 15 years, she has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which sells clothes.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more materials for designing clothes, which will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. She hopes to open a boutique business in the future.

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), a program primarily serving small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for designing clothes.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Mike has been working hard to manage his brick-making, which sells bricks. 

To help expand his business, Mike has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy firewood for burning the bricks, and will help Mike to generate greater profits and pay medical and school fees and expenses. Mike hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a machine for bricks. 

Mike  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mike who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy firewood for burning the bricks.

loans.name: Ocama

texts.en:
Ocama is 49 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Ocama has been working hard to manage his stone quarrying business, which delivers stones to different customers for building houses. 

To help expand his business, Ocama has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy tools to be used in the quarrying and will help Ocama to generate greater profits and pay school fees and expenses. Ocama hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Ocama is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ocama who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy tools to be used in quarrying.

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es: Yobana, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 27 años de edad, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y su querida hija Keyli de 11 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Yobana tuvo una infancia sacrificada de la cual tuvo que salir adelante a base de perseverancia. A sus 18 años se independizó. Dejó de ser empleada y abrió su propio negocio que es una tienda de abarrotes, empezó vendiendo sus productos en las calle de manera ambulatoria y con el transcurso del tiempo y con la ayuda de unos ahorros compró su propio lote de terreno donde actualmente se sitúa su bodega. Ella es una mujer de armas tomar y señala que uno logra su propósitos con mucho esfuerzo y tenacidad.  Hoy se siente a gusto con la actividad que realiza y el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano. Con las ganancias adquiridas compró su propia chacra de 02 hectáreas donde trabaja su esposo. Yobana necesita el crédito para seguir prosperando y prestando buen servicio a sus consumidores. Este será su sexto crédito con MFP y ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos anteriores y espera comprar lo que necesita. Necesita comprar mostradores y mesas para exhibir con mayor estética su mercadería.
texts.en: Yobana, who was born in Santa Rosa, is 27 years old. She is a sensible and hard working woman. She lives in her own home with her partner and their much loved daughter, 11 year old Keyli, who is Yobana's motivation for everything she does. Yobana had a deprived childhood which she managed to overcome with perseverance. By the age of 18 she was caring for herself independently. She left her job and started her own business - a grocery store - by selling her products while walking the streets. As time passed, and using what little savings she had, she managed to buy her own plot of land where her store is now located. She is not a woman to be reckoned with; that is to say, she is the kind of person who achieves her objectives through great effort and tenacity. These days she is happy with her business activities, her great charisma and her kindness in all her dealings. She has become a favourite with her neighbours, who have been her loyal clients since the early days of her business. Her profits have been used to buy her own 2 hec. farm where her husband now works. Yobana needs this loan to continue earning and providing a good service to her customers. This will be her sixth loan with MFP and she has repaid her previous loans on time. She hopes to be able to buy the items she needs: cabinets and tables to display her stock stylishly.

loans.use: To buy tables and display counters.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past two years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her salon, where she does hairdressing for local women. 

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids and will help Winnie to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Winnie hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Winnie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids.

loans.name: El Quisco Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “El Quisco”, lo conforman 19 emprendedoras quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía, bisutería, preparación de productos de amasandería, repostería y bazar. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de San Antonio. 
Adela presidenta del Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra delante del grupo, sentada en una silla y usa lentes, bufanda blanca, chaqueta negra y pantalones negros.
Se dedica a la confección y reparación de ropa, desde hace 30 años, trabaja desde su casa, ahí cuenta con dos máquinas de coser costura recta y una máquina overlock. Confecciona ropa de trabajo para pescadores, pecheras y mangas, además de reparaciones de ropa durante todo el año a pedido.
Sus insumos los compra en la ciudad de Santiago.  También se dedica a la preparación de ceviches y mariscales, desde su casa y de manera artesanal. Para continuar con éste negocio debe tener un local amplio, por lo que pretende ocupar la cocina de su casa, para obtener los permisos de salubridad. 
Con el crédito comprárá potes, envases, bolsas, bidones de jugo de limón, para la preparación de mariscales.
Sus metas son ampliar sus dos negocios, el de costuras y en un futuro establecerse con un local establecido para vender sus productos de mar. 
Adela vive junto a su marido, sus dos hijas de 29 y 24 años de edad, además de dos nietos. Sus sueños son generar mayores ingresos para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo esperanza, respecto al grupo Adela se siente muy cómoda ya que las reuniones son amenas, el grupo es comprometido y afiatado. Sobre las capacitaciones ellos se encuentran muy entusiasmados. 
San Antonio es un puerto de la región de Valparaíso, siendo esta una de sus principales características, ubicado en el litoral central de Chile. Se desarrolla en forma importante la pesca y venta de pescados y mariscos. Pese a la actividad portuaria y comercial del puerto, existe un alto índice de cesantía.
texts.en:
The "El Quisco" community bank is made up of 19 entrepreneurial women who work in different industries, including the crafts, jewellery making, baking and retail. They all live in the city of San Antonio. 

Adela is the president of the community bank and in the picture she is sitting down in front of the group. She is wearing glasses, a white scarf, a black jacket and black trousers. She has been making and repairing clothes for 30 years. She works from home, where she has two sewing machines - one for straight stitches and an overlock one. She makes working clothes for fishermen, aprons and sleeves, as well as repairs on demand all year long. She buys her materials in the city of Santiago. Before she used to make ceviche and seafood soup, but her business was shut down because she didn't have purpose-built premises. In order to continue with the business she has to have spacious premises, even if that means occupying the kitchen in her home, to ensure high levels of hygiene. 

With the loan she will buy pots, containers, bags and cans of lemon juice to prepare seafood dishes. Her goals are to expand her two businesses, the sewing business and in the future to have stable premises for her seafood selling business. 

Adela lives with her husband, her two daughters aged 29 and 24 and two grandchildren. Her dream is to generate more income to provide her family with a better quality of life. She is very happy and grateful for the services received from Fondo Esperanza. She is also very pleased with Grupo Adela, because the meetings are  fun and the group is committed, trustworthy and enthusiastic about the training. San Antonio is a port in the Valparaiso region, located in the central coast of Chile. The main industries are fishing and trading in fish and seafood. In spite of the commercial and shipping activity there is a high rate of unemployment at the port.

loans.use: to buy pots, containers, bags and cans of lemon juice

loans.name: Aida Galud

texts.es:
Aida Galud es soltera tiene 20 años no tiene hijos  vive con ha hermana en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Aida se dedica  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder tener su propio terreno para poder trabajar mejor.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Aida Galud is 20 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives with her sister in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province. 

The 'Vencedores Unidos' community bank is located in Anchoveta, on the road to La Templanza, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.
