Aida is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys and sells her products in Comercial Peña.

Aida is requesting this loan to buy seeds, supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pests and plant diseases.  Her dream is to own her own plot of land so that she can work better.

In her free time, Aida enjoys going out for walks and spending more time on her work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es:
Sara María tiene 47 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los tres hijos de veintiseis, veinticuatro, veintinueve años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Sara se dedica  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar más terreno para poder trabajar mejor.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and lives with her husband and her 3 children who are 29, 26, and 24 years old in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The members of the “ VCR Vencedores Unidos” located in the area of Anchoveta, on the way to Templanza, belong to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This solidarity group works in agriculture, growing short-cycle corn and rice. 

Sara works in agriculture growing corn and rice. She buys and sells her products in Comercial Peña.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds, supplies, and fertilizer for her crops. The loan will help her buy what she needs. She encounters problems such as pests and diseases. Her dream is to buy more land in able to produce more.

In her free time she likes to walk and work some extra hours.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, and fertilizers for the crops

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 45 años, convive con José, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos Diego y Ridick, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Todas las mañanas desde hace 16 años, se despierta muy contenta; pues gusta de atender en su pequeña tienda de verduras, alimentos, frutas y panes. Nelly es muy conocida y respetada en su barrio, porqué todo los sábados y domingos se dirige a la ciudad a comprar los productos que venderá en su tienda durante la semana que entra. Ella es la única que abastece el lugar con productos alimenticios, por ello le va muy bien en su negocio. Con el pasar de los años, Nelly equipó su tienda con carnes, azúcar, arroz y ahora quiere adquirir más productos para poder satisfacer las necesidades de los habitantes. Además tiene una tienda de fertilizantes naturales donde aprovecha vender a los agricultores de su zona. Asimismo su esposo José se dedica al trasporte público con el auto que adquirieron hace poco; con ello obtienen un dinero extra para el hogar. Y todo esto lo realizó gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal. Ella pertenece al banquito Virgen de Fátima” y este es el duodécimo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que ofreció su banco comunal en el progreso de su tienda. Nelly de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Nelly is 45 years old, and lives with her husband Jose. They have 4 children together but only 2 of them, Diego and Ridick, live with them in their own house located in the village of Patay.

Every morning for the last 16 years, she has woken up happy. She likes taking care of her little store of vegetables, food, fruits and bread. She is very well known and respected in her neighborhood because every Saturday and Sunday she goes to the city to buy the products that she will sell in the coming week. She has the only place that supplies food products, so she is doing very well in her business.

As the years went by, Nelly stocked her store with meat, sugar, and rice and now she wants to buy more products in order to meet the needs of the residents. 

She also has a store of natural fertilizers where local farmers in her area can shop. Her husband, Jose, is a taxi cab driver using the auto that they have had for a short while, earning extra cash for household expenses.

All of this was made possible thanks to the support of her communal bank. She belongs to the little bank of “Virgen de Fátima” and this is her 12th loan with MFP, and she is thankful for the support that the communal bank has offered in the growth of her store. Nelly will use the money from the loan to stock the store with staples.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to supply her store

loans.name: Hugo Bricenio

texts.es:
Hugo Bricenio tiene 20 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas `Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Hugo se dedica  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar un carro para poder transportar los productos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Hugo is 20 years old, single with no children, and lives with his parents in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos. 

The members of the “ VCR Vencedores Unidos” located in the area of Anchoveta, on the way to Templanza, belong to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This solidarity group works in agriculture, growing short-cycle corn and rice. 

Hugo works in agriculture growing corn and rice. He buys and sells his products in the Comercial Peña.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds, supplies, and fertilizer for his crops. The loan will help him financially supply his needs. He encounters problems such as pests and diseases. 

His dream is to buy a car in order to transport his crops. In his free time he likes to watch television.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer, and manure

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past nine years, Sulaiman has been working hard to manage his brick making business which sells bricks. and he also has a small retail shop that sells sugar, etc..

To help expand his business, Sulaiman has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy firewood for the bricks and will help Sulaiman to generate greater profits and pay medical and school fees and expenses. Sulaiman hopes that in the future he will be able to start up a wholesale shop. 

Sulaiman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sulaiman who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy firewood for bricks.

loans.name: Cristo Salva 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Esperanza is the coordinator of the Cristo Salva Groups 1, 2 & 3. Her family is maD. up of four children and a husband. She said that her most difficult challenge is to proviD. a better future for her children by working hard selling in the street. She wants to improve her business and give her children the opportunity to live safe, tranquil lives with as little need as possible.

Esperanza is very excited to receive her third loan through Esperanza International. She took her first loan almost two years ago, and she is very grateful for the opportunity her neighbors gave herself by inviting her to join the group. 

She has had her business for about 22 years. She started by selling silver jewelry such as rings and chains, using money that she had saved up. Esperanza is planning to invest by purchasing underwear and clothes for men, women and children.

She will use her business profits to reinvest and expand her inventory by buying more products, planning to set a little miscellaneous store in her house. Esperanza dreams of having a beautiful house and a successful business. 

This group is composed of 15 Haitian's immigrants, located in the city of La Romana, where tourists and the sugar cane are the biggest industries. They all live in a rural area called Batey, surrounded by sugar cane fields.

loans.use: to buy underwear and clothing.

loans.name: Luis Heriberto

texts.es:
Luis Heriberto tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Luis se dedica  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar una finca para poder producir un poco más.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Luis is 24 years old. He is single, with no children, and lives with his parents in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos. 

The members of the “ VCR Vencedores Unidos” located in the area of Anchoveta, on the way to Templanza, belong to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This solidarity group works in agriculture, growing short-cycle corn and rice. 

Luis works in agriculture growing corn and rice. He buys and sells his products in the Comercial Peña.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer and manure for his crops. The loan will help him financially supply his needs. He encounters problems such as pests and diseases. 

His dream is to buy a farm in order to grow a bit more. In his free time he likes to go for walks.

loans.use: in order to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

María se dedica  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar un carro para transportar los productos que cosecha.

En los tiempos libres le gusta leer mucho la biblia.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old and lives with her husband and her children who are 13, 9, 7, 5, and 1 years old in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos. 

The members of the “ VCR Vencedores Unidos” located in the area of Anchoveta, on the way to Templanza, belong to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This solidarity group works in agriculture, growing short-cycle corn and rice.

María works in agriculture growing corn and rice. She buys and sells her products in Comercial Peña.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer, and manure for her crops. The loan will help her buy what she needs. She encounters problems such as pests and diseases. 

Her dream is to buy a car in order to transport her harvest. In her free time she likes to read the Bible very much.

loans.use: in order to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Grettel Yadira

texts.es:
Grettel  es una señora de 40 años de edad que vive con su esposo y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, provincia de Cartago. Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y la agricultura. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. Cimarrón se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias.

Desde hace varios años que Grettel ha querido mejorar su lechería, ella cuenta en estos momentos con el local para la actividad a la que se dedica, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y el proposito es vender sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad. El proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Grettel está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de una vaca. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Grettel es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Grettel is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and son in a community called Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in Cartago province.  This is a small rural community of around 2,000 inhabitants.  The local people work in milk production and farming.  The area has an uneven terrain and much of the land remains a humid, tropical forest.  Cimarrón is located approximately one and a half hour's bus ride away from Turrialba, the nearest trade center.  However, sometimes during the year the road becomes impassable due to rain.  

For several years, Grettel has wanted to improve her dairy.  She has the premises she needs to carry out her business but she lacks the capital needed for her business to do well.  Her goal is to sell her products to the neighbors in her community.  This project is of great interest to her.

Grettel is requesting a micro loan for 500,000 colones to buy a cow.  She hopes that this will help her to grow her business and improve both her own quality of life as well as that of her family.

Grettel is a member of the 'Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón' (New Hope for Cimarrón) Community Loan Company, one of 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be her first loan and, with it, she hopes to continue growing both on a personal and financial level.  She will also take an active part in her community's loan organization.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Segundo Arturo

texts.es:
Segundo Arturo tiene 36 años de edad es casado vice con la esposa y con los seis hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Segundo se dedica  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar un carro para transportar los productos que cosecha.
En los tiempos libres le gusta leer mucho la biblia.
texts.en:
Segundo Arturo is 36 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and six children in Ventanas canton, in los Ríos province.

The 'Vencedores Unidos' community bank is located in Anchoveta, on the road to La Templanza, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Segundo is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys and sells his products in Comercial Peña.

Segundo is requesting this loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his work such as pests and plant diseases.  His dream is to buy a car to transport the products that he harvests.

In his free time, Segundo enjoys reading the Bible.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure

María Norma tiene 32 años de edad es casada vice con el esposo y con los seis hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

María se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprarse una casa y un carro.

En los tiempos libres le gusta asistir al rodeo montubio.
texts.en:
María Norma is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and six children in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.  

The members of the Vencedores Unidos communal bank are in the community of Anchoveta, on the way to the community of  La Templanza. It belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. this bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural  such as corn and rice.

María works in agriculture. She plants corn and rice. She does her buying and selling in Comercial Peña. She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, materials and fertilizers for her crops.  The loan will be financial support to meet her needs and face challenges such as pests and disease. Her dream is to buy a house and a car.  

She likes to go to the rural rodeo in her free time.

loans.use: lto buy seeds, materials, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es:
Martha María tiene 46 años de edad es soltera vive con los tres hijos  de veinte y dos dieciocho, y diecisiete años de edad en el Cantón de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Martha María se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprarse una casa y un carro.

The 'Vencedores Unidos' community bank is located in Anchoveta, on the road to La Templanza, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Martha María is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys and sells her products in Comercial Peña.

Martha María is requesting this loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pests and plant diseases.  Her dream is to buy a house and a car.

In her free time, Martha María enjoys going out for walks with her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure

Lidia Janeth tiene 18 años de edad es soltera vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Lidia Janeth se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprarse una casa y un terreno para no pagar arriendo.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con los hijos.
texts.en:
Lidia Janeth is 18 years old. She lives with her parents in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.  

The members of the Vencedores Unidos communal bank are in the community of Anchoveta, on the road to the community of  la Templanza. It belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural work such as corn and rice.    

Lidia Janeth works farming corn and rice. She does her buying and selling at Comercial Peña.

She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, materials and fertilizer for her crops. The support of the loan will help her meet her financial needs and face challenges such as pests and disease. Her dream is to buy a house and plot of land so she doesn't have to pay rent.

In her free time she likes to go on day trips with the children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, materials and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 39 años, es una mujer luchadora y alegre. Ella es madre soltera y a pesar de los constantes problemas que afronta está orgullosa de su hija María; ambas viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Desde muy temprano se levanta para poder preparar sus alimentos y enviar a estudiar a su hija, para luego dirigirse a cuidar y limpiar sus sembríos hasta altas horas de la noche, como dice "hasta que el cuerpo resista “. Son 29 años que ella se dedica a la siembra de papa (tubérculo peruano), arveja y flor de gladiolo, como toda una mujer de negocios Sonia también abrió una pequeña tienda, donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Más delante ella desea incrementar sus ventas; con la compra de más semillas y sembrar en mayores cantidades; para poder venderlo a un mejor precio y darle una excelente calidad de vida a su hija, que es el motor de su progreso y trabajo. Cuenta que dentro de algunos meses cosechará la flor de gladiolo que sembró. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde está agradecida por la seguridad que le brinda su banco comunal. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Sonia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales y si le sobra el dinero comprará productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
39-year-old Sonia is a tenacious and cheerful woman.  She is a single mother and, in spite of the constant problems that she faces, she is proud of her daughter María.  The pair live in their own home which is located in the small village of Patay.

Sonia gets up very early in the morning so that she can prepare her food and send her daughter off to school.  She then goes out to care for and weed her crops until late at night.  As she says "for as long as my body can withstand it".  Sonia has been growing potatoes (a Peruvian tuber), peas and gladioli flowers for 29 years.  Like the true businesswoman she is, Sonia also opened a small store where she sells basic household products.  In the future, she would like to increase her sales.  She would like to buy more seeds and grow crops in larger quantities.  This will enable her to sell at a better price and provide her daughter, who is the driving force behind her progress and work, with an excellent quality of life.  She tells us that in a few months time she will harvest the gladioli that she sowed.

Sonia belongs to the 'Virgen de Fátima' community bank and this is her tenth loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the security which her community bank gives her.  For this reason, she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  With your support, Sonia will invest the money she has requested in buying two bags of pea seeds, several sacks of natural fertilizers and, if she has money left over, she will buy basic household products for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds, sacks of fertilizer, and products with which to stock her store

loans.name: Pamela Ines

texts.es: La señora Pamela es socia integrante del banco de emprendimiento "las triunfadoras" pero esta vez solicito un credito individual, tiene como actividad la venta de cd`s, dvd`s un su kiosco ubicado por la zona gran poder una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de la Paz y solicito un crédito para la compra de lcd  40 pulgadas compra de colecciones de dvd`s por mayor para su segundo puesto de venta y así incrementar su capital de trabajo asimismo tener segura la mercadería de sus kioscos. Vive con su hijo, en la casa de sus papas, ella ayuda con los gastos familiares a sus papas, es una persona joven y muy responsable con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Pamela is a member of the 'Las Triunfadoras' community bank but, on this occasion, she is requesting an individual loan.  Her business is selling CDs and DVDs from a kiosk which is located in Gran Poder district.  This is a very busy area in the city of La Paz.  She requested this loan to buy a 40 inch LCD and some DVDs wholesale for her second sales kiosk.  In this way, she hopes to increase her working capital and have available the merchandise she needs for her kiosks.  Pamela lives with her son in her parents' home.  She helps her mom and dad with the family expenses.  Pamela is a very responsible young person who would like to improve her whole family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a 40 inch LCD and DVDs wholesale

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 40 años D. edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantón ventanas provincia D. los Ríos.

Los miembros D. L.  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto L. Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilL. se dedica a labores Agrícolas D. ciclo corto siembra D. maíz, arroz. 

María Teresa se dedica  a L. agricultura a L. siembra D. maíz y arroz, Compra y venD. los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para L. compra D. semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprarse un carro para poder transportar los productos para posterior venderlos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir D. paseo con los hijos.
texts.en:
María Teresa is 40 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Vencedores Unidos' community bank is located in Anchoveta, on the road to L. Templanza, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

María Teresa is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys and sells her products in Comercial Peña.

María Teresa is requesting this loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pests and plant diseases.  Her dream is to buy a car so that she can transport her products to sell.

In her free time, María Teresa enjoys going out for walks with her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta, de 49 años es una mujer trabajadora. Ella vive desde hace 30 años junto a su esposo Julian, con quien tiene 8 hijos. Pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Bellavista. Ella está llena de vitalidad y fuerza. Con una sonrisa comienza el día, pues sabe del sacrificado labor que requiere el cuidado de los cultivos. Desde hace 28 años se dedica a la agricultura, pues siembra arveja y maíz a gran escala, con el tiempo logró adquirir la destreza necesaria para poder obtener una cosecha de buena calidad. Según cuenta, los mismos comerciantes visitan sus terrenos agrícolas para comercializar los alimentos, eso la hace muy feliz. Además comparte sus actividades con el cuidado de las vacas que tiene, aunque ultimamente realiza 2 moldes de queso ya que una de sus vacas está preñada, por ello tiene menos leche para poder elaborar este producto lácteo. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para mejorar su calidad de vida. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. La casa de Jacinta esta construida con material rústico, por ello espera recibir su apoyo para comprar cemento y mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
49-year-old Jacinta is a hard-working woman.  She has been living with her husband Julian for 30 years and they have eight children.  They live with two of their children in their own home which is located in the town of Bellavista.

Jacinta is full of vitality and energy.  She starts her day with a smile as she knows the hard work she needs to carry out in order to care for her crops.  She has been farming for 28 years and grows peas and corn on a large scale.  Over time, she has managed to acquire the skill needed to obtain a good-quality harvest.  She tells us that salespeople visit her land to buy her crops.  This makes her very happy.  In addition to this, Jacinta also cares for some cows that she owns.  However, lately she has only been filling two cheese molds as one of her cows is pregnant.  This means that she has less milk with which to make this dairy product.

This is Jacinta's first loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your support so that she can improve her quality of life.  She pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  Jacinta's house is built from basic building materials and she hopes to receive your support so that she can buy cement and improve the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to buy cement

loans.name: Vicente Guerrero Group

texts.es:
Silvia tiena la edad de 31 años, estudio hasta la universidad y es madre soltera de una pequeña niña que asiste a la secundaria.ella y su familia viven en una zona cañera. Silvia nos platica que a ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar y nos dice que se gana un poco mas cuando se tiene su propio negocio asi que hace un poco mas de 4 años inicio a rentar un pequeño local en el centro de su localidad en el cual vende zapatos por catalago, ella habre su negocio todos los dias desde las nueve de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche y en ese horario sus clientes la visitan  y le hacen sus pedidos de zapatos, cuando ella ya reune mas de diez pedidos los encarga, despues los entrega a sus clientesy ella recibe el pago por sus productos.

Silvia es integrante de un grupo llamado vicente Guerrero que esta formado por 5 personas de nombres:

Paulina venta de abarrotes 
Mirna venta de zapatos 
Oralia venta de perfumeria 
Gloria venta de ropa 
Cinthya venta de perfumeria
texts.en:
Silvia is 31 years old and has a university education.  She is a single mother with a young daughter who is in middle school.  Silvia and her family live in a sugar cane area.  Silvia tells us that she has always enjoyed working and that you earn a little more when you have your own business.  For this reason, a little over four years ago she started renting some small business premises in the center of town where she sells shoes from a catalog.  She opens her store every day, from nine in the morning until eight at night.  During these hours her customers visit her store and make orders for shoes.  When she has more than ten orders from her customers, she orders the items from the catalog and then delivers them to her customers and receives payment.

Silvia is a member of a group called 'Vicente Guerrero'.  The group has five other members: Paulina, who sells groceries; Mirna, who sells shoes; Oralia, who sells perfumes; Gloria, who sells clothes, and Cinthya, who sells perfume.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 47 años es una valiente mujer, pues se separó de su esposo hace un año, ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo cuida a 2 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Bellavista. Fue difícil superar los 20 años de compromiso con su esposo, pero eso no la desanima; al contrario le brinda fuerzas para salir adelante. “Me gusta trabajar en el campo, disfruto de ello”, menciona con alegría. Pues hace 15 años comenzó a sembrar arveja, maíz y habas. En los primeros años alquilaba los terrenos productivos donde sembraba, pero con su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo comprar unos propios. Además recibe el apoyo de su hijo, quien trabaja en el arado de la tierra con los dos toros que posee, ahí le pagan S/. 70 soles diarios, por lo que tiene una ganancia extra. Ahora se concentra en su cosecha de habas, como también en mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Teodosia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el mejoramiento del piso de su casa, asimismo en el techado y cercado de su patio.
texts.en:
47-year-old Teodosia is a courageous woman who separated from her husband a year ago.  The couple have four children and she cares for two of them in her own home which is located in the town of Bellavista.  It was difficult to get over the 20 years of commitment she had with her husband but she is not discouraged.  On the contrary, it gives her the strength to get ahead in life.  "I like working in the fields, I enjoy it", she says cheerfully.  

Teodosia started growing peas, corn and beans 15 years ago.  During the first years, she rented the land where she sowed her crops but, through her work and effort, she was able to buy some land of her own.  She also has the support of her son who works plowing land with two bulls that he owns.  He is paid 70 soles a day and this gives them a little extra income.  Teodosia is currently concentrating on harvesting her beans and improving her quality of life.

This is Teodosia's first loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your support so that she can continue achieving her goals.  She pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  With your support, Teodosia will invest the money she has requested in improving the flooring in her home.  She will also improve her roof and enclose her yard.

loans.use: to buy materials to lay some flooring, improve her roof and enclose her yard

loans.name: San Silvestre (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal San Silvestre que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio del mismo nombre en la parroquia Crucita, este lugar es conocido por estar muy cerca de dos de las mejores playas de Manabí como son Crucita y San Jacinto lo que lo hacen un lugar de muchos encantos turísticos.
 
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les va a servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos pueden mejorar sus pequeños, se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Eufracia tiene 52 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos, 6 de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el menor de 14 años el mismo que estudia en colegio, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para ganar el sustento diario y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a vender comida los fines de semana, estos días son muy visitados por los turistas que acuden a este lugar para pasar momentos de diversión cerca del mar, allí en su casa instala un pequeño comedor en el cual prepara deliciosos platos en especial los que son con mariscos ya que esto es lo más típico de la zona, en su trabajo le ayuda una de sus hijos que vive con ella. Lleva con su negocio ya por dos años y le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar mariscos y víveres para preparar los alimentos.  Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante frente al mar.
texts.en:
The San Silvestre communal bank meets every fifteen days in a district of the same name, in the parish of Crucita. This area is well known as being very near two of the best beaches in the province of Manabi, the beaches of Crucita and San Jacinto, which make this a very inviting tourist area.

This is a group of people who decided to join together and form this communal bank which has served them well, as they are able to improve their small businesses with the loans. They work in areas such as agriculture and general trade, among others.

Sra. Eufracia is 52, married and has seven children, six of whom are already adults. The youngest is 14 years old and still in secondary school. Two of her sons still live with her. Her husband is a farmer.

She is a wonderful homemaker who, in order to earn an income and help her husband with household expenses, sells food on weekends. These days many tourists come to this area to enjoy themselves near the ocean and she has installed a small canteen in her house where she prepares delicious dishes, especially those with seafood, since this is most typical of the area. One of the sons living with her, helps her. She has done this work for two years and it is going well.

Eufracia will use the loan to buy seafood and other supplies to prepare the meals. She has been a member of the communal bank since its inception and likes the help she receives.

Her dream is to have a fine ocean front restaurant one day.

loans.use: to buy seafood and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria Nelis

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de ropa y medicina, vive con su esposo y un hijo, sus padres también dependen de ella, estos negocios le ayudan para cubrir de las ganancias las necesidades del hogar.
Ella invertirá un préstamo en blusas, ropa interior, ropa de niños y además comprar medicamentos como antibióticos, analgésicos, vitaminas para fortalecer el negocio, ella vende todos los días en lugares aledaños.
La aspiración de María es tener sus negocios bien fortalecidos, ganar muchos clientes, para comercializar y tener ganancias para la alimentación del hogar.
texts.en:
María sells clothes and medicine.  She lives with her husband and her child.  Her parents are also dependent upon her.  The income from these businesses helps her to cover the household necessities.

She will use the loan to buy blouses, underwear, and children’s clothes.  She will also buy medicine like antibiotics, analgesics, and vitamins in order to strengthen her business.  She sells every day in surrounding areas.

María’s goal is to increase her businesses and to gain a lot of customers.  She wants this in order to sell and have income to feed her household.

loans.use: to buy underwear and children's clothes.

loans.name: Nola

texts.es: Nola, de 38 años es una mujer admirable. Está casada desde hace 7 años con Arturo, su esposo, producto de su amor nació Jhems, su hijo; al que cuida en una casa alquilada; ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Su vida se centra en mantener la armonía familiar, ama a su hijo y a su esposo quienes son su razón para seguir adelante. Hace algunos años comenzó a ejercer la profesión de obstetra en un puesto de salud de la localidad de Acobamba, donde recibe un sueldo mensual por su servicio. Gusta de atender a las futuras madres y brindarles todo el cuidado posible; además recibe el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al trasporte público en las rutas Tarma-Acobamba, con lo que pueden salir adelante, ya que ambos apoyan en la economía del hogar. “Mis padres son agricultores, por eso yo también heredé ese oficio”, menciona Nola mientras cuenta con detalle que en sus tiempos libres, se dedica a sembrar alimentos de temporada en los terrenos agrícolas de sus padres. Con su trabajo y dedicación logró adquirir un auto y pagar los estudios de su hijo. Ahora desea seguir sembrando y juntar mayor capital de trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Nola comenzará a sembrar en esta temporada maíz; por ello de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
38-year-old Nola is an admirable woman.  She has been married to her husband Arturo for seven years and their son Jhems was born as a product of their love.  She cares for her son in a rental house which is located in the city of Tarma.

Nola's life centers around maintaining family harmony.  She loves her son and her husband who are her reason for getting ahead in life.  Some years ago, Nola started working as an obstetrician at a health clinic in the town of Acobamba.  She receives a monthly salary for her service.  Nola enjoys working with future mothers, providing them with all the care she can.  She also receives support from her husband who provides a public transport service on the Tarma-Acobamba route.  They are able to get ahead in life because they both support their household financially.  "My parents are farmers and this is why I also inherited this business" says Nola, who she tells us in detail about how she spends her free time growing seasonal food on her parents' farmland.  Through her work and commitment, Nola has managed to buy a car and pay for her son's education.  Now she would like to continue growing her crops and putting together more working capital.

Nola is a member of the "Virgen de Fátima" community bank and this is her first loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your support so that she can achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  This season, Nola will start sowing corn.  With your support, she will invest the money she has requested in buying natural fertilizers so that she can make a successful start to her upcoming sowing season.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers

loans.name: José Dimas

texts.es:
Don José tiene 29 años de edad, tiene una compañera de vida y dos hijos. Él es un hombre luchador que desde pequeño ha trabajado. Con su esfuerzo logró ayudarle a su mamá a sacar adelante a sus cuatro hermanos.  

Él empezó a trabajar a la edad de 12 años como ayudante de panadería. Cuando ya había aprendido bien el oficio se desempeñó como panadero. Esta actividad la desempeñó por dos años. 

A la edad de 14 años decide aprender el oficio de enderezado y pintura de autos.  Desde entonces esa es su fuente de ingresos. Para realizar el trabajo de sus clientes, don José tiene que viajar aproximadamente una hora cada semana a una ciudad a adquirir los materiales que necesita. Él quiere seguir adelante y mejorar cada día, por lo que solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar materiales y herramientas (un compresor y una pistola de pintar). Con esa inversión el podrá hacer trabajo de pintura de mayor calidad y así atraer más clientes.

En un futuro don José desea poder comprar un terreno para construir su casa. De ésta manera le brindará a su familia una vida digna, ya que el manifiesta que sus hijos merecen lo mejor.
texts.en:
José, 29, has a life partner and two children.  He’s a very hardworking man who has worked since childhood.  With his effort he was able to help his mother raise his four siblings.

He started working at the age of 12 as a helper in a bakery.  When he had learned this occupation well he worked as a baker.  He did this job for two years.

At the age of 14 he decided to learn to do auto body repair and auto painting.  Since then, this is his source of income.  In order to do his customers’ jobs, José has to travel approximately an hour each week to a city to get the materials he needs.  He wants to continue forward improving every day so is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy supplies and tools (a compressor and paint gun).  With this investment, he will be able to do higher quality paint jobs and attract more customers that way.

In the future, José wants to be able to buy a lot to build his house in order to provide his family with a proper life because he states that his children deserve the best.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for auto body and paint work.

loans.name: Dios Es Bueno 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Clarita is one of the members in the group called Dios Es Bueno 4 & 5 (God is Great). She makes her home here in a simple structure with four children and her long-term partner. She plans to continue enjoying church and being at home with her family. 

Clarita is excited to be taking her second  loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for one and a half years, starting out with some savings she had accumulated. She decided to began a loan with Esperanza International and the group because she was needing capital for her business. Before the loan she was looking for a way to find money and invest in her business, but she could not find it. 

Clarita plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing snacks, candies, cookies, etc. She is running a candy stall, in front of her house and she used to carry it to the local school and sell to the kids. She will use the profits to invest in her business. She would like to have an improved business and to travel to different countries.

Her group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, surrounded by sugar cane fields, where many Haitians have emigrated to work in the sugar cane industry. This group is composed of Haitians and Dominican members. This city economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry.

loans.use: to buy snacks and sweets to resell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El sr. Pedro es agricultor, nació  en Chuquisaca, convine  con la Sra. Juana,  ella es ama de casa, tiene cuatro hijos todos menores de edad. Actualmente viven y trabajan en cañada Strongert  distante a 25 km de la localidad de Santa Rita, hace 12 años que ellos se dedican a la agricultura. El destino del crédito es para la siembra de sandia y mantenimiento de yuca y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra,  Ellos vienen trabajando hace cuatro secuencias con Emprender por que es la única institución que le ha dado una mano para poder aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Sr. Pedro is a farmer. He was born in Chuquisaca and lives with Sra. Juana. Juana is a housewife and they have four young children. They currently live and work in Cañada Strongert, 25 km from Santa Rita. They have been farmers for twelve years. This loan will be used for planting watermelon and maintaining the yucca crop; this means preparing the land. They have worked with Emprender for four cycles, because it is the only institution that has offered them help in increasing their working capital.

loans.use: to sow watermelon and maintain yucca crops.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, se dedica a la venta de carne de res y cerdo, vive con su esposo y una hija de 13 años de edad quien estudia, también vive con ellos un tío de 73 años de edad, con su trabajo ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante.
Actualmente quiere invertir en la compra de cerdos y una vaquilla, estos los necesita para destazar y salir a vender a la zona, para proveer a sus familiares el sustento necesario.
Su aspiración es comprar un vehículo pick up, para transportar la carne y salir a vender a otras zonas, con mejores oportunidades de venta.
texts.en:
Lucia sells beef and pork.  He lives with his wife and his 13 year old daughter who goes to school.  His 73 year old uncle also lives with him.  Through his work he has managed to get his family ahead.

He currently wants to buy pigs and a heifer.  He needs them in order to butcher them and sell them in the neighborhood.  He will do this in order to provide sustenance for his family.

His goal is to buy a pick-up truck in order to transport the meat and go to other neighborhoods to sell.  This will give him better opportunities to sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs and a heifer.

loans.name: Zoila Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es admirada por su arquitectura, visitada por la naturaleza y gastronomía, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus ancestros.
 
Doña Zoila tiene 50 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 26, 23, 19 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas son casadas e independientes, su hijo de 19 años es soltero, trabaja y vive independientemente, su ultima hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive es fruto de su trabajo y sacrificio.

La Señora. Zoila es de profesión costurera, tiene un taller de costura 8 años y se dedica a realizar delantales, sus productos los vende en los días de feria y trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela, botones, hilos y cierres para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es crecer en su negocio y tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
Señora Zoila is a member of the Feria Libre communal bank. She lives in the outskirts of Cuenca city, a city admired for its architecture and visited for its nature and gastronomy. Its people maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Zoila is 50, widowed, and has 4 children ages 26, 23, 19 and 9. Her two oldest daughters are married and independent. Her 19-year-old son is single and works and lives independently. Her youngest daughter attends school in the city. Zoila lives in her own home, thanks to her hard work and sacrifice.

Zoila is a seamstress. She has had a workshop for eight years and she makes aprons. She sells her products on market days and works Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule.

She has been a member of the communal bank for four years. She will invest her new loan in the purchase of fabric, thread and clasps in order to continue with her business.

Her goal is to grow in her business and have a bigger workshop.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, buttons, threads and clasps.

loans.name: Guadalupe De Reyes Group

texts.es:
El señor Joel tiene la edad 59 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, esta casado con el señora Celia que es ama de casa, con la  cual tiene 1 hija y una nieta, el vive en una  zona cañera.

Don Joel nos platica que desde hace 7 años decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de abarrotes porque se vio en la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia y mas ahora que ya tiene una nieta la cual cuidar como si fuera su hija, tambien nos comenta que apesar de estar enfermo de una pierna el no se da por vencido y sigue trabajando para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El realiza sus venta de abarrotes desde la comodida de su casa, en una parte de su hogar tiene un pequeño espacio donde pone sobre unas tablas y una mesa los productos  que le vende , tambien nos dice que siempre busca tener todo lo que le piden para ganar dia a dia mas clientes.

Don Joel necesita este credito para la compra de arroz, huevo, aceite, dulces, sabritas, pan, refrescos, jugos, gelatina en polvo, productos enlatados, frijol, cloro, jabon, detergente, jabon en polvo para su posterior venta.

El espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere pues desea que su negocio cresca, y pueda darle un mejor futuro darle una mejor vida a sus nieta.

Don Joel es miembro de un grupo el cual esta formado por diez intengrantes. Los demas integrantes son:

Ana Karina-cosmeticos 
Crecencia-abarrotes 
Dorotea-ropa 
Juaquina-valconeria
Arturo-carpinteria
Alberto-antojitos mexicanos
Gertrudis-refrescos
Rosa-venta de antojitos
Dorotea-venta de antojitos mexicanos
texts.en:
Señor Joel is 59. He did not have the chance to study. He is married to Señora Celia, a housewife, and they have one daughter and one granddaughter. Joel lives in a sugarcane zone.

Joel tells us that he decided to start his own grocery store business seven years ago because he saw the need to get his family ahead. This is even more important now that he has a granddaughter, whom he cares for as if she were his own daughter. He also tells us that even though he has a problem with one leg, he hasn't given up and he is still working to give his family a better quality of life.

He sells his groceries from the comfort of his own home. In part of his house he has a small space where he lays out his products on some stands and a table. He also tells us that he always tries to have everything that his customers ask for in order to have more customers every day.

Joel needs this loan to buy rice, eggs, oil, candies, Sabrita snacks, bread, drinks, juice, powdered Jell-O, canned goods, beans, bleach, soap, detergent, and powdered soap for his next sale.

He hopes that his business will prosper with this investment because he wants it to grow. He hopes to be able to offer his granddaughter a better future and a better life.

Joel is a member of a group made up of ten members. They are:

Ana Karina- Cosmetics
Crecencia- Groceries
Dorotea- Clothing 
Juaquina- Metal work
Arturo- Carpentry
Alberto- Mexican fast food
Gertrudis- Drinks
Rosa- Fast food sales
Dorotea- Mexican fast food sales

loans.use: to sell groceries

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: La señora Jovita,  es una cliente antigua que trabaja con la institución hace 5 años,  demostró un trato amable y Cortez en la avaluación, la Sra. Jovita vive en la zona Alto Llojeta, ella vive en anticrético, la Sra. Jovita, se dedica a la venta de te café y mates acompañado de pan y sándwich, esta sacando crédito para la compra de azúcar por mayor y otros insumos para la elaboración de sus desayunos, tiene su puesto de venta en una de las zonas mas concurridas de la ciudad de la Paz, ella vende  las 16:30 a 20:30 todos los días, ella tiene un hijo que todavía esta en colegio, con el tiempo esta pensando en comprar una casa razón por la cual trabaja esforzadamente en su negocio.
texts.en: Jovita is a long-standing client who has been working with our institution for five years. She showed herself to be kind and polite during her evaluation. Jovita lives in Alto Llojeta neighborhood. She lives in 'anticrético' (a rental system used in Bolivia). Jovita's business is selling tea, coffee and maté infusions together with bread and sandwiches. She is taking out a loan to buy sugar and other supplies wholesale so that she can make her food. She has a stall in one of the busiest areas of the city of La Paz. She serves her customers from 4.30pm to 8.30pm every day. Jovita has a son who is still in school. Over time, she is planning to buy a house. For this reason, she works very hard in her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, milk and other products wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Elsa Cristina

texts.es:
La Señorita Elsa es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar es de clima frió, se caracteriza por sus campos llenos de sembríos, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señorita. Elsa tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 3 años de edad, vive con su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, la casa en la que habita es propia de sus padres.

Nuestra socia es de profesión costurera, esta actividad aprendió estudiando y reforzó sus conocimientos con el trabajo, ahora en su casa se dedica a realizar bordados. Como pasa en casa también trabaja en su tienda la cual tiene hace un año y allí labora de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia y crecer más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Feria Libre community bank.  She lives on the outskirts of the parish of Cumbe, which is a cold area filled with cultivated fields.  Her people maintain the culture and traditions of their villages; they trade, raise animals, and farm.
 
Elsa is 24 years old.  She is the single mother of a three-year-old girl, and she lives with her mother, with whom she shares the household expenses.  The house belongs to her parents.

By profession, Elsa is a seamstress.  She studied this trade and built up her knowledge through her work.  Now she makes embroidery at home.  Since she does this from home, she opened a shop a year ago, and she works there everyday from 7 am to 7 pm.

This is her second loan, and she will invest it  in buying rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, and other staples for her shop.

Her goal is to have her own house and to see her business grow further.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, and other staples.

loans.name: Maria Sarbelia

texts.es:
Sarbelia, administra un cafetín donD. venD. pupusas y bebidas, vive con su esposo y su hijo, el negocio tiene más D. 21 años D. existir y lo atienD. todos los días D. la semana por las tardes, el negocio lo heredo D. su madre.
Solicita un préstamo la compra D. bebidas como sodas, jugos, chicharrón, quesillo, pollo, condimentos, este préstamo le ayuda a incrementar el negocio disponiendo D. productos y atender a más clientes para garantizar los ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Ella quiere hacer mejoras a la vivienda a través del negocio, por eso busca apoyo en préstamo para alcanzar sus objetivos mediante el crecimiento del negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Sarbelia lives with her husband and son, and manages a small cafe where she sells pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) and drinks. The cafe has existed for over 21 years and she serves there every day of the week, in the evening. Maria Sarbelia inherited the business from her mother. 

Maria Sarbelia applied for this loan in order to purchase drinks such as sodas and juices, as well as pork, cheese, chicken, and condiments. The loan will help increase business, providing her with produce and allowing her to serve more customers, thus guaranteeing an income to support her family. 

With the income earned from running her cafe, Maria Sarbelia wants to make improvements to her home. Therefore she is seeking the support of a loan to achieve her goals through the growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase drinks such as sodas and juices, as well as pork, cheese, chicken, and condiments

loans.name: María Manuela

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar es de clima frió, se caracteriza por sus campos llenos de sembríos, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Doña María tiene 59 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, 8 de ellos son casados e independiente, su último hijo es soltero y está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando los servicios de su vehículo, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María es comerciante y hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas, labora ambulantemente en un mercado de la ciudad. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y aves de corral las que son para su consumo y para la venta.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 12 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de frutas y verduras para crecer en esta actividad.

Su meta es crecer cada vez más en el negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Feria Libre community bank.  She lives on the outskirts of the parish of Cumbe, which is a cold area known for its cultivated fields.  Its people maintain the culture and traditions of their villages; they trade, raise animals, and farm.

Doña María is 59 years old.  She is married and has raised nine children, who are all adults.  Eight of them are married and independent, while her youngest son is single and is a student at a college in the city.  Her husband is a driver by profession and rents out his vehicle and services.  They own the house in which they live.

Maria has been in the fruit and vegetable trade for ten years.  She walks around selling her goods in a market in the city.  At home, she also raises guinea pigs and fowl, which are for eating and for selling.

She has been a member of the community bank for twelve years, and she will invest the funds from her latest loan in buying fruit and vegetables to increase her business.

Her goal is to see her business grow more and more.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, bread, eggs, and oil for the business.

loans.name: Un Futuro Brillante Group

texts.es:
La señora Salome tiene la edad de 62 años, estudio la primaria,esta casada con el señor Demetrio que trabaja en el campo, tiene 7 hijos los cuales ya estan casados, ella y su familia viven en region cañera.

Doña Salome nos platica que desde hace  10 años decidio iniciar con propio negocio de venta de zapatos porque  queria sacar adelante a sus hijos y  ayudar a se esposo con los gastos del hogar, ahora que sus hijos son mayores trabaja para tener una mejor vida ella junto a su esposo.

Ella realiza sus venta de zapatos saliendo a caminar casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos pero tambien sale a otras comunidades cercanas a su comunidad, les muestra sus catalogos, levanta pedidos, cuando tiene varios pedidos sale  a compralos, posteriormente los entrega y recibe el pago por sus productos. 

Doña Salome necesita este credito para la compra de catalogos y zapatos para su posterior venta.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio pospere, tambien nos comenta que se encuentra muy contenta por la confianza que fundacion le a otorgado.

Doña Salome pertenece a un grupo conformado por seis personas llamado un futuro brillante, ellos llamaron asi a este grupo porque tienen puestas en sus negocios la espera de prosperar y poder dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias, las demas integrantes son:

Edith y luisa  que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos, Abigail Y Maria Adriana a la venta de Zapateria y Angela a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Señora Salome is 62 years old, and studied up to primary-school level.  She is married to Señor Demetrio, who works in the fields.  She has seven children who are all married.  She and her family live in a sugar-cane growing region.

Doña Salome shares with us that 10 years ago, she decided to start her own business selling shoes, because she wanted to move her children ahead in life and support her husband with the household expenses.  Now that her children are grown, she works to provide a better quality of life for herself and her husband.

She sells her shoes door-to-door to her friends and neighbors, but she also goes to other nearby communities where she shows her catalogs and takes orders.  When she has several orders, she goes to buy the items,  She later delivers them and receives payment for her products.

Doña Salome needs this loan to pay for catalogs and shoes for later sale.

She hopes that her business will prosper with this investment.  She also tells us that she is very happy about the trust that the foundation is putting in her.

Doña Salome belongs to a group made of 6 women; it is called "Un Futuro Brillante" ("A Brilliant Future").  They chose this name for the group because they hope for their businesses to prosper, and to be able to provide a better quality of life for their families.

The other members are Edith and Luisa, who sell Mexican snacks; Abigail and Maria Adriana, who sell shoes; and Angela who sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy catalogs and shoes for later sale.

loans.name: Aligda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aligda, se dedica a la compra y crianza de cerdos, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 8 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres; Ella realiza esta actividad desde hace 5 años, comenzó por iniciativa propia, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 5:00pm, hasta la fecha se ha mantenido en el trabajo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos cerdos, estos son para criarlos y luego ponerlos a la venta, esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y generar más ganancia.
Su objetivo es mantenerse en el negocio, contar con esta fuente de ingreso ya que tiene que estar pendiente de los gastos de su hijo y apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Aligda devotes herself to buying and raising pigs. She is a single mother who has an eight-year-old daughter and lives with her parents. She has been in this business for five years and began by her own initiative. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. and has stayed in business all this time. 

She is seeking a loan to buy two pigs she plans to raise and later put up for sale. This investment will help her to strengthen the business and generate more income. 

Her objective is to stay in business and have this source of income to rely on since she must be responsible for her son's expenses and support her parents.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs.

loans.name: Jose Edilberto

texts.es:
José, se dedica a prestar servicio como motorista de una moto taxi, dando el transporte a las personas del lugar, vive junto a su esposa y una hija de 6 años de edad, él trabaja desde hace dos años en su propio medio de transporte, todos los días de la semana de 6:00am a 6:00pm.
Actualmente necesita comprar láminas, cemento, ladrillo y demás materiales de construcción, esta compra le ayudara para iniciar la construcción de su pequeña casa, donde pueda tener a su familia, dándoles mayor seguridad y comodidad.
El objetivo de José es que su familia se encuentre bien, que gocen de salud y que hoy cuenten con una casa propia.
texts.en:
José devotes himself to providing services as the driver of a moto-taxi, giving rides to people from the area. He lives with his wife and a six-year-old daughter. He has worked for two years with his own means of transport, every day of the week from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Currently he needs to purchase sheeting, cement, bricks and other construction materials, a purchase which will help him begin construction on the small house where he would have his family, giving them greater safety and comfort. 

José's objective is that his family would be well, in good health, and that now they may have their own home.

loans.use: to purchase sheeting, cement and brick.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, detergents and toothpaste.

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Ilusión está formado por 14 socias quienes son amigas y vecinas, son mujeres trabajadoras y muy luchadoras que laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten ser independientes económicamente y al mismo tiempo pueden aportar a la economía de sus hogares. Viven por la parroquia de Cumbe, este  lugar es de clima frió, tiene una gran riqueza cultural y su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad especialmente los jóvenes.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora. Ana Victoria, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, tiene 43 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 26, 20, 17, 10 y 8 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan para solventar para sus gastos, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio,  sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres pero de manera independiente.

Doña Ana Victoria se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y  a  criar cuyes, pollos, cerdos y ganado a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. También se dedica a la agricultura que es para su consumo y en días de ferias vende café con tamales y comida rápida en su comunidad. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, pollos y víveres para continuar con el negocio de venta de comida rápida.
 
Su meta es darles  a sus hijos una buena educación para que se superen y realizar su casa propia.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una de las socias que por motivos personales no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Nueva Ilusión comunal bank is made up of 14 members who are friends and neighbors. They are strong, hardworking women who work in different areas that allow them to be economically independent and at the same time able to contribute to household expenses. They live in the parish of Cumbe, a place with a cold climate and a rich culture, whose people maintain their parents’ traditions. The people work in trade, animal raising and agricultural, with many working in the city, especially the youth.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Ana Victoria, who lives in Cumbe parish. She is 43 years old and a single mother of 5 children, who are 26, 20, 17, 10 and 8 years old.
Her two oldest sons work to help with expenses, her third son is in high school and the two youngest attend a small school in the city. She does not have her own house and lives with her parents, but does so independently.

Ana Victoria takes care of household tasks and raises guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and cattle which she sells when she has some economic need. She is also a subsistence farmer and, during holidays, she sells coffee with tamales and fast food in her community.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and she will use her new loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens and supplies to continue with her business selling fast food.

Her goal is to provide her sons with a good education so they can succeed and also to have her own house.

The small photo attached here is of one of the members who, due to personal reasons, could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens and food supplies.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Antonio le esta haciendo falta el piso de concreto en patio de enfrente de la casa.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el material que, arena y cemento ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejorar en horario adicionales a su empleo.
Don  Antonio elaborar en una fabrica en el aria de producción con este sueldo planea pagar el crédito, ya que su esposa la señora Maria Elena se encargar de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de sus negocio de venta de ropa usada. 
Desea mejorar la viviendo don pronto llegara su primer hijo.
texts.en:
Antonio’s house does not have a concrete floor on the patio in front of his house.  He is requesting a loan to buy the material, sand and cement, because he will make the home improvement by working additional hours at his job.

Antonio works in a factory in the area of production.  He plans to use this salary to pay for the loan.  His wife, Maria Elena, takes care of the family expenses with the income she gets from her business of selling used clothes.

He wishes to make the improvement to his home because his first child will soon arrive.

loans.use: to put down a concrete floor on the patio of his house.

loans.name: Rosa Clotilde

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por una comunidad de la parroquia del Valle, lugar que se caracteriza por su riqueza natural regalándonos bonitos paisajes, su gente es muy cálida y amable, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Doña Rosa tiene 41 años, casada y ha concebido 3 hijos, dos son casados e  independientes y su hija soltera trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo es maestro carpintero y labora en un taller, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa labora como empleada domestica hace 2 meses y trabaja de lunes a sábados todo el día. En su casa  se dedica a la cría de pollos. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y  alimento de anumales para incrementar el negocio.

La meta de nuestra socia es arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Siempre Amigas" communal bank. She lives in the community of Parroquia del Valle. This is a place known for its natural abundance and lovely landscapes. Its inhabitants are warm and friendly, and maintain the culture and traditions of their people. She is a small business owner, raises animals, and farms.

Rosa is 41, married, with three children. Two are married and independent, and her unmarried daughter works, and helps her financially. Her husband is a master carpenter, and works in a workshop. They own the house where they live.  Rosa has been working as a maid for two months; she works from Monday to Saturday, all day long.  She raises chickens in her home.  

She is on her second loan from the communal bank, and she is going to use it to buy pigs and animal feed in order to increase her business. Her goal is to fix her house.

loans.use: To buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: María Florencia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por una comunidad de la parroquia del Valle, lugar que se caracteriza por su riqueza natural regalándonos bonitos paisajes, su gente es muy cálida y amable, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos,  se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora. María tiene 66 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, seis de ellos son casados e independientes su hija soltera trabaja y ayuda económicamente. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad  pero es una casita pequeña.

Doña María se dedica  a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa también se dedica a la cria y venta de cerdos y pollos a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y  lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos y  alimento para animales. 

Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
María is a member of the "Siempre Amigas" communal bank. She lives in the community of Parroquia del Valle. This is a place known for its natural abundance and lovely landscapes. Its inhabitants are warm and friendly, and maintain the culture and traditions of their people. She is a small business owner, raises animals, and farms.

María is 66, a widow, and has 7 children. All of them are adults. Six of them are married and independent. Her unmarried daughter works, and helps her financially.  She owns the house where she lives, but it is a rather small house.  

Marie works at her household chores, and as she stays home, she also works raising and selling pigs and chickens, which she sells when she has any financial need. This is her fourth loan with the communal bank, and she is going to use it to buy pigs, chickens, and animal feed.  Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: To buy chickens, pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: El señor Manuel Antonio se dedica al transporte escolar de esta misma ciudad desde hace 6 años, trasladando a los estudiantes de primaria y preescolar desde su casa hacia la escuela y viceversa. En este momento el camión donde transporta a los niños necesita mantenimiento por eso quiere un préstamo para comprar las partes que necesita y pagar al mecánico que le hará el trabajo. Manuel Antonio desea tener su unidad en mejores condiciones para ofrecer a los niños mejor servicio y los padres mayor seguridad. De esta manera se prevendrá de tener un accidente a causa de un problema técnico. Para Manuel es muy importante tener el transporte en buenas condiciones por que su fuente de ingresos más fuerte que recibe, aparte trabaja en maquiladora para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio has been operating  a school bus in this city for six years, transporting primary and pre-school students from their homes to school and back.

At this time, the bus he uses to transport children needs maintenance. That is why he wants a loan to buy the parts he needs, and to pay the mechanic who will do the work.

Manuel Antonio wants his vehicle to be in better condition, in order to provide better service to the children, and a greater sense of security to parents. In this way, he will prevent an accident due to a technical problem. For Manuel, it is very important to have his vehicle in good condition because it is his main source of income.  

He also works in a "maquiladora" (factory that manufactures goods for export) in order to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To maintain his school bus.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: La señora Magdalena es una mujer emprendedora que le gusta el negocio por tal motivo pensó en poner su tienda de abarrotes en la cual se podría desarrollar como una buena negociante. Con la tienda ya tiene 6 años ofreciendo a su clientela una buena atención, un mejor servicio y buena calidad en productos. Desde que comenzó su negocio vio que daba resultados e ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, en este momento la familia esta atravesando por una situación que esta fuera de alcance ya que su esposo enfermo de Diabetes, en algunas veces no sale a trabajar por que se siente mal y tiene que estar en reposo. Para Magdalena es muy importante comprar mercancía como lo es refrescos, botanas, tortillas, lácteos y abarrotes para el negocio para seguir generando ingresos, de esta manera apoyar a su esposo para que no se preocupe por la estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Magdalena is an enterprising woman who likes business.  For this reason, she thought about setting up her grocery store, in which she could develop into a good business person.  She has had the store for six years now, providing great service to her clientele, and good quality products.

Since she began her business, she has seen it make a profit, and provide income to support her husband with the household expenses. At this time the family is going through a situation that is hard to deal with, as her husband has become sick with diabetes. Sometimes he doesn't go to work, because he feels unwell, and has to rest.
