For Magdalena it is very important to buy merchandise such as soft drinks, snacks, tortillas, dairy products, and groceries for the business, in order to continue generating income, and in this way provide support to her husband, so that he doesn't worry about their financial situation.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her business.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: María Cristina desde ya hace tiempo compro a un familiar la vivienda donde vive actualmente. Con el tiempo le fue construyendo y realizando algunas mejora cuartos para que la casa se viera en buenas condiciones. Con ahorros levantaron en la planta alta un cuarto pero por falta de capital no han podido poner la losa. A Maria Cristina le gustaría ya comenzar habitar ese cuarto ya que será la recamara principal para ella y su esposo y así ampliar la cocina y sala en la planta baja de su casa, de esta manera ofrecer a su familia mejor espacio.
texts.en:
Some time ago, María Cristina bought the house where she is currently living, from a family member.  Over time, she has been gradually working on it, and undertaking some improvements, so that the house could be in better shape.  

With savings, they built a room on the upper floor, but due to lack of funds, they haven't been able to complete the concrete slab roof.  Maria Cristina would now like to live in that room, since it will be the main bedroom for her and her husband, and that way they can expand the kitchen and living room on the lower floor of their house.  This way she can provide a better living space for her family.

loans.use: To install a concrete slab roof.

loans.name: Cherlyn

texts.en:
Cherlyn is 37 years old and lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has two school-aged children. 

Cherlyn has a motorcycle transport business. This has been operated by her husband for over five years and fortunately provides at least the day-to-day needs of the household and the minimal school expenses of their children.  Each month, she earns approximately PHP 7,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to repair a transport vehicle for a better service. 

Cherlyn has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. She was able to repay the previous loans made in the cooperative. In the future, Cherlyn expects to resume the business operation soon to sustain daily needs. She also plans to improve the house to live comfortably.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle.

loans.name: Marchie

texts.en:
Marchie is a single lady. She is 29 years old and lives in the village of Gata Daku in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Marchie helps her family members in financing and working on their business of planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has spent three years of her life doing this kind of job. She is also working in a private company and earns just enough to cover personal and other minor expenses. At the end of the month, she earns approximately PHP 10,000.  She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 at GDMPC to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.
 
Marchie has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. This is her fourth loan cycle in the cooperative. 

In the future, Marchie hopes for a good return of investment and to gain more income for the family. She further plans to own a condominium that could be a source of income and to become stable financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 53 years old and lives in Maquilao, Tangub City, Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Marites owns and operates a retail store at home to earn a living. She has been selling basic commodities like rice, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, etc. for over 10 years. Her spouse goes fishing very often to support the everyday needs of the family. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,000 from store operations. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 from GDMPC to invest in expanding her store inventory.

Marites has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. This will be her fourth loan cycle with GDMPC. She repaid in full the previous loans made. 

In the future, Marites hopes to expand product coverage and improve her business further. She also plans to purchase a new pump boat (an outrigger canoe with a small motor) for fishing to increase cash inflows for the family.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the store inventory.

loans.name: Sahara

texts.en:
Sahara is 40 years old and married with 10 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Sahara has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years, and also earns income from buying and selling copra and rice grains.

Sahara aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 51 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 20 years, and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, noodles, etc. In the future, Jocelyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en:
Rodella is 36 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rodella is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rodella has been raising pigs for 24 years, and also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business and working as a dealer of beauty products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 62 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for resale, like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Editha has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, canned goods, spices, soft drinks, etc. In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to resell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 53 years old and married with seven children. Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Edna has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store  for a year and also earns an income from raising pigs. Edna aspires to save enough in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 52 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has two grown children. 

To earn a living, Cecilia has a business selling assorted snacks, such as banana cue (sweetened, deep-fried bananas), hot dogs, hotcakes and many others, in the local community. Often, her children help in preparing the foods and inviting customers to buy. The business is a supplement to her everyday needs. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. Cecilia has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase raw materials needed in the snack vending business.

Cecilia is a current GDMPC member. In the future, Cecilia hopes to accumulate a good sum of money out from this investment from the cooperative and expand the range of products she sells to maintain her daily needs. She expects to take another loan after repaying the current amount drawn out.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed in her snack vending business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is married and has two children. Rosario is 48 years old and lives in Corales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling most of the basic necessities for a household. She has run the business for over five years. Every month, she gets approximately PHP 3,000 from store operations.

Her husband is a motorcycle driver.  

She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy a large number of products to sell.

Rosario has been a member of GDMPC since 2005.  All previous loans she took out from the cooperative were repaid in full. This is her 11th loan request. 

In the future, Rosario hopes to expand and improve her product offerings to gain more income and sustain business operations.

loans.use: To buy a large number of products to sell.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 50 year old, married and has two children who are in school.

Felomina is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Felomina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Felomina has been farming sugarcane for 12 years, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felomina would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 73 years old and is a widow with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a rice vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Florita has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Florita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old and married with four children. Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Gina has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for a year and also earns an income from selling rice.

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a 40-year-old married mother of six, works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years she has been buying and selling charcoal, and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Having previously received and repaid 11 loans from NWTF, Grace is now requesting a loan of PHP 20000 to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lyndie

texts.en:
Lyndie is married and has four school-aged children. Lyndie is 48 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

She is a cellphone load retailer, accommodating all networks like Smart, Globe and Sun cellular. Her customers keep on coming for she treats them very well and befriends them, and not because of the business alone: By nature she is really good. 

The prime source of income comes from her husband's earnings on driving. She has had the business for over 10 years and each month, she earns PHP 5,000 approximately. She has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to purchase big amount of cellphone loads for retail. 

Lyndie has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. This is her fifth loan cycle with GDMPC. In the future, Lyndie hopes to stabilize the business for a long period of time and plans to begin another small business to improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a big amount of cellphone loads for retail.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is married and has four school-aged children. She is 49 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a motorcycle driver on whom the family relies primarily for their day-to-day needs.

Asuncion sells several snack items in the local community to earn a living. She sells rice cakes, sweetened rice, hotcakes, cassava cakes, breads and more. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase raw materials used in making snacks to sell.

Asuncion is a current member of GDMPC. This is her first loan transaction with GDMPC. 

In the future, Asuncion hopes to expand her product offerings and own a small food stall in a school or in a trading site where there is a potential of gaining more income to support the children's education and provide stability for the business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials used in making snacks to sell.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 37 лет, разведена, и воспитывает двух детей – годовалого сына Нурэл и дочь Перизат, которая учится в 1 классе. Источником дохода семьи является животноводство, начатое Эльмирой со стартовым капиталом в сумме 6,000 сом (KGS) и приносящее на сегодняшний день около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эльмира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом для покупки бычков для откорма. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для заготовки корма и сена на зиму.
texts.en: Elmira is 37 years old, divorced and is raising two children - one-year-old son Nurel and daughter Perizat, who is in first grade.  Animal husbandry, which Elmira began with the starting capital of 6,000 som (KGS) and brings about 12,000 som (KGS) per month today from sales of milk and meat products, is the family's source of income.  In order to further develop her business, Elmira requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company for the purchase of bulls for fattening up.  She plans to use the income from the loan to prepare livestock feed and hay for the winter.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is married and has five children. Nilo is 54 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Nilo has a wood charcoal manufacturing business. He has had this business for three years. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 7,000. 

He has requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to purchase wood for the manufacturing of wood charcoal for his business. Nilo has been a member of PMPC for one year.

In the future, Nilo hopes to provide for the needs of his family and send his children to college.

loans.use: To purchase wood for the manufacturing of charcoal for his business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 45 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Janet has a business selling fish. She earns about PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. Janet has a requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase fish for her  fish vending.

Janet has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.  In the future, Janet would like to have a space in the market to display her fish. Janet is a good mother and loving wife. She is a hard working, and she takes good care of her family. Janet is proud of herself as a member of PMPC because they can help her family in terms of financial problems.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her  fish vending.

loans.name: Karamat

texts.ru: Карамат 64 года, вдова и имеет двух взрослых сыновей. Карамат начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве в 1995 году и в 2010 году взяла свой первый кредит в компании «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» в сумме 60,000 сом на увеличение поголовья скота. Кредит был использован по назначению и выплачен без просрочек, что говорит об исполнительности и упорстве Карамат.  На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Карамат насчитывается 10 баранов и 3 коровы с теленком. Также она выращивает картошку, морковь, кукурузу и подсолнечник, урожай Карамат продает на местных рынках.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Карамат повторно обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и корма для них.
texts.en: Karamat is 64 years old, a widow and has two grown children.  She started her animal husbandry and farming business in 1995 and obtained her first loan in the sum of 60,000 som from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to increase livestock quantity in 2010.  The loan was used as directed and repaid without any delays, which speaks of Karamat's diligence and persistence.  Today, Karamat has 10 sheep and 3 cows with calves.  She also grows potatoes, carrots, corn and sunflowers and sells the harvest at local markets.  In order to further develop her business, Karamat requested another loan from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of bulls and feed for them.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and livestock feed

loans.name: Kembang Kertas Group

texts.en:
Kembang Kertas group is made up of suburban residents who mostly have a trading business and raise livestock. One is raising pigs. With the number of members at 10, the group got a loan of Rp.15,000,000. 

Ni Nengah, the head of the group, will  use her share of the loan to buy three local pigs. Pigs will be maintained for two months, then sold again. Profits from the sale will be set aside and the capital will be used to buy more pig. Ni Nengah hopes this effort will be smooth so that she can realize her dream to make her kitchen more spacious.

loans.use: To buy three local pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Abduchabbor

texts.ru: Абдучаббор проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 32 года. Она замужем. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей на рынке. Имеет торговую точку, где продает хозяйственные товары. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже 15 лет. Целью получения кредита является приобретение нового товара для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en: Abduchabbor lives in the town of Isfara.  He is 32 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He is involved in sales at the market.  Abduchabbor has a retail outlet, where he sells household goods.  He has been in this business for 15 years.  The goal of obtaining this loan is a purchase of new merchandise to expand assortment.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise and expand goods assortment

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 30-year-old man and married to Zipora, a 27-year-old lady. Samson and Zipora are blessed with four children named: Marcela, 6, who is studying in the first grade of elementary school, Marshanda, 5, studying in kindergarten; Margareth, 4, and Roy, 3. 

Samson used to run a poultry business for several years, but then this business went bankrupt because the poultry was suffered from disease and all died. In order to cover his family needs, Samson raises chickens to be sold. Currently Samson has six chickens, aged 1 to 6 months. The income from this business is insufficient to fully cover his family needs as well as his children’s educational needs. 

Samson plans to operate the poultry business again. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting IDR 10,000,000. He would like to purchase chicks, feed, and also to repair the cage. He is hoping that TLM is willing to assist him to start up the poultry business again.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, feed, and also to repair the cage.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 46 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with four school-aged children. 

Tessie runs a retail store at home selling assorted items like coffee, milk, soft drinks, "checheria", canned goods, noodles, sugar, salt and other basic necessities needed by everyone. She has had this business for ten years already. It is done on a credit and cash basis.  She earns approximately PHP 1,000 a month from store operations. She has requested a loan  of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to invest in expanding the range products to sell.

Tessie joined the GDMPC family earlier this year. This is the first loan ever she'd made in the cooperative. In the future, Tessie hopes to obtain good return from this investment and acquire enough revolving funds for the business. She plans to expand and improve the current business and offer more products soon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding range of products to sell.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is married with two adult children. She is 65 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Filomena is planting and harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living. She earns from the palm fronds, fruit, husks, shells and logs, too. She has run the business for over 45 long years and each month, she receives a total of PHP 10,000. She has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to invest in expanding her coconut farm to boost business production.
 
Filomena has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. The first two loans made were paid in full. Now she is on her 3rd and expects to have more in the future. For this loan, she hopes to bring in a material sum in return for this investment. She plans to plant additional coconuts in the vacant lots.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her coconut farm.

loans.name: Helfy

texts.en:
Helfy is a 38-year-old entrepreneur who is married to Benyamin, a 41-year-old man. From their marriage they are blessed with two children; they are Reinold, 17 years old, and Wiwin, 15 years old; both are at school. 

Helfy owns a food stall business; it is located about 2 km from her house. She cooks the special menu from pork, such as sate (small pieces of meat roasted on skewer), smoked beef, kidney bean soup, etc. She operates this business from 9 am to 9 pm. Her daughter usually helps her in running this business.  Even though the price of pork in the market is unstable, Helfy is always keen to run her business.   

Helfy is dreaming to improve her business but she does not have enough capital to do so. She heard about TLM and got interested in joining TLM Individual Lending Program; she then applied for this loan and requesting a loan amounting to IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. Helfy would like to spend the loan on pork and cooking spices. She is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application.

loans.use: To purchase pork and cooking spices.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 51 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three grown children. 

Crisanta owns and operates a retail store at home selling various school and office supplies, candies, cigarettes, breads, soft drinks, etc. The children assist her sometimes when not busy at work. She has had this business for over four years and earns approximately PHP 1,600 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell.

Crisanta is a new member of GDMPC. This is her second loan request in the cooperative. In the future, Crisanta  hopes to hold the business for a long period of time and expand product offerings to gain more income and improve general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma, 53, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Eddie, 56, a "jeepney" (small public bus) driver, and a mother to seven children, three of whom are already settled and starting their own families, one studying in college, two in high school, and the youngest in elementary level. By the grace of God and with the help of her supportive husband, she can provide for the needs of her seven children. She is able to do so by means of the small business enterprises that she has ventured into.

One of her business ventures is a small computer arcade or video games rental. In the Philippines especially in urban poor communities, not all families can afford to buy personal computers, portable play stations, or equipment for video games. Children only enjoy this kind of amusement by renting at computer arcades and they pay per hour of usage. Alma has several play station units and she earns Php400 per day. 

Alma also operates a variety store adjacent to her house. It is a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. Alma earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her usual net profit per day is Php800 because her variety store includes mineral water and frozen products like hotdogs, ham, and sausages. 

Another profitable business that she runs is a piggery. She buys several piglets, raises and fattens them, and sells them at their mature age and size. Her usual buyers are owners of meat stalls and slaughterhouses who sell the cut meat per kilo. From this third business, Alma usually earns Php180 a day.      

To help her continue running her businesses, she is requesting a Php 22,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional grocery items and beverages for her variety store, and some electronic devices for her computer arcade. As her businesses get bigger, she expects a boost in her business income and will be able to cover the family’s needs, especially now that she is preparing for the college education of her two high school children.
 
Alma hopes that her small variety store will expand into a mini-grocery, and that she can procure additional play station units to accommodate the children’s demand, especially during summer and Christmas vacation. She also plans to expand her piggery, operate a slaughterhouse and own a meat stall in the market, so she can supply more pork in the community and compete with the commercialized pork dealers. In this way, she can make her meat price more affordable for her neighbors and friends. She works this hard to give her children a good future and to be a good testimony to the community. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cows to re-sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 58, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Dioscoro, a construction worker. They are working hard to support their children who are now in college, because they know that education is quite important for their children’s future and security.

Teresita operates a variety store adjacent to their house. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Teresita earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also earn extra income from a direct sales business like AVON.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a Php 21,000 loan to buy additional grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. The loan will also ensure extra capital for her direct selling business, and she can offer more AVON products to her old and new customers. This will bring forth added income for the family and will improve their living conditions.

Teresita dreams of expanding her business, possibly to a mini-grocery store. In this way she can give her children a good future and help them attain their dreams. She does not only hope for material things for her children, but most importantly she wants them to serve God and get involved in church ministry. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share her hopes and aspirations regarding her family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
For the past five years Helen, a 41-year-old married mother of three, has earned a living by operating a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.

Helen has requested a loan of PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs as she works tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Goshi's Group

texts.en:
Goshi is married and her husband is a butcher by profession. He sells red meat (goats) to his customers through his shop. He is very honest with his customers and sells good quality meat at reasonable rates. 
Goshi is a housewife who stays at home to perform her household responsibilities. She is a very responsible person who does her work with great dedication. She has five children, two of whom work while the others are under four years old and haven’t started their education yet. 
Goshi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats in order to sell their meat through his shop and increase his sales. He has been operating his business for the past 12 years and is well known for his good service. Goshi is confident that, after the loan investment, her husband’s business will grow better.

loans.use: to buy goats for her husband's butcher shop business.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 45 years old, married, and has one child who is currently going to school. For the past five years, Monina has been raising pigs in the Philippines.

Having previously received and repaid 10 loans from NWTF, she is now requesting a PHP 22500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Monina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Reame

texts.en: Reame, who is married and has had a food production and vending business in the Philippines for the past two years, works hard to support her family. Reame has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business and would like to save money to expand it in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en:
Tserendolgor is 47 years old and lives with her children in a ger, Mongolian yurt in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She is widowed and a single mother. Her one child is a college student, another one works at Ulaanbaatar city and the other one is a student at the local job training center. Her children also work during the summer time and help with the business.

Tserendolgor started her business in 2002 by selling meat at the local market. She has 9 years of meat-selling experience. She also has many regular suppliers and consumers. Now the demand for meat is increasing due to the rising prices and season. She took two previous loans from XacBank and used the loans to successfully expand her business. She plans to develop her business in the future. Tserendolgor is a diligent and hardworking woman who says "I want to create and build a good life for me and for my children. This is my goal." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat from the countryside and to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: to purchase more meat from the countryside

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 52 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alita has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Alita is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, 44, lives in the village of Andabuen. This area is characterized by agriculture and cattle raising.

For several years Edna has sold basic supplies (milk, rice, oil, sugar, coffee, tuna, etc.) and beverages. For the past three years, she has operated her business from her own home for her convenience and security. She tries, with the profits obtained from store sales, to meet all of her household expenses as well as raise her family’s standard of living.

In order to expand her business, she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more merchandise to stock her store. Her goal is to see her business grow and to have the necessary items to offer her customers. 

Edna is a responsible, dedicated and hardworking person who is dedicated to providing more advantages and future opportunities to her children.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, oil, sugar and coffee for her store

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en: Tserendolgor is 40 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband helps the family business during his work off-season. Her eldest son works in Ulaanbaatar city, and two other children are high school students. Her youngest son attends kindergarten. She started her business in 2004 by selling hot meals and foods at the local train station. She purchased a small cart with a loan she took from XacBank in March 2011. She sells foods and drinks that equal from 30,000 (Mongolian tugriks) MNT to 40,000 MNT. She sells her hot meals during the times when the international train passes. She says that, "The local train station is under construction and if the commercial space rent is reasonable, I plan to rent one of them and sell foods and drinks." She plans to expand her business. She is requesting a 725,000 MNT loan to purchase a refrigerator and TV for her daughter who is just married.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and TV.

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en: Amarjargal is 49 years old and lives with her children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her daughters work at local companies. Amarjargal operates a clothes trading business. She sells her clothes by visiting offices and business companies. Starting from March 2011, she rented a commercial space at the local market and sells clothes from there. She is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to buy more clothes and to expand her business activity and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Alima

texts.ru: Алиме 46 лет. Она имеет одну дочь, а также является опекуном дочери своей старшей сестры. Будучи единственным кормильцем для детей, в поисках средств к существованию, в 1995 году Алима решает  начать собственный бизнес в торговле продуктами повседневного спроса со стартовым капиталом в сумме 2,000 сом (KGS).  Сегодня магазин Алимы, приносящий прибыль около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, известен своими умеренными ценами на продукты, а также «самсами» - печеными пирожками с начинкой, которые она делает сама. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алима обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для увеличения ассортимента товаров. В будущем, Алима планирует увеличить количество клиентов магазина  и повысить доходы от продаж.
texts.en: Alima is 46 years old.  She has one daughter and is also a guardian for her older sister's daughter.  Being the sole provider for the children and having to find sources for survival, Alima decided to start her own business of selling products of everyday demand in 1995 with a starting capital of 2,000 som (KGS).  Today, Alima's store yields a profit of about 15,000 som (KGS) per month and is famous for its affordable prices and also for samosas - baked stuffed pastries that she makes herself.  In order to further develop her business, Alima requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her assortment of products.  In the future, Alima plans to increase the number of store customers and increase the sales income.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Toleujan

texts.en:
Toleujan is 34 years old and lives with his children and wife in a house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His children are high school students. He started his business in 1995 by transporting goods and products. Now he transports coal from the Hotgor coal mine. With his business profits, he purchased a small car his family. During the summer time, when coal transportation is slow, he becomes a taxi driver. 

He is a diligent and hard-working man who says, "I want to build a prosperous life for my children and family." He is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase spare parts for his truck and increase his turnover capital.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Wellington

texts.en:
Wellington is 60 years old, married, and a father of six children aged between three and 29. Wellington is a vegetable farmer and also a water vendor in Rabai, Mariakani. Wellington’s business has been in operation for eight years and is doing well. 

This marks his second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase water tanks and pipes for his business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business. His dream is to become a very successful businessman and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase water tanks and pipes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hardware items to sell.

loans.name: Khalida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Khalida Parveen is a 47-year-old uneducated lady. She was not able to get an education due to the poor financial condition of her family. She learned how to carry out household responsibilities from her mother and now performs her job as a housewife very well.  
Khalida's husband is involved in a fruit-selling business. He sells fruits by visiting different areas of the city  on his bicycle, and in this way he generates income for the family. 
Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy fruits and vegetables to diversify his products so he earns better profits and reaches the maximum number of customers. Khalida is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband's business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 44 years. He is married to Mildred and they have four children. He has been a landlord for the last 16 years, making a monthly profit of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He has been loaned KES 20,000 with which he plans to renovate his rental houses.

With the anticipated profit made, he plans to purchase another plot to build more rental houses, and also plans to educate his children.

He hopes to expand in the near future and build flats for rental.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of central Kenya, where he has been doing farming for 17 years. He is aged 33. He is married with four children aged between 11 and 8 years; the first two are already schooling. His farm produces beans, bananas and milk, which goes to the local market.

Kenneth has made a fifth loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase irrigation equipment like water pipes and a tank, as well as pesticides for his banana plantation. He says it will help improve his production and make his income from the farming business more consistent and help him educate his children.

He is lamenting the high costs of farm inputs, especially pesticides. He remains happy with Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To purchase irrigation pipes and a water tank.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 42 years old and lives in Quirino Cordon. She is married and has three children. 

Maribel has been operating her general store for almost 15 years. From the business she manages, she is able to earn about P18,000 a month because her store is near a highway where sometimes passenger buses and vans stop. She sells products such as bottled mineral water, soft drinks, snack foods, and biscuits. With the profits from selling her products, she is able to cover all her household expenses.

In order to continue improving her business, she is applying for a loan of P35,000 to buy more merchandise such as soft drinks, bottled mineral water, assorted biscuits, and snack foods for her general store. Her only wish is for her business to grow and to have an inventory of products to offer to her customers. She is hoping that she could save some funds to support her children in their studies until they finish their college-level education. According to her, she could make all these things a reality through her patience and hard work in maintaining her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, bottled mineral water, assorted biscuits, and snack foods for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for his child

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Rufat

texts.ru:
Rufat jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Rufat rodilsya v 1988 qodu. 
On uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya prodajey raznix texnicheskix tovarov ( adaptori dlya telefonov, naushniki, flash karti i t.d). Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit tovari dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Rufat is married and one child.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  Rufat was born in 1988.  He has been involved in sales of various technology goods (phone adapters, headphones, flash cards, etc.) for two years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy merchandise for resale and to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel lives comfortably in Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan with his wife and children. The couple was blessed with eight children. Three of them have their own families, and five are still attending school. With his children's eagerness and interest to study, it makes him work harder to provide them with a good education. Ariel has operated his motorcycle transportation business for almost 10 years. This is what occupies his daily schedule from 8am to 5pm. He usually earns about 300 PHP each day. 

He wants to improve his services, which is why he is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP. He will use the money to pay for franchise renewal and to purchase paint and side mirrors for his motorcycle. With the help of this loan, he will continue to operate the motorcycle in good condition. He would also ensure the safety of his passengers and himself.

Ariel would like to continue to provide an education for his children. He wants them to have successful lives and to pursue their chosen careers someday.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal, buy paint and side mirrors for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married 47-year-old woman. She has four children, two are married, one in college, and one employed.

She has been working as a retailer of charcoal for one year while her husband is a farmer. With her charcoal sales business she is able to provide for the financial and daily needs of her family. Cecilia would like to increase her income because of the expenses of her child who is a college student. In this matter, she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P8,000 to be used to buy additional charcoal due to the many orders of her buyers. She is glad because she doesn't have any difficulties in selling her products due to the many consumers of charcoal. Now, there are so many consumers of charcoal because of the high price of shellane (a fuel that can be used for cooking, heating water, and refrigeration). That's why some of her neighbors and people from other villages prefer to use charcoal for cooking their food. She hopes that she could increase her profit through the continued support of financial assistance to her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is aged 37 and married. She has one 11 year old child. She lives with her family in Nkubu, Central Kenya where she has been doing mixed farming for five years. Her farming produce of wheat, maize, beans, millet and potatoes all go to the local market.

Lilian has made a loan request of 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her purchase two water tanks at 30,000 KES each. She will use the remaining 30,000 KES to purchase irrigation pipes. She says the tanks will give her water security and help to irrigate her farm. She intends to do large scale dairy farming.

Lilian says farmers in the area are limited by financial contraints.

loans.use: To purchase water tanks and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children. He has owned a coffee shop since 2008. People from different areas and villages pass by his shop to enjoy their time and relax benefiting from his delicious coffee and snacks. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase provisions and supplies needed. He is positive and plans to further expand his business. He hopes to open a new branch of his shop in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase provisions and supplies needed for his cafe.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and married. She has five children. She runs a tailoring business in Kilifi. She has been in the tailoring business for the last six years. Her business is faring well, helping her to support her family.

This is Josephine's third loan in KADET. She has repaid her previous loans successfully. This loan will help her purchase a sewing machine and clothing material for her business. Anticipated profits will help her repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамире 56 лет, замужем и воспитала 6 детей. Дамира  с супругом начали свой бизнес в животноводстве в 2001 году, вложив в качестве стартового капитала 8,000 сом (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве Дамиры, приносящее около 12,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячно, насчитывается 4 коровы, 18 овец и 3 лошади. По выходным дням, Дамира вместе с супругом выезжают на скотный рынок Кадыр-Ата, где перепродают откормленный скот. Также, Дамира имеет точку общественного питания на скотном рынке, где по воскресениям занимается продажей еды. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Дамира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм. В будущем, Дамира мечтает купить машину для своей семьи.
texts.en: Damira is 56 years old, married and raised six children.  Damira and her husband started their own animal husbandry business with a starting capital investment of 8,000 som (KGS) in 2001.  Today, Damira's business yields about 12,000 som (KGS) per month and has 4 cows, 18 sheep and 3 horses.  On weekends, Damira and her husband go to the Kadyr-Ata livestock market, where they resell raised livestock.  She also has a retail outlet at the livestock market, where she sells food on Sundays.  In order to further develop her business, Damira requested a loan in the sum of 135,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up.  In the future, she dreams of buying a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is aged 27 and has been involved in mixed farming for 5 years, producing vegetables, eggs and timber for the local market. She is married and has 4 children, all in schooling.

Hellen has made a third loan request, with Juhudi Kilimo, for a loan of 100,000 KES. With the loan, she will purchase a power saw for her lumbering business and poultry birds to boost her poultry farming business. She says she will also use the income to buy dairy a cow for her dairy farming business too. She adds that previous loans have uplifted her living standards and she believes the third loan will make it much better.

She notes that the high cost of feed is a challenge in farming.

loans.use: to purchase a power saw and poultry birds

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 45-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with one of her parents and two siblings. She has been working in agriculture for the past 15 years. In 2000, she purchased a piece of land where she began her own farming work. She specialized in cultivating vegetables using large plastic tents and has one part-time employee assisting her. Today, she is asking to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to install a new plastic tent at her farm. She plans to increase her business productivity and this tent allows her to better monitor her products' quality and grow more types of products throughout the year.

loans.use: to install a new plastic tent at her farm.

loans.name: Narynbek

texts.ru:
Нарынбеку 51 год, женат и имеет 5 детей. Нарынбек по специальности экономист и вел свою трудовую деятельность с 1976 года по 1992 в местном колхозе.  Широкий кругозор отца и его активная и плодотворная деятельность вдохновили детей Нарынбека на получение высшего образования:  двое из его детей – дочь Жаныл и сын Кутман стали экономистами,  еще два сына – Азамат, Жаманак и дочь Аида стали дипломированными филологами.  
В связи с распадом системы колхозов, Нарынбек решил  начать свой собственный бизнес в животноводстве.  Настойчивый и упорный Нарынбек сумел развить свое хозяйство с численностью скота  в 10 коров, 7 лошадей, 6 овец и 5 коз на сегодняшний день.  Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Нарынбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), на которые планирует закупить двух жеребцов. Доходы от кредита Нарынбек частично вложит в покупку дома, тем самым помогая дочери в приобретении собственного жилья. В будущем, Нарынбек планирует дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Narynbek is 51 years old, married and has five children.  He is an economist by profession and spent his working career from 1976 through 1992 at the local collective farm.  Their father's vision and his active and fruitful work inspired Narynbek's children to obtain a higher education.  Two of his children - daughter Janyl and son Kutman became economists, and two other sons, Azamat and Jamanak, and daughter Aida became certified linguists.  Due to the fall of the collective farm system. Narynbek decided to start his own business of animal husbandry.  Persistent and tenacious Narynbek was able to develop his business to include 10 cows, 7 horses and 5 goats today.  In order to further expand his business, Narynbek went to the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to request a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two horses.  He will invest part of the income into a purchase of a house, thus helping his daughter to buy her own place.  In the future, Narynbek plans to further increase livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase two horses

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is from Samtredia, Imereti District. He is 44 years old and lives with his family: wife – Inga, 5 year old son, 4 year old daughter and 73 year old mother (retired). The main source of the income for the family is agriculture. In particular, they grow 500 nut trees and 100 vine trees on a family-owned 0.5 hectare piece of land. Khvicha sells harvested nuts and grapes at the local market. Grapes are sold in fall and nuts are sold in late winter and early spring, as their price reaches maximum by that time. 

Khvicha has requested credit to purchase nuts. He will process and sell them, together with his harvest, in late winter/early spring for the higher price. He will get additional income, which will be used for the family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase nuts to resell.

loans.name: C 2180 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Eric is 26 years old and he is single. He owns a business boutique, selling sugar, rice, milk, Irish potatoes and bananas.

Eric is the leader of this group, which is called "TUZAMURANE" in the local language. He is the second person on the right side. Eric has been in this business for about two years and his business is open from 6 am until 11 pm every day.

Eric and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to increase their inventory of goods to sell. Eric and his team will reinvest any profits into their businesses and save for their families' futures.

loans.use: to increase their business by buying more goods to sell.

loans.name: Dufatanye Nº4 Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Augustin fait partie du groupe Dufatanye Nº4 RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « travailler ensemble ». Augustin est né au Rwanda. Il est célibataire avec 4 orphelins en charge. Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de secondaire. 

Augustin est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 


Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver peu d’espace en utilisant des engrais chimiques afin de récolter une grande quantité de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Augustin voudrait devenir le meilleur cultivateur de sa vallée et fournisseur de la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de continuer ses études et de payer les frais scolaires pour les orphelins.
texts.en: Augustin was born in Rwanda and is part of the Dufatanye Nº4 RSZ group. The name of the group means ´working together´. Augustin is single and is raising 4 orphans. He left secondary school after 3 years, and became a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use his part of the loan to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the labourers who work on his farm. He plans to grow his business by harvesting large amounts of rice from small plots of land, thanks to the use of chemical fertilizers. In the next few years, Augustin would like to become known as the best rice farmer in his valley and become the main supplier of rice in the region. He plans to use the profits from his business to pay for the orphans´ educational expenses and continue with his own education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the labourers who work on his rice farm.

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Chamroeun is 27 years old and her husband, Ny, is 27 years old. They have been married since 2008 and just have a young daughter. The family is living in a village along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chamroeun and her husband are vegetable farmers. They grow cauliflower and cucumbers on their farmland in the village. Chamroeun is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a cow to raise. She will also purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain a vegetable farm.

Photo: Chmroeun and her husband and their young daughter.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise and to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain a vegetable farm.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (in the photo) is 37 years old and her husband, Sarran, is 43 years old. They live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003 and have three sons and one daughter. Two are in school and other two are still young.  

Sophea and her husband are banana and flower farmers. She is asking for a loan of $600 to repair the house where she lives and to assist in her farming. She will be buying fertilizer and small flowers.

loans.use: to repair the house where she lives and to assist in her banana and flower farm by buying fertilizers and small flowers.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun (in the photo) is 41 years old and his wife, Vannary, is 32 years old. They have been married since 2000 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of the children are in school and the other one is still too young for school. The family lives in a village, along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Savoeun is a farmer, while his wife is a garment worker. He hopes to earn extra income to better support his family. He will be launching a new business driving a Tuk Tuk taxi, when he is free from farming. So, he has decided to apply for his first loan, in the amount of $1,200, to buy a Tuk Tuk.

loans.use: To buy a Tuk Tuk taxi to drive.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 29 years old married to Stephen. Together they have two children. Her primary business is selling charcoal and firewood, besides having a cereal shop. She has been in business for one and half years and her monthly income from the business is KES 34,000.

This is her first loan with KADET. The loan will help her stock both her businesses. Anticipated profit from the business will help her to upgrade her family`s living standard. Her dreams and hope is to enlarge her business and to ensure that her family has a better future.

loans.use: to add inventory to the business.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary (pictured with her young daughter), 36, is a weaver, while her husband, Kosal, 40, is a construction worker. They live in a village along the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1996 and have two children-one son and one daughter. One child attends school and the other one is still too young for school. 

Nary is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona lives in the village of Etseri. She is 57 years old and married. She and her husband Otar have one a 26-year-old son named Irakli.

Madona has three milk cows and a calf. On average, she produces 60 kg of cheese per month, and sells it at the local market. The family grows corn on a one-hectare plot of land they own. The feed most of the corn they grow to the cows.

Otan and Irakli are car mechanics. They purchase old, broken cars and repair them in their workshop. After repairs are finished, they sell the cars for a higher price to make a profit. The family's total average monthly income is 800 Georgian laris. 

Madona plans to use part of this loan to expand the shed where the cows are kept, and also to use part of the loan to buy an additional cow and more calves. Some of the loan will be used to buy a broken car, which will be repaired by Otar and Irakli. The family hopes to get additional income from both activities and put any extra profit they realize towards improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to expand a cattle shed

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 55 years old, married, and has two children. He lives peacefully in the province of Isabela where he plants rice as the family's primary source of income. Abraham is hardworking man. Aside from farming, Abraham manages his hog raising business, raising pigs for breeding. His desire is to expand his business premises and grow his business.

Abraham is requesting a second loan of 50,000 PHP, which he will use to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. His previous loan was invested in his business and had a positive impact. He hopes this loan will help him bring up his family with an increase of income from the business. With the business he manages, he is able to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Meah

texts.en:
Meach (in the photo) is 48 years old, and her husband, Thay, is 60 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children: four sons and one daughter. Two of the children are garment workers, one has full-time employment, one is a weaver and another one attends school. 

Meach and her husband sell nets and finished silk and cotton products. They buy them from the weavers in the village and transport them to sell in other provinces away from their house.  

The couple faces some problems and spends lots of money for traveling costs because they have to transport nets and silk and cotton products and a bicycle via taxi. When they arrive in the provinces, they use the bicycle to carry nets and silk and cotton products for sale. 

Facing this, Meach is asking for her first loan of $1,000 in order to buy a motorbike. She will use the motorbike to carry nets and silk and cotton products to sell in provinces directly, not via taxi anymore.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry nets and finished silk and cotton products for sale.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 33 years old. She is married with two children and lives in San Miguel Ramon. She describes herself as a person of character and a hardworking woman.

She has been in the livestock business for two years. She is grateful because her profit helped her to grow her income and to give her children their daily allowances and meet the daily needs of family. She would like to buy a stock of feeds to minimize her fare expenses in going to and from the market. Due to insufficient funds, she is requesting additional capital amounting to 10,000 Philippines pesos. This loan amount would really help her business grow because she could feed her raised pigs three times a day for a better price when they reach their optimum growth to be sold.

Yolanda hopes that she could earn greater profits to be able to send her eldest child into a higher level of education and save some for the preparation of schooling her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her livestock business.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy and her husband, Chanthorn, are rice and vegetable farmers. They have been married since 1993 and have two sons and one daughter in school. The family is living along National Road Number one, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanthy hopes to continue her farming business because it’s their main source of income. That’s why she is applying for another loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm. 

In the photo, Chanthy is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain their rice and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay (in the photo) is a silk weaver, while her husband, Thorn, is a house builder and does construction work. They live across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children:  three sons and two daughters.

Lay is asking for another loan of $1,100 US in order to buy a new motorbike because the one she has is old and breaks. She will also use part of the loan to continue her weaving business by purchasing silk materials.

loans.use: to buy a replacement motorbike and weaving material for her weaving business.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally and her husband Leang have been married since 1986 and have six children. One child is married and lives in a separate home; one is a garment worker; one is a construction worker; one is a weaver; and another child is in school. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phally and her husband are farmers. In addition, she weaves silk when she is free from farming.

Phally is asking for her second loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her son, the garment worker, to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son who is a garment worker to drive to work.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 49-year-old married man living with his wife and six children. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a car repair shop since 2000. His job consists of changing car wheels in addition to fixing up the ruined ones. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional materials and equipment to reinforce his business operation and further develop his work. Ahmad is sure that with the new equipment he will be able to provide his customers with high quality services.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for his business.

loans.name: Priva

texts.en:
Priva is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya, where he has produced milk and vegetables for the last five years. He is 44 years old and married with two children, aged seventeen and thirteen, who are both in school. He gets additional income from his regular employment as a teacher.

Priva has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry for his poultry business. He says that the poultry income will supplement his regular employment income. He believes his family's living standard will be uplifted significantly. He intends to save the poultry income to enable him expand his farming business by venturing into dairy farming in future.

Priva appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services and adds that they cater to small farmers' needs.

loans.use: To purchase poultry for his poultry business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 47 years old and married to Ruth. Together they have six children aged six, eight, ten, thirteen, eighteen, and twenty years. He owns a farm in Kamoiwo and keeps livestock.  He has been in operation for the past twelve years, earning a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

This is James' third loan after successfully paying back his previous loans.  He hopes to use the loan to purchase two dairy cows and animal feed. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

He dreams of improving his livestock farming and educating his children to greater heights.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows and animal feed.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
This is Lyra, 36, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Renato, a garbage truck collector, and a mother to her four children. - two of whom are already in college. She, along with her husband and children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her children’s schooling.
 
Lyra operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which has groceries, toiletries, and beverages which are sold piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them piece-by-piece. Aside from this she also sells electronic cell phone loads and raises pigs in their compound.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products that she needs for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Lyra dreams of growing her business in the coming years, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 45-year-old Lebanese married man and the father of three children. Two of his children are still attending school. He has 18 years of experience working as a farmer. In 2000, he started running his own farm where he cultivates fruits, especially peaches. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to purchase agriculturA. fertilizers to make goods grow more successfully. In the future, he plans to also cultivate vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural fertilizers to make fruits and vegetables grow more successfully

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is 27 years old and married to Moses. Together they have two children. She runs a green grocery shop in the Mathare Kasoro market where she has a good flow of customers. She has been in this business for the last two years and earns an income of 4,000 KES per month.

Josephine is applying for her first loan from KADET which she plans on using to buy more vegetables. She will use the extra profit to expand her business. She hopes to improve the living standard of her family. She is very hard-working.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Sarren

texts.en:
Sarren (in the photo) is 59 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter, who is a tailor, in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sarren is asking for a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase fabric and a sewing machine for her daughter’s tailoring business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and a sewing machine for her daughter’s tailoring business.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 44-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and eight children. He is the only income provider of his family. He has been working in the agricultural field for almost 18 years and in 2000, he started to work independently on his own farm. He grows a wide variety of vegetables using large plastic tents. His products are sold to multiple local markets. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase seeds to increase his business productivity. He will also purchase new plastic covers for the tents. In the future, he plans to further expand his business and start cultivating exotic fruits.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and plastic covers for the tents

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and four children. Three of his children are still attending school. He has been working in his town’s municipality as a police officer since 2010. He cooperates financially with his wife who works as a tailor to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his children’s school registration fees. He says that the school year is about to begin and he must pay the required amount to the school management as soon as possible so that the children can pursue their education without having any financial problems.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school registration fees

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine  is 47 years old. She has six children who are ages 3-20 years old. She sells fresh milk and she has been selling milk for the past four years. This business has enabled her to meet her family's needs. She needs a loan to buy more milk for sale in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy milk for sale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 42 years old. She is married to Martin and they are blessed with children that go to school. She sells chickens in the area of Mathare Kasoro;Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES 4,000 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to purchase more chicken. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. She hopes to expand her business. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Kobiljon

texts.ru: Кобилчон поле окончание института не смог устроится на работу по специальности. Он начал заниматься услугами таксиста по местным городам.  Более 3 лет он успешно работает в данном бизнесе. В этом году он женился и тратил все свои сбережения на свадьбу, теперь он хочет обновить свою машину для работы в зимний период. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 12500 Сомони. Он заранее благодарен всем кредиторам за их поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Kobiljon could not find work in his profession after he had graduated from college. He started to provide taxi services around the local towns. He has been working in this business successfully for three years. This year he got married and spent all his savings on the wedding and now wants to upgrade his car for the work during the winter months. Kobiljon is asking for a loan with this purpose in the amount of $12,500 somoni. He is grateful in advance to all the lenders for their support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy and repair a car.

loans.name: Atef

texts.en: Atef is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-age children. He has been working as a driver on a farm specializing in transporting sold animal feed to other farms located in neighboring villages. He is the main income source of the family. With his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to pay his children’s school fees. Atef’s only purpose is to insure his children's high academic standards.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 24-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a car repair shop since 2009. His job consists of painting and repainting the cars. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1500 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase required tools and materials. He hopes that with the new equipment he will be able to meet his business needs and attract customers. In the future, he hopes to enlarge his shop and start repairing cars from the inside and the outside.

loans.use: to purchase required tools and materials

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a businesswoman aged 33. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last five years, she has been selling plastic plates, bags and sandals to earn a living. She works hard in her business to provide for her family.  

In the next five years, she wants to operate a wholesale business. Her dream is to buy a piece of land. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy sandals and utensils.

loans.use: To buy sandals and utensils.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is 50 years old and is married to Eunice, a primary school teacher. Together they have three children.  Noah owns a retail shop in Kapkangani trading center. He has been in the business for the past 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This is his third term loan. He successfully repaid the previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan to buy more stock for the shop like sugar, wheat flour, a carton of bar soap and soft drinks for sale. 


The profits will be used to enlarge his business. Noah's dreams are to prosper in business and have a stable income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock like, sugar, wheat flour, bar soap, and softdrinks

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He has been in active farming for 8 years and currently employs two farmhands. Peter is age 36 and married with two children who are ages 3 and 8. His farm produces milk, pineapple and tea for the local market. He laments of poor markets for the farm produce.

Peter has requested for a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for a transport business. He says the transport business will improve his family's living standards since his income will be better as he makes deliveries to the market more cheaply.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Shafi

texts.ru:
Shafi yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Shafi 41 qod. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. UJe 12 let kak Shafi zanimayetysa skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Shafi is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  Shafi is 41 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cows and expand his business.  Shafi has been involved in animal husbandry for 12 years and breeds cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows and expand his business

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been through senior high school.

Esi sells charcoal at Abura and has done so for 4 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Esi will use the loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Esi plans to plow back her new increase in income.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a business man. Age 28, he is married and blessed with one child. For the last ten years, he has been operating a business of selling scrap metals to make a living. The scrap metals are later used to make energy-saving cookers, pans and cooking pots.

Joseph is requesting for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy scrap metals. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. His dream is to buy a plot.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Nzisa

texts.en:
Nzisa is a 28 year old single woman. For the last six years she has been manufacturing and selling yogurt in Emali town. 

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to buy milk for manufacturing yogurt. In the future Nzisa hopes her to expand her business and supply yogurt in the whole country.

loans.use: to buy milk for manufacturing yogurt.
