loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua has 5 children and is married to a mason. She has been through junior high. Efua cooks wakye for sale at Abura and has done so for 8 years. She uses her income to support her husband in educating, feeding and clothing her children.

Efua will use the loan to procure rice, oil, beans and other supplies. With the new profits from her extended business, Efua plans to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: to procure rice, oil, beans and other supplies

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 27 years old and married. She has two children who are ages three and nine years old. Everline owns a phone accessories shop in Kapsabet town and has been in the business for the past nine years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

This is her second loan. She successfully repaid the previous. The loan amount will be used to purchase all kinds of phone accessories needed for her shop. The profits will be put back into the business to purchase more stock. Her dream is to be self-sustainable and grow in her business.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a business man and is age 54. He is married and blessed with ten children. For over 25 years, he has been managing a business of selling charcoal to earn a living. He has retained his business because of his good reputation with his customers. He expresses thanks to Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care.

In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. His dream is buy a plot. He is requesting for a loan of 90,000 Kenya shillings to buy charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Karagul

texts.ru: Карагулу – 79 лет, пенсионер. Карагул , отдавший 49 лет преподаванию географии в местной школе, является Отличником Образования Кыргызской Республики и известен как человек принципиальный, целеустремленный и ответственный. В 1992 году, в целях изыскания дополнительных средств к существованию для своей большой семьи, Карагул начал бизнес в животноводстве. Начав со стартового капитала в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) , Карагул сумел превратить свою ферму в преуспевающее хозяйство, поголовье которого состоит из 2 лошадей, 15 овец, 5 коз и одной коровы. Благодаря прибыли от ведения хозяйства, Карагул смог помочь своим детям обзавестись собственным жильем. На сегодняшний день, Карагул имеет прибыль от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов в сумме  15,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячно.  В целях дальнейшего развития  своего бизнеса, Карагул обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят. Прибыль Карагул планирует использовать на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Karalgul is seventy-nine and retired after forty-nine years teaching high school geography and becoming a Kyrgyz Republic "Outstanding Achiever in Education." He is known as a principled, driven, and responsible man. 

In 1992, in pursuit of additional means to support his large family, Karagul started a livestock business. With 45,000KGS in initial capital, he managed to turn his farm into a successful establishment with two horses, fifteen sheep, five goats, and a cow. Thanks to profits from managing the business, Karagul was able to help his children get their own houses. Nowadays, Karagul has income from selling milk and meat products on the order of 15,000KGS per month. 

Karagul has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000KGS to buy two calves so he can increase his earnings, which he plans to use to do repairs on his house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is married and has 8 children. She sells kenkey at Abura. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the home. 

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more maize to enable her to make a large quantity of kenkey for distribution. With the new earnings from her extended business, Adjoa plans to save towards the university education of her children. Her left hand is placed on the pan with the soaked maize that will be milled into dough for the kenkey.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to make a large quantity of kenkey for distribution

loans.name: Akhmadjon

texts.ru: Ахмаджон женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он умный и целеустремленный человек. Ахмаджон по профессии является таксистам и одновременно занимается купля продажей полиэтиленовыми (одноразовыми) пакетами. Более 8 лет он самостоятельно привозит товар из других рынка городов Таджикистана, а потом продает на местном рынке.  Его супруга домохозяйка, и она присматривать за своими детьми. Ахмаджон хотел бы получить займ в размере 2600$ США для расширения бизнеса и пополнения оборотного капитала. Он очень надеется, что Кива и Кива кредиторы будут поддерживать его.
texts.en: Akhmadjon is married and is a loving father of three children. He is a smart and purposeful man. Akhmadjon is a taxi driver and also buys and sells single use plastic bags. He has been bringing in the product himself from other town markets of Tajikistan for more than eight years and then selling it on the local market. His wife is a homemaker and she looks after the children. Akhmadjon wants to get a loan in the amount of $2,600USD to expand his business and increase the working capital. He is very hopeful that Kiva and its lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
This is Benilda, 46, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Edward, a maintenance staff member, and mother to her children. By the grace of God, She has managed to support her child's schooling. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Benilda operates a perfume business. What she basically does is buy perfume from wholesalers, sell them with a profit to her contact and customers. She also retail electronic cell phone loads for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php38, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of perfume products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Benilda dreams to expand her knowledge in doing business and also to be able to give her child a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for perfume products needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has no children. 

Hussein has been an owner of a barber shop since 2005. He has more than 10 years experience and he has a deep understanding of local consumer and he has a good reputation and he is well known in his area. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.


He decided to apply for a $1500 loan to make digital ads and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make digital ads and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is shown above with some Fante kenkey, or fermented corn dough, for sale at Essiam near Abura. She is a widow and responsible for paying for the utility bills and for her accommodations. 

Her loan will be used to buy more bags of corn to prepare the Fante kenkey. She hopes to use the new profit from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more bags of corn to prepare Fante kenkey, or fermented corn dough.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a fifty-year-old businesswoman. She is single and blessed with four children who are still in school. 

For the last ten years, she has been selling clothing to earn a living. She also practices dairy farming for more income. 

Lucy has managed to grow her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy dresses.

loans.use: To buy dresses to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more birds for her poultry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama makes palm oil in Abura to sell. She is single but has ten dependents that she is taking care of. The demands of her dependents keep increasing, so she needs a loan to expand her business to be abe to take care of their needs. The loan will be used to buy palm fruit to process into oil to sell. Ama hopes to reinvest the new profit for further growth of the business.

She washes the palm fruit and boils them until they become soft and tender. She scoops the cooked fruit into a big mortar and gently pounds with a pestle to avoid damaging the nut. Water is then added to the pounded fruit. The mixture of water and the pounded fruit is squeezed and filtered to get the juice out and the chaff removed. The chaff is sometimes used by the local people to light charcoal fires. The juice is boiled again, and as it boils, the fresh oil will float to the surface of the pot. The oil is scooped into yet another pot and left to cool. 

Fresh oil from palm fruit is traditionally used in eating roasted yam or plantains in Africa – especially on the farms after a hard day's work. Palm oil is the preferred type of cooking oil because Ghanaians like its consistency and flavor. It is used in most traditional dishes.

loans.use: to buy palm fruit to process into oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase toys to sell

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32-years-old, married and has three children.

Houssam has owned a shop since 2007, selling women's, men's and kid’s shoes. He has more than three years experience and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His shop is located in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1800 loan in order to make a sliding door, showcases and digital ads. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a sliding door, showcases and digital ads.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is from the village of Tskhratskaro. He is 39 years old and lives in the village with his family: his wife Nestan, his two sons (13 and 11 years old), and his mother. His children are in school, and his wife is a teacher in a local school. 

Badri is leading the agricultural business of the family. They own two cows and one calf. Badri and Nestan sell dairy products at the local open market. Also they own 0.8 hectares of land with a hundred wine trees. Grapes are sold seasonally. Along with this, the family has a small poultry farm with fifty hens. Eggs are sold on the local open market as well. The total average monthly income for the family is 800 Georgian laris, including Nestan's monthly salary. 

With the requested credit, Badri plans to cultivate an unused part of the family's land and plant additional vine-trees. In the future, he will harvest more grapes and earn more from sales. He will use the increase in income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and plant vine-trees.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua has four children. She sells corn, fresh peanuts, and Fante kenkey (or fermented corn dough) in Abura, which she has done for seven years. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase corn to make kenkey to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest the profit.

loans.use: to purchase corn to make kenkey, or fermented corn dough, to sell.

loans.name: Pharis

texts.en:
Pharis is a businessman who is 29 years old. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last two years, he has been managing a boutique to earn a living. 

Pharis has worked hard to grow his business.  He is also grateful for the financial support from Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. His dream is to manage a supermarket. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes and make-up.

loans.use: To buy clothes and make-up for his boutique.

loans.name: Mekhriban

texts.ru:
Mekhriban rodilas v 1980 qodu. Ona zamujem i iemeyet 1 rebonka. Mekhriban yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 
Uje 3 qoda kak ona zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. Seychas Mekhriban nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya uvelciheniya kolichestya dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Mekhriban was born in 1980.  She is married and has one child.  Mekhriban is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with her family.  She has been involved in poultry farming for three years and breeds chickens.  Currently, Mekhriban needs 2000 AZN to buy chickens for increasing quantities for sale.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Seif

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26-years-old, single and lives with six family members; three of them work.

Seif has been an owner of a grocery since 2009 and sells all kind of fruits and vegetables. He worked with his father for two years in this field so he gained a good experience. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His shop is located in an area where they are in need for foodstuffs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the area.


He is requesting a $2400 loan in order to make a sliding door, purchase a refrigerator and an electric generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a sliding door, purchase a refrigerator and an electric generator.

loans.name: Aychamol

texts.ru: Айчамол жительница Шахритуского района. Ей 54 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее муж и дети находятся в Российской Феерации. Сама Айчамол более шести лет занимается торговлей. Она в основном сеет чеснок для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Aychamol lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 54 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband and children are in the Russian Federation.  Aychamol has been involved in sales for over six years.  She primarily sows garlic for sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: to buy seeds for sowing garlic, mineral fertilizers and fuel for a tractor

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a hardworking businessman age 31. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last 10 years, he has been running a cafeteria to make a living. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. In the next five years, he wants to open other outlets of his business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cooking fat, chicken and utensils. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, chicken and utensils
